CALIPSO Spies Polar Stratospheric Clouds.title: CALIPSO Spies Polar Stratospheric Clouds
CALIPSO Spies Polar Stratospheric Clouds.caption_short: Also known as nacreous clouds, they play an important role in the depletion of stratospheric ozone.

Fires in Perth, Australia.title: Fires in Perth, Australia
Fires in Perth, Australia.caption_short: Two large wildfires burn in the tree-covered hills east of Perth, Australia, in this true-color image from February 6, 2011.

Snowy Dallas.title: Snowy Dallas
Snowy Dallas.caption_short: Clear skies allowed the MODIS instrument on NASA’s Terra satellite to capture this view of snow over Dallas, Texas, on February 6, 2011, as the city hosted the Super Bowl.

Heavy Rains in Sri Lanka.title: Heavy Rains in Sri Lanka
Heavy Rains in Sri Lanka.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall amounts over Sri Lanka and the Bay of Bengal January 3–9, 2011.

Record Low Arctic Sea Ice Extent for Jan.title: Record Low Arctic Sea Ice Extent for January
Record Low Arctic Sea Ice Extent for Jan.caption_short: This image shows average Arctic sea ice concentration for January 2011, the lowest January extent in the satellite record.

Dust Plumes off Mexico.title: Dust Plumes off Mexico
Dust Plumes off Mexico.caption_short: Acquired February 3, 2011, this natural-color image shows dust plumes blowing off Mexico.

Sediment along the Queensland Coast.title: Sediment along the Queensland Coast
Sediment along the Queensland Coast.caption_short: Acquired February 5, 2011, this natural-color image shows sediment suspended along the Queensland coast, near the city of Townsville.

Durrat Al Bahrain, Persian Gulf.title: Durrat Al Bahrain, Persian Gulf
Durrat Al Bahrain, Persian Gulf.caption_short: At the southern end of Bahrain Island, at the furthest point from the cities of the kingdom, a new complex of 14 artificial islands has risen out of the sea.

Ubinas Volcano, Peru.title: Ubinas Volcano, Peru
Ubinas Volcano, Peru.caption_short: Free of vegetation, the gray and white lava-covered peak of the Ubinas Volcano looks like it could be on the Moon or some other extraterrestrial body in this detailed true-color image from July 24, 2010.

Landslides in Brazil.title: Landslides in Brazil
Landslides in Brazil.caption_short: After weeks of cloud cover, the ASTER instrument on Terra satellite collected this image of the mudslide-riven Serrana region of Brazil on January 18, 2011.

Shinmoe-dake Volcano Erupts on Kyushu.title: Shinmoe-dake Volcano Erupts on Kyushu
Shinmoe-dake Volcano Erupts on Kyushu.caption_short: On the morning of January 26, 2011, Shinmoe-dake, a volcano on Japan’s Kyushu island, erupted spectacularly.

Sediment over the Great Barrier Reef.title: Sediment over the Great Barrier Reef
Sediment over the Great Barrier Reef.caption_short: Streaks of brilliant blue water over Australia’s Great Barrier Reef in this true-color image reveals some of Cyclone Yasi’s impact on the ocean.

Tropical Cyclone Yasi.title: Tropical Cyclone Yasi
Tropical Cyclone Yasi.caption_short: Acquired January 30, 2011, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Yasi over the southern Pacific Ocean.

Rainfall from Tropical Cyclone Yasi.title: Rainfall from Tropical Cyclone Yasi
Rainfall from Tropical Cyclone Yasi.caption_short: This color-coded map shows rainfall amounts associated with Tropical Cyclone Yasi from January 28 to February 3, 2011.

Historic Winter Storm Moves Across the U.title: Historic Winter Storm Moves Across the U.S.
Historic Winter Storm Moves Across the U.caption_short: Snow covers the ground in a solid swath from eastern Arizona to the edge of a massive winter storm in Indiana and Michigan in these images from February 2, 2011.

Ozone Hole through the years.title: Ozone Hole through the years
Ozone Hole through the years.caption_short: This series of images shows the Antarctic ozone hole on the day of its maximum depletion in 1979, 1987, 2006, and 2010; that is, the days with the thinnest ozone layer.

Fires in the Southeastern United States.title: Fires in the Southeastern United States

Heavy Rains across Malaysia.title: Heavy Rains across Malaysia
Heavy Rains across Malaysia.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall amounts over Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines January 24–30, 2011.

Fires in Oklahoma.title: Fires in Oklahoma
Fires in Oklahoma.caption_short: A cluster of fires burns in eastern Oklahoma in this photo-like image taken on January 29, 2011.

Bras&iacute;\u00adlia at Night.title: Brasí­lia at Night
Bras&iacute;\u00adlia at Night.caption_short: The developed areas of Brasília and its satellite cities are clearly outlined by street grids and highway lights in this astronaut photograph taken from the International Space Station.

Receding Flood Waters around Rockhampton.title: Receding Flood Waters around Rockhampton, Queensland
Receding Flood Waters around Rockhampton.caption_short: Acquired January 9 and 25, 2011, these natural-color images she flood waters slowly receding in the city of Rockhampton, Queensland, Australia.

Bloom in the Ross Sea.title: Bloom in the Ross Sea
Bloom in the Ross Sea.caption_short: This true-color image captures a Ross Sea phytoplankton bloom on January 22, 2011, as viewed by the MODIS instrument on NASA’s Aqua satellite.

Tropical Cyclone Bianca.title: Tropical Cyclone Bianca
Tropical Cyclone Bianca.caption_short: Acquired January 27, 2011, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Bianca off the coast of Western Australia.

A Day of Night-Shining Clouds.title: A Day of Night-Shining Clouds
A Day of Night-Shining Clouds.caption_short: High-altitude night-shining clouds form and dissipate on a daily cycle revealed in this series of images made from data from the Ozone Monitoring Instrument on NASA’s Aura satellite.

Night-Shining Clouds are Getting Brighte.title: Night-Shining Clouds are Getting Brighter
Night-Shining Clouds are Getting Brighte.caption_short: The rare night-shining clouds seen in this photo are both forming more frequently and becoming brighter, trends that point to changes in the atmosphere linked to greenhouse gases.

Tropical Cyclone Wilma.title: Tropical Cyclone Wilma
Tropical Cyclone Wilma.caption_short: Acquired January 26, 2011, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Wilma over the Pacific Ocean.

Arctic Oscillation Chills North America,.title: Arctic Oscillation Chills North America, Warms Arctic
Arctic Oscillation Chills North America,.caption_short: This color-coded map shows temperature anomalies for the United States, Canada, eastern Siberia, and Greenland for January 9 to 16, 2011.

Ice Covers Lake Baikal.title: Ice Covers Lake Baikal
Ice Covers Lake Baikal.caption_short: Accessed January 24, 2011, this natural-color image shows ice coating Lake Baikal.

Fires in Cambodia.title: Fires in Cambodia
Fires in Cambodia.caption_short: An arc of hundreds of individual fires wraps around the northern part of Cambodia, north of the Tônl&eacute Sab lake, on February 9, 2009.

Onekotan Island, Kuril Islands, Russian.title: Onekotan Island, Kuril Islands, Russian Federation
Onekotan Island, Kuril Islands, Russian.caption_short: Snow cover highlights the calderas and volcanic cones that form the northern and southern ends of Onekotan Island, part of the Kuril Island arc.

A Clear View of the Alps.title: A Clear View of the Alps
A Clear View of the Alps.caption_short: Acquired January 17, 2011, this natural-color image provides an uninterrupted view of the Alps.

Mud Volcano Emerges from the Arabian Sea.title: Mud Volcano Emerges from the Arabian Sea
Mud Volcano Emerges from the Arabian Sea.caption_short: The tiny island shown in this image from January 11, 2011, is a mud volcano, newly emerged from the Arabian Sea.

Haze over India and Bangladesh.title: Haze over India and Bangladesh
Haze over India and Bangladesh.caption_short: Thick haze lingered along the southern face of the Himalaya in late December 2008.

Flooding in the Australian Interior.title: Flooding in the Australian Interior
Flooding in the Australian Interior.caption_short: Floods continued to spread across the interior of Australia in late January 2011, with high waters apparent in Queensland, New South Wales, and South Australia.

St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands.title: St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands
St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands.caption_short: Acquired June 24, 2007, this natural-color image shows the eastern half of St. John Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands. The area pictured incorporates a national park and national monument.

Heavy Rains in Philippines.title: Heavy Rains in Philippines
Heavy Rains in Philippines.caption_short: This analysis shows rainfall estimates for Manila and the surrounding region from September 21 to 27, 2009. The heaviest rainfall amounts appear in blue and the lightest amounts appear in pale green. Gray shading indicates topography.

Flooding in Victoria.title: Flooding in Victoria
Flooding in Victoria.caption_short: Acquired January 19, 2011, and January 20, 2010, these false-color images show parts of New South Wales and Victoria before and after flooding struck the region in 2011.

Channel Beneath Pine Island Glacier.title: Channel Beneath Pine Island Glacier
Channel Beneath Pine Island Glacier.caption_short: Scientists discovered a deepwater channel that could funnel warm water to the glacier's underbelly and melt it from below.

Flooding in Brisbane Suburbs.title: Flooding in Brisbane Suburbs
Flooding in Brisbane Suburbs.caption_short: Acquired January 13, 2011 by astronauts aboard the ISS, this photograph shows extensive flooding in the Brisbane suburb of Rocklea.

Cyclone Zelia.title: Cyclone Zelia
Cyclone Zelia.caption_short: Cyclone Zelia was nearing its peak strength when this photo-like image was taken at 10 a.m. (00:00 UTC) on January 16, 2011.

North Col of Mount Everest.title: North Col of Mount Everest
North Col of Mount Everest.caption_short: This astronaut photograph highlights the northern approach to the world’s tallest mountain.

Northwestern Algeria.title: Northwestern Algeria
Northwestern Algeria.caption_short: Acquired December 17, 2010, this natural-color image shows hills, rivers, and cultivated fields in northwestern Algeria.

Rains Water Australian Interior.title: Rains Water Australian Interior
Rains Water Australian Interior.caption_short: Acquired January 14, 2011, and December 29, 2010, these false-color images show changes to Australia’s interior caused by heavy rains.

Rare Snow in the U.S. South.title: Rare Snow in the U.S. South
Rare Snow in the U.S. South.caption_short: A swath of white marks the track of a rare winter snow storm across the U.S. South in this photo-like image from January 12, 2011.

Different Records, Same Warming Trend.title: Different Records, Same Warming Trend
Different Records, Same Warming Trend.caption_short: Four independent records are unequivocal: the world has warmed since 1880, and the past decade has been the warmest on record.

Winter Storm along the U.S. East Coast.title: Winter Storm along the U.S. East Coast
Winter Storm along the U.S. East Coast.caption_short: The storm that hammered New England on January 12, 2011, is a classic, comma shaped Nor’easter, as shown in this photo-like image.

Dust across Central Africa.title: Dust across Central Africa
Dust across Central Africa.caption_short: Acquired January 9, 2011, this natural-color image shows dust from the southern Sahara blowing across central Africa.

Heavy Rains in Queensland.title: Heavy Rains in Queensland
Heavy Rains in Queensland.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall amounts in Queensland from December 20 to December 26, 2010. The heaviest rain falls along Queensland’s northeastern coast.

Sediment Transforms Lake Michigan.title: Sediment Transforms Lake Michigan
Sediment Transforms Lake Michigan.caption_short: Acquired December 17, 2010, and December 10, 2010, these natural-color images show suspended sediments changing the appearance of Lake Michigan.

Montreal at Night.title: Montreal at Night
Montreal at Night.caption_short: Montreal, the largest city in the mostly French-speaking Province of Quebec, is considered by some to be the cultural capital of Canada.

Anyuyskiy Volcano.title: Anyuyskiy Volcano
Anyuyskiy Volcano.caption_short: Using data acquired September 13, 2002, this 3-D visualization shows an old lahar (avalanche of volcanic mud) extending from Anyuyskiy Volcano in far eastern Russia.

Flooding in Rockhampton, Queensland.title: Flooding in Rockhampton, Queensland
Flooding in Rockhampton, Queensland.caption_short: Though water levels had started to subside, the Australian city of Rockhampton was still inundated when this image was taken on January 7, 2011.

Lining Up the Sun, Moon, and ISS.title: Lining Up the Sun, Moon, and ISS
Lining Up the Sun, Moon, and ISS.caption_short: While the Moon was busy passing between the Sun and Earth for an eclipse in 2011, the space station made a cameo.

Floods Spread to New South Wales.title: Floods Spread to New South Wales
Floods Spread to New South Wales.caption_short: Acquired January 6, 2011, and December 12, 2010, these false-color images show the area around Goodooga, the first New South Wales community to be affected by Queensland flood waters moving south.

Heavy Rains in the Philippines.title: Heavy Rains in the Philippines
Heavy Rains in the Philippines.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall amounts over the Philippines December 30, 2010–January 5, 2011. The heaviest rainfall is concentrated along the eastern coasts, southeast of Manila.

Heavy Sediment along the Queensland Coas.title: Heavy Sediment along the Queensland Coast
Heavy Sediment along the Queensland Coas.caption_short: Acquired January 4, 2011, this natural-color image shows heavy sediment runoff around Cape Bowling Green, Queensland.

Flooding around Rockhampton, Queensland.title: Flooding around Rockhampton, Queensland
Flooding around Rockhampton, Queensland.caption_short: Acquired January 5, 2011, this false-color image shows flooding along the Fitzroy River, around the city of Rockhampton, Queensland.

Harratt Lunayyir.title: Harratt Lunayyir
Harratt Lunayyir.caption_short: In northwestern Saudi Arabia lies a field of volcanic lava that contains some 50 cones from the past 10,000 years.

Auroral Rocket in Norway.title: Auroral Rocket in Norway
Auroral Rocket in Norway.caption_short: Photographers captured these digital photos of a four-stage Black Brant XII sounding rocket and the aurora borealis on December 12, 2010, during the NASA-funded Rocket Experiment for Neutral Upwelling (RENU).

Tidal Flats and Channels, Long Island, B.title: Tidal Flats and Channels, Long Island, Bahamas
Tidal Flats and Channels, Long Island, B.caption_short: The islands are situated on large depositional platforms composed mainly of carbonate sediments and ringed by reefs.

Icebergs along Princess Ragnhild Coast,.title: Icebergs along Princess Ragnhild Coast, Antarctica
Icebergs along Princess Ragnhild Coast,.caption_short: Acquired December 13, 2010, this natural-color image shows smooth- and rough-surfaced icebergs casting long shadows along the Antarctic coast.

Stirring Up a Bloom off Patagonia.title: Stirring Up a Bloom off Patagonia
Stirring Up a Bloom off Patagonia.caption_short: The MODIS instrument on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of a massive phytoplankton bloom off of the Atlantic coast of Patagonia on December 21, 2010.

Menan Buttes, Idaho.title: Menan Buttes, Idaho
Menan Buttes, Idaho.caption_short: Among the world’s largest tuff cones, the two Menan Buttes rise above the Snake River Plain in this photo-like image taken on September 25, 2010.

Winter Storm in the Northeastern United.title: Winter Storm in the Northeastern United States
Winter Storm in the Northeastern United.caption_short: Acquired December 28, 2010, this natural-color image shows a combination of clouds and snow over the northeastern United States.

Dust Plumes off Morocco.title: Dust Plumes off Morocco
Dust Plumes off Morocco.caption_short: Acquired December 29, 2010, this natural-color image shows dust plumes blowing off the Moroccan coast and over the Atlantic Ocean.

Semisopochnoi Island, Alaska.title: Semisopochnoi Island, Alaska
Semisopochnoi Island, Alaska.caption_short: Semisopochnoi is the “Island of the Seven Mountains, ” or more precisely in Russian: “having seven hills.” This uninhabited volcanic island is also an important nesting area for maritime birds of the North Pacific.

Hole Punch Clouds over West Virginia.title: Hole Punch Clouds over West Virginia
Hole Punch Clouds over West Virginia.caption_short: Cold winter conditions set the stage for these unusual clouds that can form due to airplane traffic.

Tropical Storm Tasha.title: Tropical Storm Tasha
Tropical Storm Tasha.caption_short: Acquired December 24, 2010, this color-coded image shows rainfall associated with Tropical Storm Tasha.

Cities at Night, Northern China.title: Cities at Night, Northern China
Cities at Night, Northern China.caption_short: This astronaut photograph features two of China’s most populous cities: Beijing and Tianjin.

Lake District, North West England.title: Lake District, North West England
Lake District, North West England.caption_short: Acquired May 7, 2000, this natural-color image shows the Lake District National Park of North West England.

A Snapshot of Particles in the Air.title: A Snapshot of Particles in the Air
A Snapshot of Particles in the Air.caption_short: This map shows the global distribution of aerosols in August 2010, and the proportion of those aerosols that are large or small.

Strong La Ni&ntilde;a in December 2010.title: Strong La Niña in December 2010
Strong La Ni&ntilde;a in December 2010.caption_short: These images show that the central and eastern Pacific Ocean was unusually cold in December 2010, a tell-tale sign of La Niña. The associated rainfall map shows that La Niña was impacting weather in parts of the globe.

Australia Greens After Record Rains.title: Australia Greens After Record Rains
Australia Greens After Record Rains.caption_short: This vegetation map reveals that plants in southeastern Australia’s Wheatbelt were flourishing under abundant spring rains.

Heavy Rains Soak California.title: Heavy Rains Soak California
Heavy Rains Soak California.caption_short: California has been deluged by rainfall that is approaching records for the month of December.

Oil Fire on Mexican Pipeline.title: Oil Fire on Mexican Pipeline
Oil Fire on Mexican Pipeline.caption_short: A thick black plume of smoke billows over an oil fire on a pipeline in Mexico in this true-color image from December 19, 2010.

Lago Alajuela, Panama.title: Lago Alajuela, Panama
Lago Alajuela, Panama.caption_short: Acquired December 17, 2010, this natural-color image shows a sediment-laden Lago Alajuela, a reservoir of the Panama Canal.

Doha, Qatar.title: Doha, Qatar
Doha, Qatar.caption_short: The old and new zones of Doha, capital city of Qatar, are clearly visible from space, as is the Persian Gulf emirate’s new artificial island, The Pearl.

Tin Bider Crater, Algeria.title: Tin Bider Crater, Algeria
Tin Bider Crater, Algeria.caption_short: Acquired December 3, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tin Bider Crater in Algeria. Spanning 6 kilometers, the crater rises above nearby land to the south.

Dust in the Wind.title: Dust in the Wind
Dust in the Wind.caption_short: This series of images, derived from a computer model, shows wind-blown dust from North Africa as it spread over the Atlantic Ocean on July 1, 2009.

Drought in Somalia.title: Drought in Somalia
Drought in Somalia.caption_short: This image reveals the impact of drought on plants growing in central and southern Somalia in late November and early December 2010.

Arctic Oscillation Chills US and Europe.title: Arctic Oscillation Chills US and Europe
Arctic Oscillation Chills US and Europe.caption_short: This map of the land surface temperature shows that the first week of December was exceptionally cold in northern Europe and the eastern United States.

Heavy Rains in Central and South America.title: Heavy Rains in Central and South America
Heavy Rains in Central and South America.caption_short: This color-coded map shows rainfall amounts over Central and South America from November 25 to December 1, 2010.

Our Reliance on Plants is Increasing.title: Our Reliance on Plants is Increasing
Our Reliance on Plants is Increasing.caption_short: A representation of the pressure local populations put on their ecosystem, this map shows how much plant matter people need for food and other products compared to the amount of plant material produced in each region.

Urban Heat Islands.title: Urban Heat Islands
Urban Heat Islands.caption_short: Acquired in the summer of 2002, these color-coded images compare the urban heat islands of Buffalo, New York, and Providence, Rhode Island.

Record-Setting Storm in Minnesota.title: Record-Setting Storm in Minnesota
Record-Setting Storm in Minnesota.caption_short: Minnesota is covered in white in this photo-like satellite image, taken one day after a record-setting snowstorm moved across the state.

Dust and Violent Weather in the Eastern.title: Dust and Violent Weather in the Eastern Mediterranean
Dust and Violent Weather in the Eastern.caption_short: Captured December 12, 2010, this natural-color image shows a combination of clouds and dust over the eastern Mediterranean.

Las Vegas at Night.title: Las Vegas at Night
Las Vegas at Night.caption_short: The desert darkness contrasts starkly with the brightly lit street grid of Las Vegas in this photo from the International Space Station.

Gravel Rivers in Northeastern Italy.title: Gravel Rivers in Northeastern Italy
Gravel Rivers in Northeastern Italy.caption_short: Acquired September 21, 2010, this natural-color image shows portions of the Cellina, Meduna, and Tagliamento Rivers in northeastern Italy.

Brazil&rsquo;s Negro River Reaches Recor.title: Brazil’s Negro River Reaches Record Low
Brazil&rsquo;s Negro River Reaches Recor.caption_short: The impact of severe drought on the Negro River, a tributary of the Amazon River, and other rivers in the basin is dramatically evident in this pair of images, which show that every body of water has shrunk in 2010 compared to 2008.

Dust Storm in Eastern China.title: Dust Storm in Eastern China
Dust Storm in Eastern China.caption_short: This true-color image shows dust mixed with clouds over eastern China and Bo Hai on April 24, 2009.

Deadly Forest Fire in Northern Israel.title: Deadly Forest Fire in Northern Israel
Deadly Forest Fire in Northern Israel.caption_short: Thick smoke from a large forest fire blows over Haifa, Israel, in this true-color image taken at 12:10 p.m. on December 2, 2010.

Global Warming Mapped.title: Global Warming Mapped
Global Warming Mapped.caption_short: The average global temperature has increased by about 0.8°Celsius since 1880, and two-thirds of the warming occurred after 1975.

Snow Storm across the U.S. Midwest.title: Snow Storm across the U.S. Midwest
Snow Storm across the U.S. Midwest.caption_short: A swath of white defines the path of powerful snow storm in this image from December 7, 2010.

Flooding in Southern Spain.title: Flooding in Southern Spain
Flooding in Southern Spain.caption_short: Acquired March 9, 2010 (top), and March 8, 2009 (bottom), these false-color images show changes brought about by heavy rains in 2010, compared to the same time of year in 2009.Vegetation appears bright green. Clouds appear sky blue. Water ranges from electric blue to navy. Bare ground appears tan.

Snow in Great Britain and Ireland.title: Snow in Great Britain and Ireland
Snow in Great Britain and Ireland.caption_short: Acquired December 8, 2010, this natural-color image shows snow cover stretching from Northern Ireland and Scotland into Ireland and England.

Bloom around the Chatham Islands, New Ze.title: Bloom around the Chatham Islands, New Zealand
Bloom around the Chatham Islands, New Ze.caption_short: A large phytoplankton bloom colors the water around the Chatham Islands, New Zealand, in an array of green and blue in this image from December 5, 2010.

SOHO Still Having a Blast.title: SOHO Still Having a Blast
SOHO Still Having a Blast.caption_short: Fifteen years ago this month, the European Space Agency and NASA launched SOHO, a satellite that fundamentally changed our understanding of the Sun and how it affects our planet.

Dust Storm over Southwest Asia.title: Dust Storm over Southwest Asia
Dust Storm over Southwest Asia.caption_short: Acquired December 4, 2010, this natural-color image shows a dust storm over the borders between Iran, Afghanistan, and Pakistan.

Rising Rivers in Queensland.title: Rising Rivers in Queensland
Rising Rivers in Queensland.caption_short: Acquired December 6 and November 6, 2010, these false-color images show conditions before and after heavy rains filled seasonal rivers in Queensland.

Activity at Klyuchevskaya Volcano Resume.title: Activity at Klyuchevskaya Volcano Resumes
Activity at Klyuchevskaya Volcano Resume.caption_short: After a respite of less than a month, Klyuchevskaya Volcano resumed erupting in late November 2010.

Kamchatka Volcanoes.title: Kamchatka Volcanoes
Kamchatka Volcanoes.caption_short: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes send ash plumes above Kamchatka.

Arctic National Wildlife Refuge Turns 50.title: Arctic National Wildlife Refuge Turns 50
Arctic National Wildlife Refuge Turns 50.caption_short: Acquired July 25, 2010, this natural-color image shows the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in northern Alaska.

Emerald Isle, White Coating.title: Emerald Isle, White Coating
Emerald Isle, White Coating.caption_short: Ireland got a coating of snow and ice this week, the latest expression of an unusually early and brisk start to winter.

Rainfall from the 2010 Hurricane Season.title: Rainfall from the 2010 Hurricane Season
Rainfall from the 2010 Hurricane Season.caption_short: This map provides a summary of the very active 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, showing both the track each storm took and the rain it produced.

Saharan Dust over Sicily.title: Saharan Dust over Sicily
Saharan Dust over Sicily.caption_short: Acquired December 1, 2010, this natural-color image shows Saharan dust blowing over Sicily.

Tropical Cyclone Abele.title: Tropical Cyclone Abele
Tropical Cyclone Abele.caption_short: Acquired December 1, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Abele over the southern Indian Ocean.

Widespread Fires in West Africa.title: Widespread Fires in West Africa
Widespread Fires in West Africa.caption_short: Widespread fires were burning across West Africa when this photo-like image was taken on November 30, 2010.

Khirbat en-Nahas.title: Khirbat en-Nahas
Khirbat en-Nahas.caption_short: Black piles of slag define the ancient copper mining and smelting site, Khirbat en-Nahas, in this image from August 11, 2010.

Mapping Mangroves by Satellite.title: Mapping Mangroves by Satellite
Mapping Mangroves by Satellite.caption_short: Mangroves are among the most biologically important ecosystems on the planet and a common feature of tropical and sub-tropical coastlines. Scientists have used satellite imaging to compile the most detailed map of the extent of mangroves worldwide.

Dust off Tunisia and Libya.title: Dust off Tunisia and Libya
Dust off Tunisia and Libya.caption_short: Acquired November 28, 2010, this natural-color image shows dust plumes blowing off the coasts of Tunisia and Libya.

Kathmandu, Nepal.title: Kathmandu, Nepal
Kathmandu, Nepal.caption_short: The capital and largest city of Nepal, Kathmandu, occupies much of the valley located near the center of the country.

Land Reclamation at Rotterdam.title: Land Reclamation at Rotterdam
Land Reclamation at Rotterdam.caption_short: Acquired in 2006, 2009, and 2010, these natural-color images show the progress of land reclamation aimed at increasing the port capacity at Rotterdam.

Dust blowing out of West Africa.title: Dust blowing out of West Africa
Dust blowing out of West Africa.caption_short: Satellite instruments such as CALIPSO can measure the distribution of aerosols in a vertical slice of the atmosphere, as with this dust plume off the west coast of Africa on April 22, 2010.

Snowstorm covers Western United States.title: Snowstorm covers Western United States
Snowstorm covers Western United States.caption_short: A storm system passing over the north-western United States left a trail of heavy snow as it passed, bringing many a white Thanksgiving Day.

Jewel-Toned Lakes of the Qinghai-Tibet P.title: Jewel-Toned Lakes of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau
Jewel-Toned Lakes of the Qinghai-Tibet P.caption_short: Acquired November 10, 2010, this natural-color image shows assorted lakes of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in iridescent hues of blue, green, and teal.

Maize: A Global Crop with American Roots.title: Maize: A Global Crop with American Roots
Maize: A Global Crop with American Roots.caption_short: Native to America, corn is now a staple in diets around the world. This map shows the global distribution of corn in 2000.

Seasonal Changes in Indian Aerosols.title: Seasonal Changes in Indian Aerosols
Seasonal Changes in Indian Aerosols.caption_short: New research shows that the amount, size, and source of aerosol particles hovering in the air over India changes by season.

Krakatau, Indonesia.title: Krakatau, Indonesia
Krakatau, Indonesia.caption_short: The thick brown plume of ash, steam and volcanic gas rising from Anak Krakatau in this true-color image from November 17, 2010, is a common sight at the volcano

Bright Waters off the Namibian Coast.title: Bright Waters off the Namibian Coast
Bright Waters off the Namibian Coast.caption_short: Acquired November 21, 2010, this natural-color image shows brightly colored water off the coast of northern Namibia.

Nevado Coropuna, Peru.title: Nevado Coropuna, Peru
Nevado Coropuna, Peru.caption_short: Nevado Coropuna is the highest volcanic peak in Peru.

Settling on the Coast.title: Settling on the Coast
Settling on the Coast.caption_short: Cape Cod is a haven for rocks and people who have washed up on American shores.

Sivash, Ukraine.title: Sivash, Ukraine
Sivash, Ukraine.caption_short: Acquired on June 6, 2010, this natural-color image shows brightly hued waters in a network of salt marshes between the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov.

Spring on the Antarctic Peninsula.title: Spring on the Antarctic Peninsula
Spring on the Antarctic Peninsula.caption_short: This rare, nearly cloud-free view of the northern tip of the Antarctic Peninsula provides a photo-like view of sea ice melting and pushing away from the continent in the late spring.

Eruption at Mount Merapi, Indonesia.title: Eruption at Mount Merapi, Indonesia
Eruption at Mount Merapi, Indonesia.caption_short: This visualization shows the approximate location of an avalanche of hot ash and volcanic gas flowing down Indonesia’s erupting Mount Merapi volcano on October 30, 2010.

Glory on the Brunt Ice Shelf.title: Glory on the Brunt Ice Shelf
Glory on the Brunt Ice Shelf.caption_short: One of NASA’s workhorse planes, the DC-8, is being used this month to provide critical insight on the health of the ice sheets and shelves at the southern tip of the world.

Reliant Park Area, Houston, Texas.title: Reliant Park Area, Houston, Texas
Reliant Park Area, Houston, Texas.caption_short: This astronaut photograph of the Reliant Park area of Houston, Texas, is one of the highest spatial resolution images ever obtained from the International Space Station.

Oslofjorden, Norway.title: Oslofjorden, Norway
Oslofjorden, Norway.caption_short: Acquired August 26, 2000, this false-color image shows part of Oslofjorden, a rift valley in southern Norway. At the northern tip of the rift valley sites Norway’s capital city.

Filamentous Bloom near Fiji.title: Filamentous Bloom near Fiji
Filamentous Bloom near Fiji.caption_short: Some of the smallest organisms on our planet can be viewed from space: MODIS on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of a plankton or bacterial bloom south of Fiji on October 18, 2010.

Dust over the Mediterranean.title: Dust over the Mediterranean
Dust over the Mediterranean.caption_short: Acquired November 10, 2010, this natural-color image shows Saharan dust blowing northward across the Mediterranean Sea toward Greece.

Dust Plume over the Sea of Japan.title: Dust Plume over the Sea of Japan
Dust Plume over the Sea of Japan.caption_short: Acquired November 12, 2010, this natural-color image shows an arc of dust extending from the Yellow Sea to the northern Sea of Japan.

Sandstorm over Eastern China.title: Sandstorm over Eastern China
Sandstorm over Eastern China.caption_short: On November 11, 2010, a wall of sand blew across eastern China hiding much of the North China Plain from view in this true color image.

Eruption at Sakurajima.title: Eruption at Sakurajima
Eruption at Sakurajima.caption_short: A tan plume of ash drifts east from the summit of Japan’s Sakurajima volcano in this natural-color image from November 2, 2010.

Activity at Klyuchevskaya Subsides, Bezy.title: Activity at Klyuchevskaya Subsides, Bezymianny Continues
Activity at Klyuchevskaya Subsides, Bezy.caption_short: The most recent eruption of Kyluchevskaya Volcano ended on November 4, 2010, while lava dome growth continues at nearby Bezymianny.

Arctic Sea Ice Melting and Moving.title: Arctic Sea Ice Melting and Moving
Arctic Sea Ice Melting and Moving.caption_short: A new NASA analysis has quantified for the first time the amount of “multi-year” ice that is being lost from the Arctic Ocean due to melting as opposed to export.

Global View of Fine Aerosol Particles.title: Global View of Fine Aerosol Particles
Global View of Fine Aerosol Particles.caption_short: Solid particles and liquid droplets in the air come in a range of sizes, but those smaller than 2.5 micrometers pose the greatest risk to human health.

Cyclone Jal.title: Cyclone Jal
Cyclone Jal.caption_short: Acquired November 7, 2010, this natural-color image shows Jal along the coast of India.

Rainfall from Cyclone Jal.title: Rainfall from Cyclone Jal
Rainfall from Cyclone Jal.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall over India, Sri Lanka, and the Bay of Bengal from November 1 to 7, 2010, and the storm track for Jal from November 5 to November 7, 2010.

Rainfall from Hurricane Tomas.title: Rainfall from Hurricane Tomas
Rainfall from Hurricane Tomas.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall over the Caribbean from November 1 to 7, 2010, and the storm track for Tomas from October 30 to November 7, 2010.

Nile River Delta at Night.title: Nile River Delta at Night
Nile River Delta at Night.caption_short: The Nile River and its delta looks like a brilliant, long-stemmed flower in this astronaut photograph of the southeastern Mediterranean Sea at night.

Matusevich Glacier.title: Matusevich Glacier
Matusevich Glacier.caption_short: Acquired September 6, 2010, this natural-color image shows chunks of ice breaking off Matusevich Glacier along the coast of Antarctica.

Hurricane Tomas.title: Hurricane Tomas
Hurricane Tomas.caption_short: Acquired November 5, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Tomas in between Haiti and Cuba.

Haze from India to the Arabian Sea.title: Haze from India to the Arabian Sea
Haze from India to the Arabian Sea.caption_short: Acquired November 2, 2010, this natural-color image shows haze stretching from the southern face of the Himalaya over parts of India and Pakistan to the Arabian Sea.

Wandering Ozone Hole in November 2009.title: Wandering Ozone Hole in November 2009
Wandering Ozone Hole in November 2009.caption_short: In November 2009, the Antarctic ozone hole contorted and stretched itself for three weeks in such a way as to give South Americans an extra dose of ultraviolet radiation.

Ongoing Activity at Popocat&eacute;petl.title: Ongoing Activity at Popocatépetl
Ongoing Activity at Popocat&eacute;petl.caption_short: Steam and gas over the summit of Popocatépetl Volcano, Mexico.

Fires in Louisiana and Arkansas.title: Fires in Louisiana and Arkansas
Fires in Louisiana and Arkansas.caption_short: Dozens of fires burn in this cloud-free view of Louisiana and Arkansas, taken on October 30, 2010.

Syr Darya River Floodplain, Kazakhstan,.title: Syr Darya River Floodplain, Kazakhstan, Central Asia
Syr Darya River Floodplain, Kazakhstan,.caption_short: Acquired September 30, 2010, this astronaut photograph shows part of the Syr Darya River Floodplain in Kazakhstan, where the river flows through braided channels.

Gandoman, Iran.title: Gandoman, Iran
Gandoman, Iran.caption_short: Acquired September 30, 2010, this natural-color image shows an arid landscape south of Esfahan, Iran.

The Shrinking Aral Sea Recovers.title: The Shrinking Aral Sea Recovers
The Shrinking Aral Sea Recovers.caption_short: Though the Aral Sea has been steadily shrinking over the past decade, this true-color image from August 2010 shows slight growth in the southern sea as water flowed into it from the Amu Darya for the first time since 2008.

Lava Fountain and Volcanic Plume, Piton.title: Lava Fountain and Volcanic Plume, Piton de la Fournaise
Lava Fountain and Volcanic Plume, Piton.caption_short: The latest eruption of Piton de la Fournaise Volcano began on October 14, 2010.

Fire near Vandenberg Air Force Base.title: Fire near Vandenberg Air Force Base
Fire near Vandenberg Air Force Base.caption_short: A plume of smoke rises over the Pacific Ocean from a fire burning near Vandenberg Air Force Base in this image from October 28, 2010.

Strong Extratropical Cyclone Over the US.title: Strong Extratropical Cyclone Over the US Midwest
Strong Extratropical Cyclone Over the US.caption_short: This image, taken by the GOES satellite on October 26, shows the large extratropical cyclone over much of the United States.

MISR Mystery Image Quiz.title: MISR Mystery Image Quiz
MISR Mystery Image Quiz.caption_short: Where on Earth...? Follow the clues to figure out what geographic region is shown in this image, and then answer the questions about the place for a chance to win the MISR Mystery Image contest.

7.7 Magnitude Quake off Sumatra.title: 7.7 Magnitude Quake off Sumatra
7.7 Magnitude Quake off Sumatra.caption_short: This image shows the topography, bathymetry, fault lines, and earthquake locations related to the earthquake that struck off the coast of Indonesia on October 25, 2010.

Rain from Typhoon Megi.title: Rain from Typhoon Megi
Rain from Typhoon Megi.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall along Typhoon Megi’s path across the western Pacific between October 13 and 23, 2010.

Hurricane Richard off Belize.title: Hurricane Richard off Belize
Hurricane Richard off Belize.caption_short: Acquired October 24, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Richard making landfall along the coast of Belize.

Merowe Dam, Nile River, Republic of the.title: Merowe Dam, Nile River, Republic of the Sudan
Merowe Dam, Nile River, Republic of the.caption_short: Astronaut photograph of Merowe Dam and Reservoir along the Nile River, Sudan.

Ouachita Mountains, Oklahoma.title: Ouachita Mountains, Oklahoma
Ouachita Mountains, Oklahoma.caption_short: Acquired November 13, 2002, this false-color image shows part of the Ouachita Mountains in southeastern Oklahoma.

Cyclone Giri.title: Cyclone Giri
Cyclone Giri.caption_short: This image of Cyclone Giri approaching Myanmar (Burma) on October 22, 2010, shows a strong, mature storm with a well-defined eye and a circular shape.

Flooding in Benin.title: Flooding in Benin
Flooding in Benin.caption_short: Acquired October 22, 2010, and October 26, 2009, these false-color images show differences in the Ouémé River in southern Benin caused by flooding in 2010.

Dust over Afghanistan and Pakistan.title: Dust over Afghanistan and Pakistan
Dust over Afghanistan and Pakistan.caption_short: Acquired October 22, 2010, this natural-color image shows dust over Afghanistan and Pakistan.

Fires in Botswana.title: Fires in Botswana
Fires in Botswana.caption_short: Patches of black, scorched earth and pale gray plumes of smoke surround the Okavango Delta in this natural color image from October 15, 2010.

Taklimakan Desert Dust Storm.title: Taklimakan Desert Dust Storm
Taklimakan Desert Dust Storm.caption_short: Acquired September 5, 2010, these natural-color images a wide-area and close-up view of a dust storm in the Taklimakan Desert.

The Gravity of Water.title: The Gravity of Water
The Gravity of Water.caption_short: In much of the world, differences in seasonal precipitation—and in how that water gets stored on land—are big enough to affect Earth’s gravity field.

Spring in Lake Tahoe.title: Spring in Lake Tahoe
Spring in Lake Tahoe.caption_short: This pair of true color images shows spring settling in over Lake Tahoe and the surrounding region in May and June 2010.

Fires in Queensland.title: Fires in Queensland
Fires in Queensland.caption_short: Fires were burning across Queensland from the Cape York Peninsula to the area surrounding Rockhampton.

Susitna Glacier, Alaska.title: Susitna Glacier, Alaska
Susitna Glacier, Alaska.caption_short: Acquired August 27, 2009, this false-color image shows the complex marbled surface of Alaska’s Susitna Glacier.

Super Typhoon Megi.title: Super Typhoon Megi
Super Typhoon Megi.caption_short: Spanning more than 600 kilometers (370 miles) across, the Super Typhoon Megi approached the Philippines on October 18, 2010 as the most potent tropical storm of the year.

Pyramid Lake, Nevada.title: Pyramid Lake, Nevada
Pyramid Lake, Nevada.caption_short: Pyramid Lake, in western Nevada, is a remnant of the ancient and much larger Lake Lahontan that formed during the last Ice Age.

Imja Tsho, Nepal.title: Imja Tsho, Nepal
Imja Tsho, Nepal.caption_short: Acquired October 4, 2010, this natural-color image shows Imja Tsho and surrounding glaciers in eastern Nepal.

Fall Colors in the Allegheny Mountains.title: Fall Colors in the Allegheny Mountains
Fall Colors in the Allegheny Mountains.caption_short: Brilliant orange leaves paint the mountains of northern Pennsylvania in this natural-color image acquired on October 13, 2010.

Hurricane Paula.title: Hurricane Paula
Hurricane Paula.caption_short: Acquired October 13, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Paula between Mexico and Cuba.

Tropical Storm Paula.title: Tropical Storm Paula
Tropical Storm Paula.caption_short: Acquired October 14, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Storm Paula between stretching from the Gulf of Mexico to the Atlantic Ocean.

Landslide Lake in Northwest Pakistan.title: Landslide Lake in Northwest Pakistan
Landslide Lake in Northwest Pakistan.caption_short: Acquired March 16,2010, this true-color image shows a lake created by a landslide in the Hunza Valley of northern Pakistan. The landslide appears near the upper left corner, and a submerged bridge appears near the lower right corner.

Lava Flows and Ash Plume from Klyuchevsk.title: Lava Flows and Ash Plume from Klyuchevskaya Volcano
Lava Flows and Ash Plume from Klyuchevsk.caption_short: Russia’s Klyuchevskaya Volcano continues its frequent but relatively mild volcanic activity.

Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monum.title: Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument, Utah
Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monum.caption_short: Acquired May 15, 2005, this natural-color image shows part of the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument in south-central Utah.

Flood Lake Lingers in Pakistan.title: Flood Lake Lingers in Pakistan
Flood Lake Lingers in Pakistan.caption_short: Accessed October 11, 2009, August 11, 2010, and October 12, 2010, these false-color images show lingering effects of the 2010 monsoon season in Pakistan.

Toxic Sludge in Hungary.title: Toxic Sludge in Hungary
Toxic Sludge in Hungary.caption_short: Acquired October 9, 2010, this natural-color image shows the toxic sludge spill from an alumina plant in southern Hungary.

Great Dyke of Zimbabwe.title: Great Dyke of Zimbabwe
Great Dyke of Zimbabwe.caption_short: The Great Dyke of Zimbabwe is a layered intrusion of igneous, metal-bearing rock that has been dated to approximately 2.5 billion years in age.

Barnes Ice Cap, Baffin Island, Canada.title: Barnes Ice Cap, Baffin Island, Canada
Barnes Ice Cap, Baffin Island, Canada.caption_short: Acquired September 4, 2010, this natural-color image shows part of the Barnes Icecap and adjoining Gee Lake on Baffin Island.

Ring of Gullion, Northern Ireland.title: Ring of Gullion, Northern Ireland
Ring of Gullion, Northern Ireland.caption_short: A rocky ring of hills in Northern Ireland rises from green farmland in this Landsat image, revealing the ancient geology of the island.

Ash from Karymsky Volcano.title: Ash from Karymsky Volcano
Ash from Karymsky Volcano.caption_short: Plume of gas and ash from Karymsky Volcano.

Boteti River, Botswana.title: Boteti River, Botswana
Boteti River, Botswana.caption_short: In September 2010, water again flowed through this riverbed after several dry years.

A Little Water Goes a Long Way.title: A Little Water Goes a Long Way
A Little Water Goes a Long Way.caption_short: The tiny amount of water vapor in our atmosphere has an outsized influence on the planet as a potent greenhouse gas.

Heavy Rains in Jamaica.title: Heavy Rains in Jamaica
Heavy Rains in Jamaica.caption_short: Tropical Storm Nicole maintained tropical-storm status for only a matter of hours, but the storm nevertheless poured torrential rains on the island nation of Jamaica. The heavy rain led to flash floods and landslides, which proved especially deadly in shantytowns along unstable banks.

Arctic Sea Ice Minimum for 2010.title: Arctic Sea Ice Minimum for 2010
Arctic Sea Ice Minimum for 2010.caption_short: These images show overall Arctic sea ice extent on September 19, 2010 (the date of the 2010 minimum), and sea ice growth in mid-September 2010.

Kilauea Lava Enters the Ocean.title: Kilauea Lava Enters the Ocean
Kilauea Lava Enters the Ocean.caption_short: Lava from Kilauea Volcano flows into the ocean near Kalapana, Hawaii.

Winds of Drought, Winds of Flood.title: Winds of Drought, Winds of Flood
Winds of Drought, Winds of Flood.caption_short: Made from a model based on satellite data, these animations contrast wind patterns that brought drought to the U.S. Midwest in 1988 with those that brought floods in 1993.

ISS View of the Southwestern USA.title: ISS View of the Southwestern USA
ISS View of the Southwestern USA.caption_short: This panoramic view of the southwestern USA and Pacific Ocean was taken by an astronaut looking out at an angle from the International Space Station

Dust over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterr.title: Dust over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterranean Sea
Dust over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterr.caption_short: Acquired October 1, 2010, this natural-color image shows a dust plume over Egypt, Libya, and the Mediterranean Sea.

Saint Pierre and Miquelon.title: Saint Pierre and Miquelon
Saint Pierre and Miquelon.caption_short: The last remnant of France’s once-vast holdings in North America, an island archipelago off the coast of Newfoundland bears the scars of a complicated geologic history. Altogether, the archipelago covers just 242 square kilometers (93 square miles), and the three biggest islands lend the entire island chain its name: Saint Pierre and Miquelon.

The Water Planet.title: The Water Planet
The Water Planet.caption_short: Earth is a water planet. Three-quarters of the planet’s surface covered by ice or oceans, and the sky is filled with clouds.

Steaming Mount Etna.title: Steaming Mount Etna
Steaming Mount Etna.caption_short: Even in the absence of an eruption, there are signs of activity at the summit of Mount Etna.

Twitchell Canyon Fire, Utah.title: Twitchell Canyon Fire, Utah
Twitchell Canyon Fire, Utah.caption_short: The false-color image in this true- and false-color image pair shows the extent of the large Twitchell Canyon Fire burning in the mountains of central Utah on September 21, 2010.

How Warm Was Summer 2010?.title: How Warm Was Summer 2010?
How Warm Was Summer 2010?.caption_short: 2010 was the 4th warmest summer in the 131-year-temperature record. Unusually warm summers in the U.S. and Europe created the impression of global warming run amuck, but extrapolating global trends based on one or two regions can be misleading.

Plumes from Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya.title: Plumes from Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya Volcanoes
Plumes from Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya.caption_short: Shiveluch and Klyuchevskaya volcanoes continue their long-running eruptions.

Snowy Peaks and Fall Colors in Alaska.title: Snowy Peaks and Fall Colors in Alaska
Snowy Peaks and Fall Colors in Alaska.caption_short: This natural-color image shows a combination of snow capped peaks, glaciers, and changing vegetation north of Anchorage, Alaska on September 20, 2010.

St. Anthony Sand Dunes, Idaho.title: St. Anthony Sand Dunes, Idaho
St. Anthony Sand Dunes, Idaho.caption_short: White sand dunes spill across the Snake River Plain in a wide arc in this detailed, photo-like image acquired by the Advanced Land Imager on NASA’s EO-1 satellite on September 25, 2010.

High Pressure Cloud Patterns, Eastern U..title: High Pressure Cloud Patterns, Eastern U.S.
High Pressure Cloud Patterns, Eastern U..caption_short: The MODIS instrument on NASA’s Terra satellite captured this view of a high pressure system dominating the eastern half of the United States on September 23, 2010.

Planch\u00c3\u00b3n-Peteroa Volcano.title: PlanchÃ³n-Peteroa Volcano
Planch\u00c3\u00b3n-Peteroa Volcano.caption_short: Planchón-Peteroa Volcano emitted a dark gray plume of ash on September 21, 2010.

Barren Island Ash Plume.title: Barren Island Ash Plume
Barren Island Ash Plume.caption_short: Remote Barren Island Volcano emits a small plume of ash on September 25, 2010.

Smoke Plume, Caspian Sea, Kazakhstan.title: Smoke Plume, Caspian Sea, Kazakhstan
Smoke Plume, Caspian Sea, Kazakhstan.caption_short: Astronauts on the International Space Station took in this view of the north coast of the Caspian Sea and two river deltas in Kazakhstan and Russia on September 11, 2010.

San Jose Mine, Chile.title: San Jose Mine, Chile
San Jose Mine, Chile.caption_short: Acquired September 16, 2010, this natural-color image shows Chile’s San José copper and gold mine where a mine collapse trapped 33 miners.

Fires in Southern Kruger National Park.title: Fires in Southern Kruger National Park
Fires in Southern Kruger National Park.caption_short: The fires and resulting burn scars shown in these true-color images help maintain healthy savanna ecosystems in South Africa's Kruger National Park.

High Waters along the Pakistan-India Bor.title: High Waters along the Pakistan-India Border
High Waters along the Pakistan-India Bor.caption_short: Acquired September 23, 2010, and September 23, 2009, these false-color images show changes in water levels along the coastlines of Pakistan and India following the 2010 monsoon floods.

Heavy Rainfall from Hurricane Karl.title: Heavy Rainfall from Hurricane Karl
Heavy Rainfall from Hurricane Karl.caption_short: This color-coded map shows the rainfall and storm track associated with Hurricane Karl from September 14 to 18, 2010.

Flooding around Manchhar Lake, Pakistan.title: Flooding around Manchhar Lake, Pakistan
Flooding around Manchhar Lake, Pakistan.caption_short: Acquired September 15, 2010, this natural-color image shows flooding along the northern and eastern margins of Pakistan’s Manchhar Lake.

Water Level Changes in Lake Mead.title: Water Level Changes in Lake Mead
Water Level Changes in Lake Mead.caption_short: In August 2010, Lake Mead reached its lowest level since 1956, the result of a persistent drought and increasing human demand.

Ash Plume from Planch\u00c3\u00b3n-Peter.title: Ash Plume from PlanchÃ³n-Peteroa Volcano
Ash Plume from Planch\u00c3\u00b3n-Peter.caption_short: Planchón-Peteroa Volcano emits an ash plume on September 18, 2010.

Twitchell Canyon Fire, Central Utah.title: Twitchell Canyon Fire, Central Utah
Twitchell Canyon Fire, Central Utah.caption_short: This astronaut photograph shows smoke billowing from the Twitchell Canyon Fire in central Utah on September 21, 2010.

Es Safa Volcanic Field, Syria.title: Es Safa Volcanic Field, Syria
Es Safa Volcanic Field, Syria.caption_short: Es Safa is a striking basaltic volcanic field located in Syria, within the larger Harrat Ash Shamah—the largest volcanic field on the Arabian tectonic plate.

La Nina in progress.title: La Nina in progress
La Nina in progress.caption_short: Acquired September 6, 2010, this map shows cooling in the central Pacific Ocean consistent with La Niña conditions.

Drought and Air Quality in August 2010.title: Drought and Air Quality in August 2010
Drought and Air Quality in August 2010.caption_short: This global map shows high concentrations of aerosols, particles in the atmosphere, over drought-afflicted Russia and South America in August 2010.

Typhoon Fanapi.title: Typhoon Fanapi
Typhoon Fanapi.caption_short: The MODIS instrument on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of Typhoon Fanapi approaching Taiwan from the Philippine Sea on September 17, 2010.

Fourmile Canyon Fire.title: Fourmile Canyon Fire
Fourmile Canyon Fire.caption_short: Acquired September 6, 2010, this natural-color image shows a river of smoke flowing eastward from a wildfire west of Boulder, Colorado.

Hurricane Karl.title: Hurricane Karl
Hurricane Karl.caption_short: Acquired September 16, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Karl over the Gulf of Mexico and southern Mecixo.

Hurricane Igor from the Space Station.title: Hurricane Igor from the Space Station
Hurricane Igor from the Space Station.caption_short: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station took this photograph of the eye of Hurricane Igor on September 14, 2010.

Hurricane Igor.title: Hurricane Igor
Hurricane Igor.caption_short: Acquired September 13, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Igor, a Category 4 hurricane, over the Atlantic Ocean.

Tropical Storm Fanapi.title: Tropical Storm Fanapi
Tropical Storm Fanapi.caption_short: Acquired September 16, 2010, this natural-color image shows Fanapi east of Taiwan.

Antarctic Ozone Hole 2010.title: Antarctic Ozone Hole 2010
Antarctic Ozone Hole 2010.caption_short: The Ozone Monitoring Instrument (OMI) on NASAâ€™s Aura satellite acquired data for this map of ozone concentrations over Antarctica on September 12, 2010.

Seasonal Fires in Southern Africa.title: Seasonal Fires in Southern Africa
Seasonal Fires in Southern Africa.caption_short: Widespread fires produce thick smoke in this image of South Africa from September 15, 2010.

Dust Storm in Afghanistan and Pakistan.title: Dust Storm in Afghanistan and Pakistan

Microwave Sea Ice.title: Microwave Sea Ice
Microwave Sea Ice.caption_short: NASA's Aqua satellite used microwaves to capture this snapshot of Arctic sea ice on September 3, 2010.

Landslide in Zhouqu, China.title: Landslide in Zhouqu, China
Landslide in Zhouqu, China.caption_short: This detailed image, taken by the commercial WorldView-2 satellite on August 10, 2010, shows the path of a large mudslide through the Chinese city of Zhouqu.

Rising Waters in Manchhar Lake.title: Rising Waters in Manchhar Lake
Rising Waters in Manchhar Lake.caption_short: Acquired September 7, 2010, and September 13, 2010, these false-color images show floodwaters rising along a massive lake that branched off the Indus River.

Maseru, Lesotho.title: Maseru, Lesotho
Maseru, Lesotho.caption_short: Maseru is the capital city of the Kingdom of Lesotho, and is located along the northwestern border of the country with the Republic of South Africa.

Florence, Italy.title: Florence, Italy
Florence, Italy.caption_short: Acquired July 30, 2010, this natural-color image shows the city of Florence, Italy, spanning the west-flowing Arno River.

Tropical Storm Hermine.title: Tropical Storm Hermine
Tropical Storm Hermine.caption_short: The MODIS instrument on NASA's Terra satellite captured this natural-color image of Tropical Storm Hermine as it crossed from the Gulf of Mexico into Texas on September 7.

Dust Storm in Idaho.title: Dust Storm in Idaho
Dust Storm in Idaho.caption_short: Acquired September 5, 2010, this natural-color image shows dust blowing over southeastern Idaho.

Indus River and Manchhar Lake.title: Indus River and Manchhar Lake
Indus River and Manchhar Lake.caption_short: Acquired September 5, 2010, this false-color image shows the Indus River and nearby Manchhar Lake, both swollen by floods.

Fires in Santa Cruz, Bolivia.title: Fires in Santa Cruz, Bolivia
Fires in Santa Cruz, Bolivia.caption_short: This true-color image shows large fires burning in a national park and a nature reserve in Bolivia on September 8, 2010.

Earth and Moon from Mercury.title: Earth and Moon from Mercury
Earth and Moon from Mercury.caption_short: Looking back from its orbit around Mercury, MESSENGER captured this view of Earth and the Moon on May 6, 2010.

7.0 Quake near Christchurch, New Zealand.title: 7.0 Quake near Christchurch, New Zealand
7.0 Quake near Christchurch, New Zealand.caption_short: This topographic map of the South Island, New Zealand, illustrates the location of a large earthquake on September 4, 2010, how geologic activity shaped the region in the past, and why the current geology makes Christchurch vulnerable to earthquake damage.

Great Lakes, No Clouds.title: Great Lakes, No Clouds
Great Lakes, No Clouds.caption_short: Late August 2010 provided a rare satellite view of a cloudless summer day over the entire Great Lakes region of North America.

Volcanic Landscapes, Central Andes.title: Volcanic Landscapes, Central Andes
Volcanic Landscapes, Central Andes.caption_short: The landscape in the central Andes Mountains, near the border between Chile and Argentina, is dominated by volcanoes and associated landforms.

Phytoplankton Bloom in the Barents Sea.title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Barents Sea
Phytoplankton Bloom in the Barents Sea.caption_short: Phytoplankton are tiny plant-like organisms that are the foundation of the ocean food web. Like plants, they contain chlorophyll and other pigments that they use to harvest sunlight for photosynthesis. In northern waters, these organisms are starved for sunlight much of the year, but during the summer months, they explode in colorful blooms such as this one.

Earl Moves Up the East Coast.title: Earl Moves Up the East Coast
Earl Moves Up the East Coast.caption_short: Once a tightly wound spiral of clouds with a clear eye, Hurricane Earl was a far more relaxed sprawling oval on September 3, 2010, when this true-color image was acquired.

Flooding in Balochistsan.title: Flooding in Balochistsan
Flooding in Balochistsan.caption_short: Acquired August 28, 2010, and August 28, 2009, these false-color images show part of Pakistan’s Balochistan Province before and after the 2010 monsoon floods.

Hurricane Earl along the North Carolina.title: Hurricane Earl along the North Carolina Coast
Hurricane Earl along the North Carolina.caption_short: Acquired September 2, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Earl grazing the North Carolina coast.

Typhoon Kompasu.title: Typhoon Kompasu
Typhoon Kompasu.caption_short: The MODIS instrument on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this natural-color image of Typhoon Kompasu approaching the Korean peninsula and China on September 1, 2010.

Hurricane Earl Cloud Heights.title: Hurricane Earl Cloud Heights
Hurricane Earl Cloud Heights.caption_short: Acquired on August 29, 2010, this image combines a natural-color image of Hurricane Earl with a cloud height profile.

Weakened Kompasu over Land.title: Weakened Kompasu over Land
Weakened Kompasu over Land.caption_short: Acquired September 2, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Storm Kompasu over the coasts of North Korea and the Russian Federation.

Hurricane Earl.title: Hurricane Earl
Hurricane Earl.caption_short: Acquired August 29, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Earl near the Lesser Antilles.

Hurricane Earl - The Astronaut View.title: Hurricane Earl - The Astronaut View
Hurricane Earl - The Astronaut View.caption_short: An astronaut on the International Space Station snapped this photograph of Hurricane Earl as a Category 4 storm on August 30, 2010.

Fire Cloud over Northern Russia.title: Fire Cloud over Northern Russia
Fire Cloud over Northern Russia.caption_short: This profile of the atmosphere provides a rare view of a towering fire-formed thunderstorm and the smoke it injected high into the atmosphere.

Flooding in Niger.title: Flooding in Niger
Flooding in Niger.caption_short: Acquired on August 23, 2010, and August 27, 2009, these false-color images show part of Niger before and after torrential rains that began in July 2010.

Flooding on the Chenab River, Pakistan.title: Flooding on the Chenab River, Pakistan
Flooding on the Chenab River, Pakistan.caption_short: Acquired August 21, 2010, this natural-color image shows the Chenab River, near the city of Multan, Pakistan, in flood.

Sinabung Volcano Pre-Eruption.title: Sinabung Volcano Pre-Eruption
Sinabung Volcano Pre-Eruption.caption_short: Dormant since at least the year 1600, Indonesia’s Mount Sinabung erupted on August 29, 2010.

Hurricane Danielle.title: Hurricane Danielle
Hurricane Danielle.caption_short: Acquired August 26, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Danielle over the Atlantic Ocean.

Mataiva Atoll, Tuamotu Archipelago, Sout.title: Mataiva Atoll, Tuamotu Archipelago, South Pacific Ocean
Mataiva Atoll, Tuamotu Archipelago, Sout.caption_short: This astronaut photograph shows Mataiva Atoll, the westernmost atoll of the Tuamotu Archipelago.

Tropical Storm Mindulle.title: Tropical Storm Mindulle
Tropical Storm Mindulle.caption_short: Acquired August 23, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Storm Mindulle over the South China Sea.

Breakup on the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf.title: Breakup on the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf
Breakup on the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf.caption_short: Acquired August 18, 2010, and August 22, 2002, these natural-color images show changes on the Ward Hunt Ice Shelf on Canada’s Ellesmere Coast.

Hurricane Frank.title: Hurricane Frank
Hurricane Frank.caption_short: Acquired August 25, 2010, this natural-color image shows Hurricane Frank just off the coast of Mexico.

Kong Oscar Glacier, Greenland.title: Kong Oscar Glacier, Greenland
Kong Oscar Glacier, Greenland.caption_short: The heavily crevassed terminus of Kong Oscar Glacier in northwestern Greenland crumbles into a mélange of icebergs in the Davis Strait.

Tropical Storm Danielle.title: Tropical Storm Danielle
Tropical Storm Danielle.caption_short: Acquired August 23, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Storm Danielle over the Atlantic Ocean.

Gulf of Izmit, Turkey.title: Gulf of Izmit, Turkey
Gulf of Izmit, Turkey.caption_short: Taken on July 31, 2010, this astronaut photograph shows an industrialized area of Turkey at the eastern edge of the Sea of Marmara.

Drought Slows Plant Growth, 2000-2009.title: Drought Slows Plant Growth, 2000-2009
Drought Slows Plant Growth, 2000-2009.caption_short: This color-coded map shows how plant growth and the carbon plants store changed between 2000 and 2009.

Fires in British Columbia, Canada.title: Fires in British Columbia, Canada

Smoke over Western Russia.title: Smoke over Western Russia

Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Volcano, Chile.title: ChaitÃ©n Volcano, Chile
Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Volcano, Chile.caption_short: Winter snows partially cover Chaitén Volcano’s lava dome.

Fires in Madeira, Portugal.title: Fires in Madeira, Portugal

NASA Johnson Space Center, Houston, Texa.caption_short: Acquired July 31, 2010, this astronaut photograph features the NASA Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center.

Phytoplankton Bloom off Greenland.title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Greenland
Phytoplankton Bloom off Greenland.caption_short: The stark black and white landscape of eastern Greenland provides a fine contrast to the burst of color created by a large phytoplankton bloom in this photo-like image from August 7, 2010.

Volcanic Activity at Nyiragongo.caption_short: Acquired August 3, 2010, this natural-color image shows a plume from Nyiragongo Volcano.

Unusually Intense Monsoon Rains.title: Unusually Intense Monsoon Rains

Tropical Storm Dianmu.title: Tropical Storm Dianmu

Tropical Storm Estelle.title: Tropical Storm Estelle

These satellite images show Tempe Town Lake before and after a rubber dam maintaining the

Earth from the Moon.title: Earth from the Moon

Plume from the Klyuchevskaya Volcano.title: Plume from the Klyuchevskaya Volcano

Sunset from the International Space Stat.title: Sunset from the International Space Station

Vog from Yasur Volcano.caption_short: On June 6, 2010, a large swath of faint blue-gray haze extends from Tanna toward the southeast, spreading out as it travels farther from the volcano.

Mingachevir Reservoir, Azerbaijan.title: Mingachevir Reservoir, Azerbaijan
Mingachevir Reservoir, Azerbaijan.caption_short: Afternoon sun highlights distinctive parallel patterns in the hills surrounding Azerbaijan’s Mingachevir Reservoir in this astronaut image from May 8, 2010.

Santa Catalina Island, California.title: Santa Catalina Island, California
Santa Catalina Island, California.caption_short: Off the coast of California, rugged Santa Catalina Island is encircled by a white perimeter of breaking waves in this satellite image from May 11, 2010.

Dust over India.title: Dust over India
Dust over India.caption_short: A wide swath of pale dust blows across the Great Indian Desert in this true-color image from June 2, 2010.

Sea Surface Temperatures at the Start of.title: Sea Surface Temperatures at the Start of 2010 Hurricane Season
Sea Surface Temperatures at the Start of.caption_short: This color-coded image from June 1, 2010, shows which equatorial ocean waters are warm enough to promote hurricane formation.

Dust Storm over Egypt and Libya.title: Dust Storm over Egypt and Libya
Dust Storm over Egypt and Libya.caption_short: Lighter in color than the desert beneath it, a large dust storm curls in a comma shape over Egypt and Libya in this natural-color image from May 26, 2010.

Canadian Fires Send Smoke Over New Engla.title: Canadian Fires Send Smoke Over New England
Canadian Fires Send Smoke Over New Engla.caption_short: A thick river of smoke flowed southeast over New England from several forest fires burning out of control in southern Quebec, Canada, on May 31, 2010.

Oil Leak Continues in Gulf of Mexico.title: Oil Leak Continues in Gulf of Mexico
Oil Leak Continues in Gulf of Mexico.caption_short: Beneath scattered clouds, streaks and ribbons of oil brightened the reflection of the Sun off the Gulf of Mexico in this photo-like satellite image from May 31, 2010.

Zambezi Flood Plain, Namibia.title: Zambezi Flood Plain, Namibia
Zambezi Flood Plain, Namibia.caption_short: Originating in swampy wetlands, the river tumbles over one of the world’s largest waterfalls, flows through deep gorges, and spreads across broad floodplains.

City Lights at Night along the France-It.title: City Lights at Night along the France-Italy Border
City Lights at Night along the France-It.caption_short: Moonglint and the lights of Torino, Lyon, and Marseille glitter in this nighttime astronaut photo of the Italy-France border region.

Rainbow Bridge National Monument.title: Rainbow Bridge National Monument
Rainbow Bridge National Monument.caption_short: Acquired on May 23, 2010, this natural-color image shows the Colorado Plateau’s Rainbow Bridge, a natural sandstone arch, casting a slim shadow to the northwest.

Smoke over the U.S. from Spring Burning.title: Smoke over the U.S. from Spring Burning
Smoke over the U.S. from Spring Burning.caption_short: Elevated concentrations of carbon monoxide trace the transport of smoke from agricultural fires across Mexico, southern Canada, and the U.S. Great Plains and New England.

Flooding in Southern China.title: Flooding in Southern China
Flooding in Southern China.caption_short: Acquired on May 25, 2010 (top), and May 2, 2010 (bottom), these false-color images show part of Fujian Province before and after heavy rains caused widespread flooding.

Vistula River Flooding, Southeastern Pol.title: Vistula River Flooding, Southeastern Poland
Vistula River Flooding, Southeastern Pol.caption_short: Taken on May 22, 2010, this astronaut photograph shows flooding along the Vistula River near the towns of Gorzyce, Sokolniki, and Trześń.

Record Low April Snow.title: Record Low April Snow
Record Low April Snow.caption_short: Snow cover across North America in April 2010 was the lowest since records began in 1967.

Eruption of Eyjafjallaj\u00c3\u00b6kull.title: Eruption of EyjafjallajÃ¶kull Volcano, Iceland
Eruption of Eyjafjallaj\u00c3\u00b6kull.caption_short: Lava fountains erupt near Eyjafjallajökull Volcano, Iceland, on March 24, 2010.

Flooding in Poland.title: Flooding in Poland
Flooding in Poland.caption_short: Acquired May 23, 2010 (top), and April 26, 2010 (bottom), these false-color images show an area along the flooded Vistula River.

Phytoplankton Bloom in the North Atlanti.title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the North Atlantic
Phytoplankton Bloom in the North Atlanti.caption_short: Acquired on May 22,2010, this natural-color image shows a phytoplankton bloom stretching hundreds of kilometers, from the waters west of Ireland to the Bay of Biscay.

Nighttime Ash Tracking with CALIPSO.title: Nighttime Ash Tracking with CALIPSO
Nighttime Ash Tracking with CALIPSO.caption_short: A satellite records a vertical profile of the atmosphere and reveals the altitude of ash clouds.

Eruption of Eyjafjallaj&ouml;kull Volcan.title: Eruption of Eyjafjallajökull Volcano, Iceland
Eruption of Eyjafjallaj&ouml;kull Volcan.caption_short: The volcanic eruption near Eyjafjallajökull persists into its second week, with continued lava fountaining and lava flows spilling into nearby canyons.

Oil Slick Continues in the Gulf of Mexic.title: Oil Slick Continues in the Gulf of Mexico
Oil Slick Continues in the Gulf of Mexic.caption_short: On May 23, 2010, a large patch of oil covered the waters near the site of an offshore oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico.

Kata Tjuta (The Olgas), Northern Territo.title: Kata Tjuta (The Olgas), Northern Territory, Australia
Kata Tjuta (The Olgas), Northern Territo.caption_short: Afternoon sunlight highlights the rounded summits and eroded fractures of the Kata Tjuta rock formation in this astronaut photo from April 30, 2010.

Oil Slick off the Mississippi Delta.title: Oil Slick off the Mississippi Delta
Oil Slick off the Mississippi Delta.caption_short: Acquired May 18, 2010, this image shows oil slicks just off the Mississippi Delta.

Goat Paddock Crater.title: Goat Paddock Crater
Goat Paddock Crater.caption_short: Acquired April 30, 2010, this natural-color image shows Goat Paddock Crater in northwestern Australia. The slightly elliptical crater spans roughly 5 kilometers.

The Greenstone Waters, New Zealand.title: The Greenstone Waters, New Zealand
The Greenstone Waters, New Zealand.caption_short: From space, the southwest coast of New Zealand resembles the greenstone for which it is named. This cloud-free satellite image is from April 9, 2010.

Tropical Cyclone Laila Soaks India.title: Tropical Cyclone Laila Soaks India
Tropical Cyclone Laila Soaks India.caption_short: This color-coded image shows estimated rainfall amounts from Tropical Storm Laila from May 17 through May 19, 2010, and the storm track from May 17 to May 20, 2010.

Gulf Oil Slick Approaching Loop Current.title: Gulf Oil Slick Approaching Loop Current
Gulf Oil Slick Approaching Loop Current.caption_short: This pair of sea surface temperature images shows how the warm waters of the Loop Current connect the Gulf of Mexico to the Atlantic Ocean and the dynamic northern margin of the current on May 18. On May 18, NOAA reported that oil was very close to, and perhaps already entrained in, the Loop Current.

Tropical Cyclone Laila.title: Tropical Cyclone Laila
Tropical Cyclone Laila.caption_short: Acquired May 19, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Laila hovering over the eastern coastline of India.

30th Anniversary of the Eruption of Mt..title: 30th Anniversary of the Eruption of Mt. St. Helens
30th Anniversary of the Eruption of Mt..caption_short: A trio of images documents the devastation and recovery of the landscape around Mt. St. Helens Volcano following its cataclysmic 1980 eruption.

Panorama of Central Andes Mountains, Sal.title: Panorama of Central Andes Mountains, Salar de Arizaro, Argentina
Panorama of Central Andes Mountains, Sal.caption_short: A panoramic view of South America from the Atacama Desert in the Andes to the Atlantic Coast is captured in this astronaut photo from April 26, 2010.

Wilpena Pound and St. Mary Peak, South A.title: Wilpena Pound and St. Mary Peak, South Australia
Wilpena Pound and St. Mary Peak, South A.caption_short: Acquired March 7,2003, this natural-color image shows South Australia’s Wilpena Pound, a remnant valley surrounded by high rock walls.

A Living Relic: Madeira&rsquo;s Laurissi.title: A Living Relic: Madeira’s Laurissilva Forest
A Living Relic: Madeira&rsquo;s Laurissi.caption_short: The deep green forest that covers the northern mountains of Madeira Island is one of the last remnants of an ancient forest that once covered much of Europe and North Africa.

Flooding in Kentucky.title: Flooding in Kentucky
Flooding in Kentucky.caption_short: Acquired on May 9, 2010 and April 29, 2010, these false-color images show changes in the Green and Ohio Rivers caused by severe flooding.

Fires in Democratic Republic of Congo.title: Fires in Democratic Republic of Congo

Grinnell Glacier, Glacier National Park.title: Grinnell Glacier, Glacier National Park
Grinnell Glacier, Glacier National Park.caption_short: The retreat of Grinnell Glacier, in the heart of Glacier National Park, since 1950 is revealed in this image from August 21, 2003.

April 2010 Water Level in Lake Powell.title: April 2010 Water Level in Lake Powell
April 2010 Water Level in Lake Powell.caption_short: This April 7, 2010, image from Landsat 5 shows water levels in Lake Powell on the Colorado River.

Explosion, Leak at Gulf of Mexico Oil We.title: Explosion, Leak at Gulf of Mexico Oil Well
Explosion, Leak at Gulf of Mexico Oil We.caption_short: An oil slick approaches the Louisiana coast on April 27, 2010.

Dust over Syria.title: Dust over Syria
Dust over Syria.caption_short: Dust blankets Syria’s Fertile Crescent in this natural-color image from May 11, 2010.

Oil Slick near the Mouth of the Mississi.title: Oil Slick near the Mouth of the Mississippi
Oil Slick near the Mouth of the Mississi.caption_short: Concentrated patches and streaks of oil appear silvery gray in this high-resolution image of the Gulf of Mexico near the tip of the Mississippi River Delta on May 8, 2010.

Oil Spill Continues in Gulf of Mexico.title: Oil Spill Continues in Gulf of Mexico
Oil Spill Continues in Gulf of Mexico.caption_short: The oil slick from a damaged well in the Gulf of Mexico appeared as a silvery U-shape in natural-color imagery from May 9, 2010.

Gulf of Mexico Oil Spill Observed From t.title: Gulf of Mexico Oil Spill Observed From the International Space Station
Gulf of Mexico Oil Spill Observed From t.caption_short: Shot by an astronaut looking westward from the International Space Station from a location over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, this May 4, 2010, photograph shows the Deepwater Horizon oil slick brushing the Chandeleur Islands.

Indus River, Pakistan.title: Indus River, Pakistan
Indus River, Pakistan.caption_short: Between 1992 and 2009, a section of the lower Indus River changes course following the formation of an oxbow lake.

Oil Slick in Gulf of Mexico.title: Oil Slick in Gulf of Mexico
Oil Slick in Gulf of Mexico.caption_short: Acquired on May 8, 2010, this natural-color image shows the oil slick in the Gulf of Mexico in two parts: a serpentine slick in the west, and a large, round slick in the east.

Oil Reaches Chandeleur Islands, Louisian.title: Oil Reaches Chandeleur Islands, Louisiana
Oil Reaches Chandeleur Islands, Louisian.caption_short: Light tan streamers snake across Chandeleur Sound in this detailed natural color satellite image from May 5, 2010. The streamers are probably ropes of oil from a leaking well in the Gulf of Mexico.

Spring Dust Storm in Washington.title: Spring Dust Storm in Washington
Spring Dust Storm in Washington.caption_short: A dark plume of dust extends across nearly half of Washington state in these natural-color image from May 3, 2010.

New Ash Eruptions from Eyjafjallaj\u00c3.title: New Ash Eruptions from EyjafjallajÃ¶kull Volcano, Iceland
New Ash Eruptions from Eyjafjallaj\u00c3.caption_short: A broad plume of brown ash spreads east and south from Eyjafjallajokull Volcano in this image from May 6, 2010.

Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Pakistan.title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Pakistan

Record Floods in Tennessee.title: Record Floods in Tennessee
Record Floods in Tennessee.caption_short: The landscape of Tennessee is marbled blue in this false-color satellite image from May 4, 2010, revealing extensive flooding.

Heavy Rains in Kentucky and Tennessee.title: Heavy Rains in Kentucky and Tennessee
Heavy Rains in Kentucky and Tennessee.caption_short: A map of rainfall totals between May 1 and May 3, 2010, shows a line of heavy rain following  the path of severe thunderstorms across Tennessee and Kentucky.

Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park, Ca.title: Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park, Canada
Lake Minnewanka, Banff National Park, Ca.caption_short: Acquired July 1, 2009, this natural-color image shows Lake Minnewanka at the eastern tip of Banff National Park.

Nevado del Ruiz Volcano, Colombia.title: Nevado del Ruiz Volcano, Colombia
Nevado del Ruiz Volcano, Colombia.caption_short: Eruptions at glacier-mantled Nevado del Ruiz Volcano in Colombia have been accompanied by deadly mudflows.

Mt. Hood National Forest.title: Mt. Hood National Forest
Mt. Hood National Forest.caption_short: Acquired September 24, 2002, this natural-color image shows part of Mt. Hood National Forest, including the volcanic peak that gave the area its name. Park boundaries are outlined in white.

Oil Slick Near Mississippi Delta.title: Oil Slick Near Mississippi Delta
Oil Slick Near Mississippi Delta.caption_short: Acquired May 1, 2010, this natural-color image shows the oil slick from the April 20 accident in the Gulf of Mexico nearing the Mississippi Delta.

Signs of Life: Sulfur Deposits at Borup.title: Signs of Life: Sulfur Deposits at Borup Fiord Pass, Canadian Arctic
Signs of Life: Sulfur Deposits at Borup.caption_short: A natural-color satellite image and an aerial photograph show a unique glacial valley in the Canadian Arctic, where sulfur deposits on the ice may give scientists insights into how to search for extraterrestrial life.

Gulf Oil Spill Creeps Towards Mississipp.title: Gulf Oil Spill Creeps Towards Mississippi Delta
Gulf Oil Spill Creeps Towards Mississipp.caption_short: The northwestern tip of the oil slick in the Gulf of Mexico almost touches the Mississippi Delta in this image from April 29, 2010.

Dust in Northwestern China.title: Dust in Northwestern China
Dust in Northwestern China.caption_short: Dust ringed the Taklimakan Desert of northwestern China when this true-color satellite image was taken on April 25, 2010.
