Dust in Northwest China.title: Dust in Northwest China
Dust in Northwest China.caption_short: Dense dust from at least three regions mingles in the air over northwestern China in this photo-like image from April 24, 2010.

Sahara Dust Storm.title: Sahara Dust Storm
Sahara Dust Storm.caption_short: Acquired April 22, 2010, this natural-color image shows a dust plume spanning hundreds of kilometers in western Africa. A wall of dust appears to advance toward the southeast in Burkina Faso and Niger.

Sahara Dust over the Canary Islands.title: Sahara Dust over the Canary Islands
Sahara Dust over the Canary Islands.caption_short: A thin layer of yellow-brown dust masks the Atlantic Ocean and the Canary Islands in this photo-like image, taken on April 28, 2010.

Heavy Rain in Assam, India.title: Heavy Rain in Assam, India
Heavy Rain in Assam, India.caption_short: Acquired April 28, 2010 (top), and April 16, 2010 (bottom), these false-color images show changes caused by floods along the Brahmaputra River.

Big Thompson Canyon, Colorado.title: Big Thompson Canyon, Colorado
Big Thompson Canyon, Colorado.caption_short: Big Thompson Canyon in northern Colorado is the site of the state’s worst natural disaster—a 1976 flash flood that killed 144 people.

Open- and Closed-Cell Clouds over the Pa.title: Open- and Closed-Cell Clouds over the Pacific Ocean
Open- and Closed-Cell Clouds over the Pa.caption_short: Acquired April 17, 2010, this natural-color image shows a network of open- and closed-cell clouds over the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Peru.

Fires across Tyumen and Omsk Regions, So.title: Fires across Tyumen and Omsk Regions, Southern Russia
Fires across Tyumen and Omsk Regions, So.caption_short: Smoke from scores of agricultural fires veiled southern Russia’s Omsk and Tyumen’ regions on April 26, 2010.

Oil Leak from Damaged Well in Gulf of Me.title: Oil Leak from Damaged Well in Gulf of Mexico
Oil Leak from Damaged Well in Gulf of Me.caption_short: These satellite images were among the first revealing the scope of the Deepwater Horizon spill.

Eruption of Gaua Volcano.title: Eruption of Gaua Volcano
Eruption of Gaua Volcano.caption_short: A plume of ash and steam rises from Mount Garet—the summit of Vanuatu’s Gaua volcano—in this natural-color satellite image from February 14, 2010.

Volcanoes near Usulut&aacute;n, El Salva.title: Volcanoes near Usulután, El Salvador
Volcanoes near Usulut&aacute;n, El Salva.caption_short: Differences in size and surface features reveal the histories of four adjacent volcanoes.

Brasilia, Brazil.title: Brasilia, Brazil
Brasilia, Brazil.caption_short: Sitting between an artificial lake and a national park, Brasilia, Brazil, is recognized as a pioneer in the use of rigorous urban planning to create livable cities.

Great Escarpment, South Africa.title: Great Escarpment, South Africa
Great Escarpment, South Africa.caption_short: This photo-like image of South Africa on April 12, 2010, shows the rugged cliffs of the continent-spanning Great Escarpment.

Tropical Cyclone Sean.title: Tropical Cyclone Sean
Tropical Cyclone Sean.caption_short: Acquired April 23, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Sean over the southern Indian Ocean. The storm is northwest of Australia and south of the Lesser Sunda Islands.

Arctic Sea Ice Extent, 2009-2010.title: Arctic Sea Ice Extent, 2009-2010
Arctic Sea Ice Extent, 2009-2010.caption_short: These images show Arctic sea ice extent for the September 2009 summer minimum and the March 2010 winter maximum. Ice extents were greater than they had been in many recent years, but were still below the long-term average.

Smoke Plume from Burning Oil Rig in Gulf.title: Smoke Plume from Burning Oil Rig in Gulf of Mexico
Smoke Plume from Burning Oil Rig in Gulf.caption_short: On April 21, 2010, brownish smoke fanned out to the southeast of a burning oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico.

Prominence from the Solar Dynamics Obser.title: Prominence from the Solar Dynamics Observatory
Prominence from the Solar Dynamics Obser.caption_short: NASA's newest sun-monitoring mission captures a detailed view of a prominence erupting on March 30, 2010.

Heavy Rain in Eastern India.title: Heavy Rain in Eastern India
Heavy Rain in Eastern India.caption_short: This color-coded image shows estimated rainfall amounts from April 14–20, 2010. Lowest amounts appear in pale green, and heaviest amounts appear in dark blue.

Dust over Pakistan and India.title: Dust over Pakistan and India
Dust over Pakistan and India.caption_short: A veil of dust blurs the surface of the Thar Desert on the border between India and Pakistan in this photo-like image taken on April 20, 2010.

Hot spots on Iceland&rsquo;s Eyjafjallaj.title: Hot spots on Iceland’s Eyjafjallajökull Volcano
Hot spots on Iceland&rsquo;s Eyjafjallaj.caption_short: A NASA satellite spied the eruption plume and the heat signature of lava at the summit.

Detailed View of Ash Plume at Eyjafjalla.title: Detailed View of Ash Plume at EyjafjallajÃ¶kull Volcano
Detailed View of Ash Plume at Eyjafjalla.caption_short: A billowing cloud of ash emanates from Eyjafjallajökull Volcano on April 17, 2010.

Ice Floes off the Northeastern Tip of Ur.title: Ice Floes off the Northeastern Tip of Urup Island, Russia
Ice Floes off the Northeastern Tip of Ur.caption_short: Off the tip of Urup Island, the difference between sea ice and island can be hard to identify.

Sumatra Subduction Zone.title: Sumatra Subduction Zone
Sumatra Subduction Zone.caption_short: Subduction off the coast of Sumatra is responsible for the region’s geography, undersea topography, earthquakes, and volcanoes.

Lush Vegetation Brings Locusts to Easter.title: Lush Vegetation Brings Locusts to Eastern Australia
Lush Vegetation Brings Locusts to Easter.caption_short: This vegetation image from March 2010 shows lush vegetation growing in Australia’s interior, where developing swarms of locusts had been spotted.

Ash Plume across the North Atlantic.title: Ash Plume across the North Atlantic
Ash Plume across the North Atlantic.caption_short: Acquired April 15, 2010, this natural-color image shows an ash plume blowing from Eyjafjallajökull Volcano toward the east-southeast across the North Atlantic. The plume’s tan hue indicates a fairly high ash content.

Eruption of Eyjafjallaj\u00f6kull Volcan.title: Eruption of Eyjafjallajökull Volcano, Iceland
Eruption of Eyjafjallaj\u00f6kull Volcan.caption_short: A 100-kilometer-long plume of steam and ash stretches from Iceland’s Eyjafjallajökull Volcano towards Europe.

Sea Ice Imitates the Shoreline along the.title: Sea Ice Imitates the Shoreline along the Kamchatka Peninsula
Sea Ice Imitates the Shoreline along the.caption_short: Acquired April 13, 2010, this natural-color image shows a long formation of sea ice with a shape that mimics the features of the eastern shore of the Kamchatka Peninsula.

Earthquake on Tibetan Plateau, Qinghai,.title: Earthquake on Tibetan Plateau, Qinghai, China
Earthquake on Tibetan Plateau, Qinghai,.caption_short: Based on data collected by the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission in 2002, this map shows the location of the April 13, 2010, earthquake in Qinghai, China, as well as tectonic features of the eastern Tibetan Plateau.

Lake Frome, South Australia.title: Lake Frome, South Australia
Lake Frome, South Australia.caption_short: Acquired on April 10, 2010, and and March 7, 2009, these natural-color images show changes in a central Australian saltpan, Lake Frome. In 2010, water has seeped into the salt lake, leaving standing water in some areas and muddying much of the ground surface.

Walgreen Coast, West Antarctica.title: Walgreen Coast, West Antarctica
Walgreen Coast, West Antarctica.caption_short: Low-angled sunlight highlights topography and ice textures along Walgreen Coast in West Antarctica on March 14, 2010.

Panian Mine, Semirara Island, Philippine.title: Panian Mine, Semirara Island, Philippines
Panian Mine, Semirara Island, Philippine.caption_short: A rare cloud-free photo of the northern end of Semirara Island in the Philippines shows the Panian open-pit mine.

Spring Ice Breakup on Dnieper River, Ukr.title: Spring Ice Breakup on Dnieper River, Ukraine
Spring Ice Breakup on Dnieper River, Ukr.caption_short: Acquired March 23, 2010, this natural-color image shows the southern end of the Kyiv (Kiev) Reservoir and part of the city of Vyshhorod. Ice lingers on parts of the reservoir’s surface.

Spring Runoff in the Adriatic Sea.title: Spring Runoff in the Adriatic Sea
Spring Runoff in the Adriatic Sea.caption_short: Clouds of tan and blue and green line Italy’s eastern shore in this natural-color image from April 6, 2010.

Fragments of Larsen B Ice Shelf Lingered.title: Fragments of Larsen B Ice Shelf Lingered Until 2005
Fragments of Larsen B Ice Shelf Lingered.caption_short: Acquired in 2003, 2004,and 2005, these images show an intermittently ice-filled bay in the wake of the 2002 collapse of the Larsen B Ice Shelf on the Antarctic Peninsula.

Retreat of Crane Glacier, Antarctic Peni.title: Retreat of Crane Glacier, Antarctic Peninsula
Retreat of Crane Glacier, Antarctic Peni.caption_short: This pair of satellite images shows the dramatic retreat of the Crane Glacier between 2002 and 2003, following the collapse of the Larsen B Ice Shelf.

Wildfire in Central Chile.title: Wildfire in Central Chile
Wildfire in Central Chile.caption_short: Thick brownish smoke hung over Bío Bío province in central Chile on April 6, 2010.

Global Aerosols March 2010.title: Global Aerosols March 2010
Global Aerosols March 2010.caption_short: This global map shows the concentration of aerosols in the atmosphere in March 2010, revealing the intensity of a large African dust storm and smoke and dust over Asia.

Minchinmavida and Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Vol.title: Minchinmavida and ChaitÃ©n Volcanoes, Chile
Minchinmavida and Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Vol.caption_short: A steam plume hung above Chaitén Volcanoe’s growing lava dome, and a nearby river bed was choked with volcanic debris on April 3, 2010.

Flooding in the Northeastern United Stat.title: Flooding in the Northeastern United States
Flooding in the Northeastern United Stat.caption_short: Acquired April 3, 2010, this natural-color image shows parts of Cranston and Warwick, Rhode Island, after record-setting floodwaters had begun to recede. Flooded areas appear as patches of muddy blue-green, especially along the Pawtucket River and part of I-295.

7.2-Magnitude Quake near Mexicali, Mexic.title: 7.2-Magnitude Quake near Mexicali, Mexico
7.2-Magnitude Quake near Mexicali, Mexic.caption_short: Northwest-southeast-trending mountains and wide basins dominate the topography between the Gulf of California and the Mexico-United States border where a major earthquake occurred on April 4, 2010.

Tropical Cyclone Robyn.title: Tropical Cyclone Robyn
Tropical Cyclone Robyn.caption_short: Acquired April 5, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Robyn spanning hundreds of kilometers over the Southern Indian Ocean. Although the storm lacks a distinct eye, it has a discernible center marked by opaque white clouds.

Four Erupting Kamchatka Volcanoes.title: Four Erupting Kamchatka Volcanoes
Four Erupting Kamchatka Volcanoes.caption_short: Four volcanoes were erupting on Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula in early April 2010.

Escondida Copper Mine, Atacama Desert, C.title: Escondida Copper Mine, Atacama Desert, Chile
Escondida Copper Mine, Atacama Desert, C.caption_short: The impoundment area for waste materials associated with the Escondida Copper Mine in Chile is centered in this astronaut photograph from December 9, 2009.

Himalayan Glacier, Southern China.title: Himalayan Glacier, Southern China
Himalayan Glacier, Southern China.caption_short: Acquired December 25, 2009, this natural-color image shows a glacier slowly creeping down a valley to terminate in a frozen lake.

50th Anniversary of the TIROS Satellite.title: 50th Anniversary of the TIROS Satellite
50th Anniversary of the TIROS Satellite.caption_short: The first satellite designed to observe clouds was launched on April 1, 1960.

New Fissure near Eyjafjallaj\u00c3\u00b6.title: New Fissure near EyjafjallajÃ¶kull, Iceland
New Fissure near Eyjafjallaj\u00c3\u00b6.caption_short: A steam plume marks the site of a new volcanic fissure in the Fimmvörduháls Pass region of southern Iceland.

Varied Ice Shapes along the Greenland Co.title: Varied Ice Shapes along the Greenland Coast
Varied Ice Shapes along the Greenland Co.caption_short: Acquired March 27, 2010, this natural-color image shows part of the southeastern coast of Greenland, fringed by multiple forms of sea ice: fast ice, multiyear ice fragments, and small pieces of ice shaped into swirls by currents.

Remnants of Tropical Cyclone Paul.title: Remnants of Tropical Cyclone Paul
Remnants of Tropical Cyclone Paul.caption_short: Acquired April 1, 2010, this natural-color image shows remains of Tropical Cyclone Paul over northern Australia. The thickest clouds occur along the Northern Territory-Queensland border.

Damage to Migratory Bird Habitat Followi.title: Damage to Migratory Bird Habitat Following Hurricane Hugo
Damage to Migratory Bird Habitat Followi.caption_short: Damage to forests in the path of destructive Hurricane Hugo in 1989 appear in this disturbance map of South Carolina made from Landsat 5 satellite data.

Late March Dust Storm in Northeastern Ch.title: Late March Dust Storm in Northeastern China
Late March Dust Storm in Northeastern Ch.caption_short: Acquired March 31, 2010, this natural-color image shows thick dust plumes blowing near the China-Mongolia border.

Tropical Cyclone Paul.title: Tropical Cyclone Paul
Tropical Cyclone Paul.caption_short: Acquired March 29, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Paul spanning the distance between the northern coast of Australia and the southern coast of New Guinea.

Aral Sea Dust Storm.title: Aral Sea Dust Storm
Aral Sea Dust Storm.caption_short: Acquired March 26, 2010, this natural-color image shows a plume rising from the eastern lobe of the South Aral Sea. The dust blows toward the southeast, along the Kazakhstan-Uzbekistan border.

Global Hawk, NASA&rsquo;s New Remote-Con.title: Global Hawk, NASA’s New Remote-Controlled Plane
Global Hawk, NASA&rsquo;s New Remote-Con.caption_short: The Global Hawk, NASA's new remote-controlled airplane, banks for a landing over Rogers Dry Lake at Edwards Air Force Base in California at the end of a test flight on October 23, 2009.

Flooding in Channel Country.title: Flooding in Channel Country
Flooding in Channel Country.caption_short: Acquired March 26, 2010 (top), and March 14, 2010 (bottom), these false-color images track the movement of floodwaters in Australia’s Channel Country.

Llullaillaco Volcano, Argentina-Chile Bo.title: Llullaillaco Volcano, Argentina-Chile Border
Llullaillaco Volcano, Argentina-Chile Bo.caption_short: This detailed astronaut photo shows the summit of South America’s Llullaillaco Volcano, the highest historically active volcano in the world.

Wembo-Nyama Feature, DR Congo.title: Wembo-Nyama Feature, DR Congo
Wembo-Nyama Feature, DR Congo.caption_short: The dark green Unia River highlights the circular structure of the Wembo-Nyama feature—a possible impact crater in the Democratic Republic of Congo—in this natural-color image from April 1, 2000.

Flooding near the Betsiboka River, Madag.title: Flooding near the Betsiboka River, Madagascar
Flooding near the Betsiboka River, Madag.caption_short: Acquired March 23, 2010, this natural-color image shows an agricultural area immediately south of the Betsiboka River, roughly 40 kilometers from the coast. The beige-and-green area filling most of the image is flooded.

Spring Sandstorm Scours China.title: Spring Sandstorm Scours China
Spring Sandstorm Scours China.caption_short: Thick dust hangs over the Pacific Ocean east of Japan in this true-color image from March 21, 2010.

Temperature Anomalies, Winter 2009-2010.title: Temperature Anomalies, Winter 2009-2010
Temperature Anomalies, Winter 2009-2010.caption_short: Northern Hemisphere winter 2009–2010 temperatures were unusually cold across much of the United States, Canada, and Europe compared to previous winters this decade, while Greenland, North Africa, and the Middle East were warmer than usual.

Flooding near Huron, South Dakota.title: Flooding near Huron, South Dakota
Flooding near Huron, South Dakota.caption_short: Floodwaters closed roads, filled basements, and soaked agricultural fields in southeastern South Dakota in late March 2010.

Tropical Cyclone Imani.title: Tropical Cyclone Imani
Tropical Cyclone Imani.caption_short: Acquired March 24, 2010, this natural-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Imani over the Southern Indian Ocean. Besides the characteristic cyclone shape, this storm throws out radial clouds toward the north.

Flooding in North Dakota.title: Flooding in North Dakota
Flooding in North Dakota.caption_short: A pair of false-color and natural-color images acquired March 21, 2010, show flooding in agricultural areas north of Fargo, North Dakota.

Spring Sandstorm Scours China.title: Spring Sandstorm Scours China
Spring Sandstorm Scours China.caption_short: Few landmarks or topographic features are recognizable beneath a sheet of dust that covered the North China Plain on March 20, 2010.

Dam Failure near Kyzylagash, Kazakhstan.title: Dam Failure near Kyzylagash, Kazakhstan
Dam Failure near Kyzylagash, Kazakhstan.caption_short: Acquired March 21, 2010, a true-color, high-resolution image shows the settlement of Kyzylagash and its surroundings. On either side of the waterway, two tiny white strips along the highway suggest a destroyed bridge. Rugged mountains, partially covered with snow, push up against Kyzylagash.

Houston, Texas at Night.title: Houston, Texas at Night
Houston, Texas at Night.caption_short:
Taken on February 28, 2010, this astronaut photograph shows Houston at 
night. Different land uses appear at varying levels of brightness, with bright lights in Houston proper, and no lights in undeveloped areas.

Kelvin Wave Renews El Ni&ntilde;o.title: Kelvin Wave Renews El Niño
Kelvin Wave Renews El Ni&ntilde;o.caption_short: A trio of globes of sea surface height anomalies shows a deep pulse of warm water—a Kelvin wave—crossing the Pacific Ocean in February 2010. Kelvin waves strengthen and maintain El Niño episodes.

Rising Waters in St. Paul.title: Rising Waters in St. Paul
Rising Waters in St. Paul.caption_short: Acquired on March 17, 2010 (top), and August 5, 2009 (bottom), these false-color images show differences in vegetation and river levels at different times of year.

Solar Flare and Coronal Mass Ejection.title: Solar Flare and Coronal Mass Ejection
Solar Flare and Coronal Mass Ejection.caption_short: This ultraviolet image, captured by NASA’s Solar Terrestrial Relations Observatory (STEREO) Ahead spacecraft on February 12, 2010, shows solar storms brewing in two active areas of the Sun.

Massive Dust Storm Sweeps Across Africa.title: Massive Dust Storm Sweeps Across Africa
Massive Dust Storm Sweeps Across Africa.caption_short: Pale tan dust blurs the southern edge of the Sahara Desert across the entire African continent in this natural-color satellite image from March 19, 2010.

Tropical Cyclone Ului.title: Tropical Cyclone Ului
Tropical Cyclone Ului.caption_short: Acquired March 18, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Ului spanning several hundred kilometers over the Pacific Ocean, just south of the Solomon Islands.

Mauna Loa Observatory.title: Mauna Loa Observatory
Mauna Loa Observatory.caption_short: This satellite image of the summit of Mauna Loa overlaid with contour lines helps illustrate why volcanic emissions from the summit rarely reach the observatory where atmospheric carbon dioxide is measured.

Landslide in Maierato, Italy.title: Landslide in Maierato, Italy
Landslide in Maierato, Italy.caption_short: A pale tan scar in this natural-color image from March 14, 2010, marks the location of a landslide outside the southern Italian town of Maierato.

Flooding in Southwestern Queensland.title: Flooding in Southwestern Queensland
Flooding in Southwestern Queensland.caption_short: Acquired March 8, 2010 (top), and February 23, 2010 (bottom), these false-color images show changes in river levels in Australia’s Channel Country. Vegetation appears bright green. Clouds appear sky blue. Water varies in color from electric blue to navy. Bare ground appears tan.

Tropical Cyclones Tomas and Ului.title: Tropical Cyclones Tomas and Ului
Tropical Cyclones Tomas and Ului.caption_short: Acquired March 15, 2010, local time, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Tomas over Fiji, and Tropical Cyclone Ului over the Solomon Islands.

Ash Plume from Batu Tara.title: Ash Plume from Batu Tara
Ash Plume from Batu Tara.caption_short: Batu Tara erupted ash over 2,000 meters high on March 15, 2010.

Hydrogen Sulfide Emissions along the Nam.title: Hydrogen Sulfide Emissions along the Namibian Coast
Hydrogen Sulfide Emissions along the Nam.caption_short: Acquired March 13, 2010, this true-color image shows pale-hued surface waters along the coat of Namibia, ranging in color from peacock green to off-white. Inland, the image captures the rippling sand dunes of the Namib Desert.

Dust over China.title: Dust over China
Dust over China.caption_short: A ribbon of tan dust extends across the North China Plain and over the Yellow Sea towards the Korean peninsula in this natural color image from March 12, 2010.

Sir Bani Yas Island, United Arab Emirate.title: Sir Bani Yas Island, United Arab Emirates
Sir Bani Yas Island, United Arab Emirate.caption_short: This astronaut photograph illustrates the varying character of surfaces on Sir Bani Yas, an island in the Persian Gulf near the west coast of the United Arab Emirates.

Pakistan Mud Volcanoes.title: Pakistan Mud Volcanoes
Pakistan Mud Volcanoes.caption_short: This image from February 11, 2010, shows several mud volcanoes that rise from the desert landscape of southern Pakistan, along the coast of the Arabian Sea.

Large Landslide in Uganda.title: Large Landslide in Uganda
Large Landslide in Uganda.caption_short: Freshly exposed earth traces down the slope of Mount Elgon in Uganda where a large landslide buried three villages on March 2, 2010. This cloud-free, natural color image is from March 11.

Dubai, February 2010.title: Dubai, February 2010
Dubai, February 2010.caption_short: Acquired February 8, 2010, this false-color image shows part of the city of Dubai, including the resort island of Palm Jumeirah. Bare ground appears brown, vegetation appears red, water appears dark blue, and buildings and paved surfaces appear light blue or gray.

Icebergs off the Antarctic Coast.title: Icebergs off the Antarctic Coast
Icebergs off the Antarctic Coast.caption_short: Acquired March 8, 2010, this true-color image shows two icebergs, Iceberg B-09B and an iceberg recently broken off the Mertz Glacier, floating in the Southern Ocean, just off the George V Coast.

Strong Aftershocks Rattle Chile Followin.title: Strong Aftershocks Rattle Chile Following Big Quake
Strong Aftershocks Rattle Chile Followin.caption_short: This map of topography and water depth along the Chilean coast includes black circles that indicate aftershocks with a magnitude of 5.0 or larger that occurred between March 5 and 12, 2010, following the large earthquake on February 27.

Ash Covers Klyuchevskaya Volcano.title: Ash Covers Klyuchevskaya Volcano
Ash Covers Klyuchevskaya Volcano.caption_short: Klyuchevskaya Volcano on Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula was covered in ash on March 10, 2010.

Chateaubriant, France.title: Chateaubriant, France
Chateaubriant, France.caption_short: Vestiges of Medieval Brittany mingle with signs of modern civilization in this simulated natural color satellite image of Chateaubriant, France.

Chait\u00e9n Volcano Lava Dome, Chile.title: Chaitén Volcano Lava Dome, Chile
Chait\u00e9n Volcano Lava Dome, Chile.caption_short: Reduced volcanic emissions and clear skies over southern Chile on March 3, 2010, revealed Chaitén volcano’s new lava dome.

Joanne Simpson, 1923-2010.title: Joanne Simpson, 1923-2010
Joanne Simpson, 1923-2010.caption_short: Dr. Joanne Simpson (1923–2010) pores over reams of images of tropical clouds filmed during flights across the tropical Pacific. The photos and her hand-drawn maps of cloud formations became the foundation for her groundbreaking “hot towers” hypothesis about atmospheric circulation in the tropics.

Snow in Eastern United States and Canada.title: Snow in Eastern United States and Canada
Snow in Eastern United States and Canada.caption_short: Acquired March 6, 2010, this true-color image shows snow cover over the eastern reaches of Canada and the United States. Snow cover appears the most opaque in Ohio, central New York, and between Lake Huron and its neighboring lakes to the east.

Phytoplankton Bloom in the Arabian Sea.title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Arabian Sea
Phytoplankton Bloom in the Arabian Sea.caption_short: Phytoplankton swirled across the Arabian Sea on February 18, 2010, drawn into thin green ribbons by turbulent eddies.

Irrigation Project along the Orange Rive.title: Irrigation Project along the Orange River
Irrigation Project along the Orange Rive.caption_short: Acquired February 17, 2010, this true-color image shows emerald-green irrigated fields along the Orange River, which separates Namibia from the Republic of South Africa.

GOES-P Satellite Launches.title: GOES-P Satellite Launches
GOES-P Satellite Launches.caption_short: This photo shows the GOES-P satellite launching from Cape Canaveral, Florida, on March 4, 2010.

Thick Ice in the Baltic Sea.title: Thick Ice in the Baltic Sea
Thick Ice in the Baltic Sea.caption_short: Enough ice lines the coasts of Sweden and Finland in this natural-color image from March 5, 2010,  that it is difficult to tell where the coast ends and the sea begins.

Thick Ice in the Gulf of Bothnia.title: Thick Ice in the Gulf of Bothnia
Thick Ice in the Gulf of Bothnia.caption_short: Acquired March 5, 2010, this true-color image shows ice filling part of the Gulf of Bothnia. Ice lines much of the coast, including the area around Sundsvall.

Snow across the Upper Midwest.title: Snow across the Upper Midwest
Snow across the Upper Midwest.caption_short: Acquired March 4, 2010, this true-color image shows snow covering the ground from Missouri to the beyond the Great Lakes. Uniform snow cover in the southwest gives way to a mixture of snow and forest in the northeast.

Widespread Fires, Smoky Skies Across Sou.title: Widespread Fires, Smoky Skies Across Southeast Asia
Widespread Fires, Smoky Skies Across Sou.caption_short: Hundreds of fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, and Vietnam were creating smoky skies on March 5, 2010.

Dust Extends from Saudi Arabia to Iran.title: Dust Extends from Saudi Arabia to Iran
Dust Extends from Saudi Arabia to Iran.caption_short: Acquired March 4, 2010, this true-color image shows a thick dust plume stretching from Saudi Arabia to Iran, obscuring part of the Persian Gulf.

Smoke Plumes over Concepcion, Chile, Fol.title: Smoke Plumes over Concepcion, Chile, Following Large Earthquake
Smoke Plumes over Concepcion, Chile, Fol.caption_short: Smoke plumes and apparent damage to a bridge are visible in this astronaut photograph of Concepción, Chile, following the magnitude 8.8 earthquake on February 27, 2010.

Heavy Rain in Queensland.title: Heavy Rain in Queensland
Heavy Rain in Queensland.caption_short: This color-coded image shows estimated rainfall amounts in Queensland and neighboring states from February 24 to March 2, 2010. Lowest rainfall amounts appear in pale green, and heaviest amounts appear in dark blue.

Dust Plumes over Jordan, Syria, and Iraq.title: Dust Plumes over Jordan, Syria, and Iraq
Dust Plumes over Jordan, Syria, and Iraq.caption_short: Acquired March 3, 2010, this true-color image shows dust plumes blowing toward the east-northeast across Jordan, Syria, and northern Iraq. Multiple pinpoints of dust originate along a lava field in Jordan.

Fires and Smoke Across Southeast Asia.title: Fires and Smoke Across Southeast Asia
Fires and Smoke Across Southeast Asia.caption_short: Skies across Southeast Asia were thick with smoke from hundreds of fires, probably agriculture related, on March 3, 2010.

Growth of Mountaintop Mine, West Virgini.title: Growth of Mountaintop Mine, West Virginia, 1984-2009
Growth of Mountaintop Mine, West Virgini.caption_short: Landsat 5 observed the growth of one of the largest surface mines in the state it expanded from ridge to ridge.

8.8 Magnitude Quake near Concepcion, Chi.title: 8.8 Magnitude Quake near Concepcion, Chile
8.8 Magnitude Quake near Concepcion, Chi.caption_short: This map of topography and water depth reveals subduction’s influence on the West Coast of South America near the epicenter of the 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Chile on February 27, 2010.

Windy Weather Carries Dust over Egypt an.title: Windy Weather Carries Dust over Egypt and Saudi Arabia
Windy Weather Carries Dust over Egypt an.caption_short: Dense plumes of dust blow east across Saudi Arabia in this natural-color satellite image from February 26, 2010.

Violent Storm Strikes Western Europe.title: Violent Storm Strikes Western Europe
Violent Storm Strikes Western Europe.caption_short: Acquired February 27, 2010, this true-color image shows storm clouds extending from the Atlantic Ocean across Portugal, Spain, France, and northern Italy.

Mal&eacute; Atoll, Maldive Islands, Indi.title: Malé Atoll, Maldive Islands, Indian Ocean
Mal&eacute; Atoll, Maldive Islands, Indi.caption_short: This detailed astronaut photograph features surface currents illuminated by mirror-like reflections of sunlight off the waters around the Malée Atoll in the Maldive Islands.

Acraman Impact Structure, South Australi.title: Acraman Impact Structure, South Australia
Acraman Impact Structure, South Australi.caption_short: Acquired February 18, 2010, this true-color image shows Lake Acraman and surrounding saltpans in South Australia. The sprawling saltpans appear off-white, and the largely bare soils appear in shades of orange and brown.

Haze Over Santiago Following 8.8 Earthqu.title: Haze Over Santiago Following 8.8 Earthquake
Haze Over Santiago Following 8.8 Earthqu.caption_short: Black smoke lingered over the metropolitan area of Santiago, Chile, following a magnitude 8.8 earthquake on February 27, 2010.

Collision Calves Iceberg from Mertz Glac.title: Collision Calves Iceberg from Mertz Glacier Tongue, Antarctica
Collision Calves Iceberg from Mertz Glac.caption_short: This series of true color satellite images show the massive B-09B iceberg on a collision course with the Mertz Glacier Tongue in East Antarctica. The collision broke the ice tongue away from the glacier, creating another vast iceberg.

Chaiten Volcano and the Surrounding Area.title: Chaiten Volcano and the Surrounding Area
Chaiten Volcano and the Surrounding Area.caption_short: Although it has quieted in recent months, Chaitén Volcano remains active. Crystal clear skies reveal the volcano and the surrounding area in this natural-color satellite image from February 25, 2010.

Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, Vietnam,.title: Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, China
Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, Vietnam,.caption_short: Hundreds of active fires were burning across the hills and valleys of Burma (Myanmar), Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, and southern China on February 26, 2010.

Soufriere Hills Volcano Resumes Activity.title: Soufriere Hills Volcano Resumes Activity
Soufriere Hills Volcano Resumes Activity.caption_short: Soufrière Hills volcano emitted thick ash plumes and exhibited a summit hot spot in mid-October, 2009.

Terra Tracks Earth&rsquo;s Vital Signs.title: Terra Tracks Earth’s Vital Signs
Terra Tracks Earth&rsquo;s Vital Signs.caption_short: This collection of image highlights several of the Earth’s vital signs monitored by NASA’s Terra mission, which began observing our planet a decade ago this month.

Snow Blankets the Rocky Mountains.title: Snow Blankets the Rocky Mountains
Snow Blankets the Rocky Mountains.caption_short: Acquired February 23, 2010, this true-color images shows snow cover stretching from northern Arizona to South Dakota under largely cloud-free skies.

Southern Madeira.title: Southern Madeira
Southern Madeira.caption_short: This detailed image, taken by the Advanced Land Imager on NASA’s EO-1 satellite on March 7, 2007, illustrates how the steep mountains and deep ravines contributed to a flooding disaster in February 2010.

Valley Fog in British Columbia.title: Valley Fog in British Columbia
Valley Fog in British Columbia.caption_short: Acquired February 21, 2010, these true- and false-color images of British Columbia show fog filling mountain valleys northeast of Vancouver. In the false-color image, vegetation appears bright green, snow appears bright turquoise, and fog appears as a very pale, muted blue-green.

Polar Mesospheric Clouds, Southern Hemis.title: Polar Mesospheric Clouds, Southern Hemisphere
Polar Mesospheric Clouds, Southern Hemis.caption_short: Night-shining clouds high in the atmosphere over the southern polar region appear in shades of blue and orange in this astronaut photo from January 30, 2010.

&ldquo;Super Pit&rdquo; Mine, Kalgoorlie.title: “Super Pit” Mine, Kalgoorlie, Western Australia
&ldquo;Super Pit&rdquo; Mine, Kalgoorlie.caption_short: Acquired February 15, 2010, this true-color image shows the Super Pit Mine in Western Australia and part of the neighboring metropolitan area of Kalgoorlie.

Astronauts&rsquo; New Window on the Worl.title: Astronauts’ New Window on the World
Astronauts&rsquo; New Window on the Worl.caption_short: Primarily designed to give astronauts a way to see the outside of the ISS, it also provides stunning panoramic views of Earth and space.

Tropical Cyclone Gelane.title: Tropical Cyclone Gelane
Tropical Cyclone Gelane.caption_short: Acquired February 19, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Gelane over the southern Indian Ocean. The storm’s spiral arms span hundreds of kilometers, but no landmasses appear in this image.

Volcanoes Erupt Simultaneously on Kamcha.title: Volcanoes Erupt Simultaneously on Kamchatka
Volcanoes Erupt Simultaneously on Kamcha.caption_short: False-color images show Klyuchevskaya and Bezymianny releasing plumes over the snowy Kamchatka Peninsula.

Fires in Western Australia Nature Reserv.title: Fires in Western Australia Nature Reserve
Fires in Western Australia Nature Reserv.caption_short: Large bushfires affected remote areas in Western Australia, including Lake Dundas Nature Reserve, on February 18, 2010.

Davenport-Murchison Range, Northern Terr.title: Davenport-Murchison Range, Northern Territory, Australia
Davenport-Murchison Range, Northern Terr.caption_short: The Davenport Ranges of central Australia, known for their striking oval and zigzag patterns, are one of many dramatic landscapes mapped during the 2000 Shuttle Radar Topography Mission.

Alluvial Fans in Northeastern Egypt.title: Alluvial Fans in Northeastern Egypt
Alluvial Fans in Northeastern Egypt.caption_short: Acquired November 13, 2009, this false-color image shows an abrupt transition between rugged hills and flat floodplains in northeastern Egypt.

Heavy Rains in Central Australia.title: Heavy Rains in Central Australia
Heavy Rains in Central Australia.caption_short: This color-coded image shows total rainfall amounts in Australia from February 7 to 13, 2010. Light green indicates the lightest amounts and dark blue indicates the heaviest amounts.

Partial Dome Collapse at Soufriere Hills.title: Partial Dome Collapse at Soufriere Hills
Partial Dome Collapse at Soufriere Hills.caption_short: Acquired February 11, 2010, this true-color image shows a massive volcanic plume hovering over, and completely obscuring, the Caribbean island of Montserrat.

Snow in Coastal North Carolina.title: Snow in Coastal North Carolina
Snow in Coastal North Carolina.caption_short: A blanket of white snow covers coastal North Carolina in this natural-color satellite image from February 14, 2010.

Volcanic Plume over Shiveluch Volcano.title: Volcanic Plume over Shiveluch Volcano
Volcanic Plume over Shiveluch Volcano.caption_short: Acquired February 13, 2010, this image shows a plume rising from Shiveluch Volcano and dark flows streaking the southern slopes.

Gulf Coast Snow.title: Gulf Coast Snow
Gulf Coast Snow.caption_short: A swath of snow stretches from Mississippi, across Alabama, and into Georgia in this photo-like satellite image from February 13, 2010.

Second Blizzard Strikes U.S. East Coast.title: Second Blizzard Strikes U.S. East Coast
Second Blizzard Strikes U.S. East Coast.caption_short: Acquired February 11,2010, this true-color image shows snow blanketing much of the U.S. East Coast and stretching far inland.

Tropical Cyclone Rene.title: Tropical Cyclone Rene
Tropical Cyclone Rene.caption_short: Acquired February 12, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Rene spanning hundreds of miles over the southern Pacific Ocean, as well as the islands of Samoa and American Samoa.

Rio Negro Floodplain, Patagonia, Argenti.title: Rio Negro Floodplain, Patagonia, Argentina
Rio Negro Floodplain, Patagonia, Argenti.caption_short: This astronaut photo from January 4, 2010, shows meander scars and oxbow lakes in the floodplain of the Rio Negro in South America.

Devils Lake, North Dakota.title: Devils Lake, North Dakota
Devils Lake, North Dakota.caption_short: Acquired on August 11, 1984 (top), and September 1, 2009 (bottom), these true-color images show dramatic expansion of Devils Lake in North Dakota. In the 1990s, the lake began flooding, spilling into neighboring Stump Lake.

Coronal Mass Ejection in late January 20.title: Coronal Mass Ejection in late January 2010
Coronal Mass Ejection in late January 20.caption_short: Fiery arcs rise above an active region on the surface of the Sun in this pair of images of a coronal mass ejection on January 27, 2010.

Winter Olympics in Vancouver.title: Winter Olympics in Vancouver
Winter Olympics in Vancouver.caption_short: Acquired December 2, 2009, this image shows show area around the Olympic Village in Vancouver, British Columbia. Images on the right are close-up views.

Submarine Volcano Fukutoku-Okanoba Erupt.title: Submarine Volcano Fukutoku-Okanoba Erupts
Submarine Volcano Fukutoku-Okanoba Erupt.caption_short: Acquired February 11, 2010, this true-color image shows water discoloration immediately west of the underwater summit of Fukutoku-Okanoba. Clouds overhead might result from vapor emissions, but might be unrelated to volcanic activity.

Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, and Viet.title: Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, and Vietnam
Fires in Burma, Thailand, Laos, and Viet.caption_short: Fires dotted the landscape between Burma and Vietnam on February 10, 2010.

Dust Plumes over the Canary Islands.title: Dust Plumes over the Canary Islands
Dust Plumes over the Canary Islands.caption_short: Acquired February 6, 2010, this true-color image shows a thin veil of dust blowing past the Canary Islands, gradually curving toward the southwest south of El Hierro.

Tropical Cyclone Pat.title: Tropical Cyclone Pat
Tropical Cyclone Pat.caption_short: Acquired February 9, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Pat spanning hundreds of kilometers over the southern Pacific Ocean.

Heavy Rain in Uruguay.title: Heavy Rain in Uruguay
Heavy Rain in Uruguay.caption_short: Covering the period from February 1 to February 7, 2010, these images show total rainfall (left image) and rainfall anomalies (right image) for the region around Buenos Aires and Uruguay. Deepest blue corresponds to heaviest rain in each image.

Dust over Iran.title: Dust over Iran
Dust over Iran.caption_short: Acquired February 8, 2010, this true-color image shows thick dust plumes over Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and the Gulf of Oman.

Heavy Snow around U.S. Capital.title: Heavy Snow around U.S. Capital
Heavy Snow around U.S. Capital.caption_short: Acquired February 7, 2010, this true-color image shows snow blanketing much of the U.S. East Coast. Snow extends hundreds of kilometers inland from the Atlantic coastline, but thins near New York City.

Open Pit Mines, Southern Arizona.title: Open Pit Mines, Southern Arizona
Open Pit Mines, Southern Arizona.caption_short: This astronaut photograph illustrates three open-pit copper mines located west-northwest of the town of Green Valley, Arizona.

Dallas.title: Dallas
Dallas.caption_short: This pair of images shows explosively growing suburbs—“boomburbs”—north of Dallas, Texas.

Cyclone Oli.title: Cyclone Oli
Cyclone Oli.caption_short: Comma-shaped Cyclone Oli was a formidable Category 4 cyclone moving over French Polynesia in the South Pacific when this true-color image was captured on the afternoon of February 4, 2010.

Karachi, Pakistan.title: Karachi, Pakistan
Karachi, Pakistan.caption_short: Acquired January 8, 2010, this true-color image shows part of Karachi, Pakistan, a city of over 12 million residents. Heavily urbanized areas mix with rivers and mangroves, especially near the Port of Karachi.

Lusi Mud Volcano, Indonesia.title: Lusi Mud Volcano, Indonesia
Lusi Mud Volcano, Indonesia.caption_short: Lusi, the world’s largest and fastest growing mud volcano, had developed the mound-like shape of a volcano when this false-color image was acquired in October 2009, two and a half years after its birth.

Tropical Storm Oli.title: Tropical Storm Oli
Tropical Storm Oli.caption_short: Acquired at 21:00 UTC February 2 (10:00 a.m. February 3 in New Zealand), this image shows storm clouds from Tropical Cyclone Oli over the South Pacific.

Snow-Capped Llaima Volcano in Springtime.title: Snow-Capped Llaima Volcano in Springtime
Snow-Capped Llaima Volcano in Springtime.caption_short: Acquired December 11, 2009, this true-color image shows a layer of snow resting on the summit of Llaima Volcano. The slopes appear in a combination of purple-brown and green, probably a combination of volcanic rock and vegetation.

Tropical Cyclone Fami.title: Tropical Cyclone Fami
Tropical Cyclone Fami.caption_short: Acquired February 2, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Fami over Madagascar.

Soufriere Hills Volcano Continues Activi.title: Soufriere Hills Volcano Continues Activity
Soufriere Hills Volcano Continues Activi.caption_short: After 10 months of relative quiet, Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat continued activity in October 2009.

Ice and Clouds in the Bering Strait.title: Ice and Clouds in the Bering Strait
Ice and Clouds in the Bering Strait.caption_short: Acquired January 16, 2010, this true-color image shows sea ice spanning the Bering Strait, and parallel rows of clouds extending toward the southwest.

Flooding near Machu Picchu, Peru.title: Flooding near Machu Picchu, Peru
Flooding near Machu Picchu, Peru.caption_short: Acquired February 1, 2010, this false-color image shows the Andes Mountains in the wake of flooding in the region. Vegetation appears bright red, clouds appear white, and rivers appear blue-gray and white.

Plume and Ash from Karymsky Volcano.title: Plume and Ash from Karymsky Volcano
Plume and Ash from Karymsky Volcano.caption_short: A plume rises above Karymsky Volcano’s ash-covered summit in this image from January 28, 2010.

Artificial Archipelagos, Dubai, United A.title: Artificial Archipelagos, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
Artificial Archipelagos, Dubai, United A.caption_short: Taken January 13, 2010, this astronaut photograph shows two artificial archipelagos along the Dubai coast: Palm Jumeirah and The World. The image also shows the 800-meter-tall Bhurj Khalifa high rise building.

Chiyli Crater, Kazakhstan.title: Chiyli Crater, Kazakhstan
Chiyli Crater, Kazakhstan.caption_short: Acquired October 10, 2007, this false-color image shows Chiyli Crater in western Kazakhstan. Vegetation appears red, and clings primarily to riverbanks near the crater. Sunlight illuminates south-facing slopes, including the central peak of the crater.

Patagonian Bloom.title: Patagonian Bloom
Patagonian Bloom.caption_short: Streaks of blue and green color the South Atlantic Ocean in this image from January 9 2010.

Melt Season in the Arctic Getting Longer.title: Melt Season in the Arctic Getting Longer
Melt Season in the Arctic Getting Longer.caption_short: Satellite data revealed changes in the average start of spring melting and the first autumn freeze.

Tropical Cyclone Olga.title: Tropical Cyclone Olga
Tropical Cyclone Olga.caption_short: Acquired January 27, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Olga over the Gulf of Carpentaria.

Yellow River Delta, 1989 and 2009.title: Yellow River Delta, 1989 and 2009
Yellow River Delta, 1989 and 2009.caption_short: Chinese engineers changed the main channel through the delta, changing the shape of the land at the river’s mouth.

Patagonian Dust over the Atlantic Ocean.title: Patagonian Dust over the Atlantic Ocean
Patagonian Dust over the Atlantic Ocean.caption_short: In this photo-like image of a dust storm blowing out of southern Argentina, turbulence creates ripples in a cloud of dust that complements the long waves of color created by a phytoplankton bloom in the Atlantic Ocean below.

Dasht-e Lut Dust Storm.title: Dasht-e Lut Dust Storm
Dasht-e Lut Dust Storm.caption_short: Pale tan dust billows over the Dasht-e Lut in eastern Iran in this photo-like image from January 23, 2010.

Water Use On Idaho&rsquo;s Snake River P.title: Water Use On Idaho’s Snake River Plain
Water Use On Idaho&rsquo;s Snake River P.caption_short: Natural vegetation and irrigated farmland along the Snake River Plain in Idaho use dramatically different amounts of water during the growing season.

Tsauchab River and Sossus Vlei Lakebed,.title: Tsauchab River and Sossus Vlei Lakebed, Namibia
Tsauchab River and Sossus Vlei Lakebed,.caption_short: A pale, dry riverbed cuts through the red dunes of the Namib Sand Sea.

Avignon, France.title: Avignon, France
Avignon, France.caption_short: Acquired December 15, 2009, this true-color image shows Avignon, France, immediately east of the Rhône River. Walls surround the city’s historic center. Industrial-style buildings predominate in the southwest and southeast.

2009 Ends Warmest Decade on Record.title: 2009 Ends Warmest Decade on Record
2009 Ends Warmest Decade on Record.caption_short: These maps illustrate just how much warmer temperatures were in 2009 and the decade (2000-2009) compared to average temperatures recorded between 1951 and 1980.

Cyclone Magda Comes Ashore.title: Cyclone Magda Comes Ashore
Cyclone Magda Comes Ashore.caption_short: Acquired January 22, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Magda coming ashore along the coast of Western Australia.

Storms in California.title: Storms in California
Storms in California.caption_short: Acquired January 20, 2010, this true-color image shows an apostrophe-shaped storm, looking slightly like a hurricane without most of its center, over the California coast. Isolated areas of clear sky show the Central Valley and Baja Peninsula.

7.0 Quake Near Port Au Prince.title: 7.0 Quake Near Port Au Prince
7.0 Quake Near Port Au Prince.caption_short: This map shows the region around the earthquake that struck the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on January 12, 2010. Blue areas indicate water and brown areas indicate land. Lighter colors indicate higher elevation or shallower depth. Circles indicate earthquake locations, with circle size corresponding to earthquake magnitude. Lines indicate faults.

Ships Arriving in Port-au-Prince, Haiti.title: Ships Arriving in Port-au-Prince, Haiti
Ships Arriving in Port-au-Prince, Haiti.caption_short: Acquired January 21, 2010, this false-color image shows Port-au-Prince nine days after a severe earthquake, as relief ships sail into the newly restored port.

Ice on the St Lawrence River, Canada.title: Ice on the St Lawrence River, Canada
Ice on the St Lawrence River, Canada.caption_short: Still fragile and shaped by the river currents, a thin layer of new ice formed over Québec, Canada’s, St. Lawrence River in mid-January 2010.

Floods in Australian Channel Country.title: Floods in Australian Channel Country
Floods in Australian Channel Country.caption_short: Acquired on January 18, 2010, and December 23, 2009, these false-color images show changes brought by heavy rains to southwestern Queensland. Water appears electric blue, clouds appear sky blue, vegetation appears bright green, and land appears pink-brown.

Dust over Queensland, Australia.title: Dust over Queensland, Australia
Dust over Queensland, Australia.caption_short: Tan strands of wind-blown dust blow north across Queensland, Australia, in this photo-like image from January 17, 2010.

Potential Landslides near Epicenter of H.title: Potential Landslides near Epicenter of Haiti Quake
Potential Landslides near Epicenter of H.caption_short: This true-color image from January 15, 2010, highlights potential new landslides near the epicenter of Haiti’s massive 7.0 earthquake.

Greater Bridgetown Area, Barbados.title: Greater Bridgetown Area, Barbados
Greater Bridgetown Area, Barbados.caption_short: Taken December 16, 2009, this astronaut photograph shows the greater metropolitan area of Bridgetown, Barbados. Gray-and-white urban areas along the coast contrast with green vegetation inland.

Iceberg off Mertz Glacier Tongue.title: Iceberg off Mertz Glacier Tongue
Iceberg off Mertz Glacier Tongue.caption_short: Acquired January 10, 2010, this true-color image shows an iceberg measuring roughly 8.5 by 9.5 kilometers drifting off the edge off the Mertz Glacier Tongue in East Antarctica.

Annular Solar Eclipse over India.title: Annular Solar Eclipse over India
Annular Solar Eclipse over India.caption_short: Acquired January 15, 2010, this true-color image shows India and the Bay of Bengal, both darkened by an annular eclipse. A white line marks the Indian coastline.

Port-Au-Prince, Haiti.title: Port-Au-Prince, Haiti
Port-Au-Prince, Haiti.caption_short: This regional view of Port-Au-Prince, Haiti, from January 15, 2010, shows the densely developed urban area and the limited number of transportation hubs available for bringing aid into the earthquake-hit nation.

Rapid Sea Ice Breakup along the Ronne-Fi.title: Rapid Sea Ice Breakup along the Ronne-Filchner Ice Shelf
Rapid Sea Ice Breakup along the Ronne-Fi.caption_short: An area of sea ice larger than the state of Rhode Island can be seen breaking from the Ronne-Filchner Ice Shelf in this series of photo-like images.

Topography Along the Enriquillo-Plaintai.title: Topography Along the Enriquillo-Plaintain Garden Fault, Haiti
Topography Along the Enriquillo-Plaintai.caption_short: A long valley reveals the location of the Enriquillo-Plaintain Garden Fault in southern Haiti, the site of a deadly earthquake in mid-January 2010.

Currents Collide and Coastal Waters Bloo.title: Currents Collide and Coastal Waters Bloom off Patagonia
Currents Collide and Coastal Waters Bloo.caption_short: The convergence of warm and cold currents off the coast of Patagonia helps fuel large blooms of phytoplankton. This pair of images shows temperature and chlorophyll in November 2009.

Snow across U.S. Midwest.title: Snow across U.S. Midwest
Snow across U.S. Midwest.caption_short: Acquired January 10, 2010, this true-color image shows snow cover stretching from Oklahoma to Pennsylvania. Snow thins toward the southwest.

Tropical Cyclone Edzani.title: Tropical Cyclone Edzani
Tropical Cyclone Edzani.caption_short: Acquired January 7, 2010, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Edzani over the Southern Indian Ocean. The storm has a well-defined eye surrounded by spiral arms spanning several hundred kilometers.

Snow around the Aral Sea.title: Snow around the Aral Sea
Snow around the Aral Sea.caption_short: Acquired January 8, 2010, this true-color image shows snow surrounding the Aral Sea. A broad band of snow that crosses over the sea thins toward the southeast.

Giens Peninsula, France.title: Giens Peninsula, France
Giens Peninsula, France.caption_short: This astronaut photograph from December 2, 2009, shows urban areas around the Giens Peninsula, on the French Riviera.

Booming Growth in Phoenix Suburbs.title: Booming Growth in Phoenix Suburbs
Booming Growth in Phoenix Suburbs.caption_short: Acquired in 1989 and 2009, these images show rapid development of Chandler, Arizona, a “boomburb.”

Winter Temperatures and the Arctic Oscil.title: Winter Temperatures and the Arctic Oscillation
Winter Temperatures and the Arctic Oscil.caption_short: Much of the Northern Hemisphere experienced cold land surface temperatures in December 2009, but the Arctic was exceptionally warm.

Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Iran.title: Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Iran
Dust Storm over Afghanistan and Iran.caption_short: A thick plume of dust rises from the dry Sistan Wetlands and blows across the Iran-Afghanistan border in this photo-like image from January 7, 2010.

Iceberg B17-B in the Indian Ocean.title: Iceberg B17-B in the Indian Ocean
Iceberg B17-B in the Indian Ocean.caption_short: Iceberg B17-B resembles a cartoon drawing of a whale in this image from December 30, 2009.

Volcanic Plume, Gaua Volcano.title: Volcanic Plume, Gaua Volcano
Volcanic Plume, Gaua Volcano.caption_short: A plume of ash and steam rises from Gaua Volcano in this satellite image.

Heavy Snow in Eastern China.title: Heavy Snow in Eastern China
Heavy Snow in Eastern China.caption_short: Acquired January 4, 2010, this true-color image shows snow coating the area around Bo Hai. Beijing and Tianjin leave big gray splotches on the snowy blanket, and smaller cities appear as small gray dots.

Heavy Snow in Korea.title: Heavy Snow in Korea
Heavy Snow in Korea.caption_short: Acquired January 3, 2010, this true-color image shows snowfall on the Korean Peninsula and cloud streets over the Sea of Japan (East Sea).

Earthquakes in the Solomon Islands, Paci.title: Earthquakes in the Solomon Islands, Pacific Ocean
Earthquakes in the Solomon Islands, Paci.caption_short: The contrast in ocean depths between the Australia Plate and the Pacific Plate near the Solomon islands reveals the subduction of the former beneath its northeastern neighbor. This subduction was responsible for the 7.2-magnitude quake on January 4, 2010.

Flooding in New South Wales.title: Flooding in New South Wales
Flooding in New South Wales.caption_short: Acquired on January 4, 2010, and December 22, 2009, these false-color images show the difference heavy rains can make on usually dry land. The image from January 2010 shows a newly created water body in New South Wales.

Evaporation Ponds, Salar de Atacama, Chi.title: Evaporation Ponds, Salar de Atacama, Chile
Evaporation Ponds, Salar de Atacama, Chi.caption_short: This astronaut photo from December 15, 2009, shows evaporation ponds in the Atacama Desert, where brines are evaporated to concentrate lithium salts.

Kabul, Afghanistan.title: Kabul, Afghanistan
Kabul, Afghanistan.caption_short: Acquired September 24, 2009, this false-color image shows the rapidly growing city of Kabul, Afghanistan. Vegetation is green, urbanized areas are gray to black, and bare ground is beige to red-brown.

Whitsunday Islands, Queensland, Australi.title: Whitsunday Islands, Queensland, Australia
Whitsunday Islands, Queensland, Australi.caption_short: The Whitsunday Islands are a collection of some 74 islands sandwiched between the Australian mainland and the outer atolls of the Great Barrier Reef.

Mangroves, Dunes, and Desert on Baja Cal.title: Mangroves, Dunes, and Desert on Baja California
Mangroves, Dunes, and Desert on Baja Cal.caption_short: Pale fields of sand dunes are interspersed with deep green, mangrove-lined streams on the southern Baja Peninsula.

North Sentinel Island, Andaman Sea.title: North Sentinel Island, Andaman Sea
North Sentinel Island, Andaman Sea.caption_short: This photo-like image shows North Sentinel Island, in the Andaman Sea, almost five years after the devastating 2004 Aceh-Andaman Earthquake raised its surrounding reefs above the water line.

Mayon Volcano Threatens Major Eruption.title: Mayon Volcano Threatens Major Eruption
Mayon Volcano Threatens Major Eruption.caption_short: A small plume of ash and/or steam is blowing west from the summit of Mayon Volcano in this image from December 15, 2009.

Snow From Severe Winter Storm Dips into.title: Snow From Severe Winter Storm Dips into Texas
Snow From Severe Winter Storm Dips into.caption_short: Acquired December 26, 2009, this image shows the edge of snow cover in northern Texas, near the town of Snyder.

Phytoplankton Bloom Over Chatham Rise, S.title: Phytoplankton Bloom Over Chatham Rise, South Pacific
Phytoplankton Bloom Over Chatham Rise, S.caption_short: An expansive bloom of phytoplankton traced colorful swirls across the South Pacific Ocean between New Zealand (left) and the Chatham Islands (right) on December 23, 2009.

Snow in Southern Central United States.title: Snow in Southern Central United States
Snow in Southern Central United States.caption_short: Acquired December 25, 2009, this true-color image shows snow stretching from Colorado and New Mexico across Texas and Oklahoma, and into Kansas, Missouri, and Arkansas.

Dust over Eastern China.title: Dust over Eastern China
Dust over Eastern China.caption_short: China’s Bo Hai and the adjacent inland basin were shrouded with yellow dust on March 15, 2009.

Sand Dunes in the Tenere Desert, Niger.title: Sand Dunes in the Tenere Desert, Niger
Sand Dunes in the Tenere Desert, Niger.caption_short: Layers of dunes march across a sand sea in the east-central Tenéré Desert of Niger in this astronaut photo from December 1, 2009.

Central Athens, Greece.title: Central Athens, Greece
Central Athens, Greece.caption_short: Acquired July 2, 2004, this true-color image shows central Athens, including famous sites from antiquity and an industrialized area to the west.

Mangroves and Coral Reefs, Viti Levu, Fi.title: Mangroves and Coral Reefs, Viti Levu, Fiji
Mangroves and Coral Reefs, Viti Levu, Fi.caption_short: Deep green forest on land and the delicate turquoise coral reef in the ocean mirror each other in this true-color image of Viti Levu, Fiji, from December 18, 2009.

Deadly Cold Across Europe and Russia.title: Deadly Cold Across Europe and Russia
Deadly Cold Across Europe and Russia.caption_short: Land surface temperatures across Europe and Russia were far below the 2000–2008 average in mid-December 2009.

Terra Tracks Atlantic Dust Storms.title: Terra Tracks Atlantic Dust Storms
Terra Tracks Atlantic Dust Storms.caption_short: Observations from different sensors on NASA’s Terra satellite are combined to track the spread of Saharan dust across the Atlantic Ocean.

Tropical Cyclone Laurence.title: Tropical Cyclone Laurence
Tropical Cyclone Laurence.caption_short: Acquired December 16, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Laurence spanning hundreds of kilometers over the Indian Ocean, just off the Australian coast.

Snow Storm Buries the U.S. East Coast.title: Snow Storm Buries the U.S. East Coast
Snow Storm Buries the U.S. East Coast.caption_short: The Mid-Atlantic states were completely white on Sunday, December 20, 2009, in the wake of a record-breaking snow storm.

Snowstorm Hits the U.S. East Coast.title: Snowstorm Hits the U.S. East Coast
Snowstorm Hits the U.S. East Coast.caption_short: Heavy snow blanketed the U.S. East Coast on the first day of winter 2009.

Cloud Formations and Sunglint, Italy.title: Cloud Formations and Sunglint, Italy
Cloud Formations and Sunglint, Italy.caption_short: An extreme sideways viewing angle and the mirror-like reflection of sunlight off water creates a dramatic astronaut photo of clouds over Italy’s Calabrian Peninsula.

Sunrise Dam Gold Mine.title: Sunrise Dam Gold Mine
Sunrise Dam Gold Mine.caption_short: Acquired December 4, 2009, this true-color image shows the Sunrise Dam Gold Mine, roughly 55 kilometers (35 miles) south of Laverton, Western Australia.

Iceberg B17-B Adrift Off the Southwester.title: Iceberg B17-B Adrift Off the Southwestern Coast of Australia
Iceberg B17-B Adrift Off the Southwester.caption_short: Captured between early November and early December 2009, these true-color images show the changes in iceberg B17-B as it drifts northward from Antarctica toward Australia.

Terra Turns Ten: Snow, Clouds, and Sunli.title: Terra Turns Ten: Snow, Clouds, and Sunlight
Terra Turns Ten: Snow, Clouds, and Sunli.caption_short: This trio of global maps illustrates how snow and clouds make Earth more reflective.

Heavy Rain in the Southeastern United St.title: Heavy Rain in the Southeastern United States
Heavy Rain in the Southeastern United St.caption_short: This color-coded image shows rainfall amounts over the southeastern United States from December 9 to 15, 2009. Heaviest amounts appear in blue and lightest amounts appear in green.

Fires near Perth, Western Australia.title: Fires near Perth, Western Australia
Fires near Perth, Western Australia.caption_short: A fire in a Western Australia state forest near Dwellingup billows smoke over the Indian Ocean on December 15, 2009.

Black Soot and the Survival of Tibetan G.title: Black Soot and the Survival of Tibetan Glaciers
Black Soot and the Survival of Tibetan G.caption_short: Model simulations track the movement of black soot pollution over the Tibetan Plateau from August–November 2009. This image shows haze on September 26, 2009.

Cyclone Mick.title: Cyclone Mick
Cyclone Mick.caption_short: Acquired December 13, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Mick spanning the islands of Fiji.

Lake Ilopango, El Salvador.title: Lake Ilopango, El Salvador
Lake Ilopango, El Salvador.caption_short: This astronaut photo shows the blue-green waters of Lake Ilopango, which fills the caldera of a volcano in El Salvador that last erupted in 1879.

The Island of Malta.title: The Island of Malta
The Island of Malta.caption_short: Acquired August 12, 2009, this true-color image shows the Mediterranean island of Malta, the largest island in the Republic of Malta archipelago.

Drought in Southeast Australia.title: Drought in Southeast Australia
Drought in Southeast Australia.caption_short: This pair of images shows vegetation conditions in southeastern Australia&rsquos; Wheatbelt in 2005, the last year this decade with favorable growing conditions, and 2009, at the end of three consecutive years of drought.

El Ni&ntilde;o Strengthens in November 2.title: El Niño Strengthens in November 2009
El Ni&ntilde;o Strengthens in November 2.caption_short: These color-coded images show the strengthening of El Niño between October and November 2009. In the November image, warm waters (indicated in red) have spread across the Pacific.

Winter Storm Crosses the United States.title: Winter Storm Crosses the United States
Winter Storm Crosses the United States.caption_short: Acquired December 9, 2009, this image combines observations from Terra and Aqua to show snow cover across the western and central United States.

Winter Storm Crosses United States.title: Winter Storm Crosses United States
Winter Storm Crosses United States.caption_short: This image of the United States from December 8, 2009, shows a blanket of snow across the West along with a thick swirl of storm clouds over the Great Plains from North Dakota to Oklahoma.

Flooding Along the Rio Negro, Uruguay.title: Flooding Along the Rio Negro, Uruguay
Flooding Along the Rio Negro, Uruguay.caption_short: Acquired December 4, 2009, this true-color image shows a flood-ravaged city, Paso de Los Toros, just north of the swollen Rio Negro in central Uruguay.

Ash Plume from Tavurvur, Papua New Guine.title: Ash Plume from Tavurvur, Papua New Guinea
Ash Plume from Tavurvur, Papua New Guine.caption_short: A grayish white plume of ash drifted north from Tavurvur Cone on the rim of Rabaul Caldera when the Advanced Land Imager on NASA’s Earth Observing-1 (EO-1) satellite captured this image on November 30, 2009.

Ambrym Volcano.title: Ambrym Volcano
Ambrym Volcano.caption_short: Ambrym volcano emits a thin plume in this NASA satellite image from December 3, 2009.

Flooding in Brazil, Argentina, and Urugu.title: Flooding in Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay
Flooding in Brazil, Argentina, and Urugu.caption_short: This image shows rainfall estimates for Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil from November 19–25, 2009. Heaviest rainfall amounts appear in dark blue, and lightest rainfall amounts appear in page green.

Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.title: Pearl Harbor, Hawaii
Pearl Harbor, Hawaii.caption_short: Located on the highly populated Hawaiian island of Oahu just west of Honolulu, Pearl Harbor is the historic center of events on “the day that will live in infamy”—December 7, 1941—when the Japanese fleet launched a surprise air attack on Pearl Harbor and other strategic military targets on Oahu.  The ISS-6 Space Station crew obtained this high-resolution image of Pearl Harbor in March 2003, enabling detailed observations of the harbor and its multiple uses.

Chilla Wildlife Sanctuary, India.title: Chilla Wildlife Sanctuary, India
Chilla Wildlife Sanctuary, India.caption_short: Acquired November 27, 2009, this true-color image shows the Ganges River passing through the eastern portion of Rajaji National Park, past the city of Rishikesh and the Chilla Wildlife Sanctuary.

Rainfall from Philippine Typhoons.title: Rainfall from Philippine Typhoons
Rainfall from Philippine Typhoons.caption_short: Between May and October 2009, 12 tropical cyclones poured rain over the Philippine Islands. This image illustrates how much rain fell over the islands when the storms were active.

Flooding in Brazil and Uruguay.title: Flooding in Brazil and Uruguay
Flooding in Brazil and Uruguay.caption_short: Acquired on December 1, and October 28, 2009, these false-color images show flood waters inundating land around two lagoons: Lagoa dos Patos and Lagoa Mirim.

Harmful Bloom in Lake Atitl\u00c3\u00a1n.title: Harmful Bloom in Lake AtitlÃ¡n, Guatemala
Harmful Bloom in Lake Atitl\u00c3\u00a1n.caption_short: A large bloom of cyanobacteria, more commonly known as blue-green algae, spread across Guatemala’s Lake Atitlán in green filaments and strands that are clearly visible in this simulated-natural-color image from November 22, 2009.

Erg Iabes, Algeria.title: Erg Iabes, Algeria
Erg Iabes, Algeria.caption_short: This natural-color image from the Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus sensor on the Landsat 7 satellite shows the emptiness of the Erg Iabès in western Algeria’s Adrar province.

Tropical Storm Nida.title: Tropical Storm Nida
Tropical Storm Nida.caption_short: Acquired November 23, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Nida over the western Pacific Ocean, roughly 8 degrees north of the Equator. An apparent tower of clouds rises at the storm’s center.

Dust over Southeast Australia.title: Dust over Southeast Australia
Dust over Southeast Australia.caption_short: A tan plume of dust swept over southeastern Australia on November 29, 2009.

Springtime Heatwave in Southeastern Aust.title: Springtime Heatwave in Southeastern Australia
Springtime Heatwave in Southeastern Aust.caption_short: Land surface temperatures were far above average in southeastern Australia during a springtime heatwave in November 2009.

Ounianga Lakes, Sahara Desert, Chad.title: Ounianga Lakes, Sahara Desert, Chad
Ounianga Lakes, Sahara Desert, Chad.caption_short: This astronaut photograph features one of the largest of a series of ten mostly fresh water lakes in the Ounianga Basin in the heart of the Sahara Desert of northeastern Chad.

British Virgin Islands.title: British Virgin Islands
British Virgin Islands.caption_short: Acquired September 17, 2005, this true-color image shows Tortola, the largest of the British Virgin Islands. Also shown are Tortola’s smaller neighbors: Guana Island, Grand Camanoe, and Beef Island.

Tsingy de Bemaraha National Park, Madaga.title: Tsingy de Bemaraha National Park, Madagascar
Tsingy de Bemaraha National Park, Madaga.caption_short: Acquired January 16, 2005, this true-color image shows part of the inhospitable limestone landscape of western Madagascar, with bare rocks and vegetation forming a patchwork of gray and green.

Forest Change in Paraguay.title: Forest Change in Paraguay
Forest Change in Paraguay.caption_short: Between 1990 and 2000, Paraguay lost about 13 percent of its forests, including nearly 40 percent of the Atlantic Forest.

Shadow Cast by Bezymianny Volcano.title: Shadow Cast by Bezymianny Volcano
Shadow Cast by Bezymianny Volcano.caption_short: Bezymianny Volcano exhibited a modest plume and dramatic shadow in late November, 2009.

Wave Clouds from South Sandwich Islands.title: Wave Clouds from South Sandwich Islands
Wave Clouds from South Sandwich Islands.caption_short: Acquired November 23, 2009, this true-color image shows wave clouds formed by air currents passing over the South Sandwich Islands. The islands anchor the V-shaped clouds that spread out toward the east.

Landslides on Volcan de San Vicente.title: Landslides on Volcan de San Vicente
Landslides on Volcan de San Vicente.caption_short: The paths of more than a dozen lahars radiate down the flanks of  El Salvador’s Volcáan San Vicente in all directions following torrential rains in November 2009.

Savage Islands, Atlantic Ocean.title: Savage Islands, Atlantic Ocean
Savage Islands, Atlantic Ocean.caption_short: Bright white waves break along the fringing beaches of the Savage Islands in these astronaut photos from October 22, 2009.

Maupiti Island.title: Maupiti Island
Maupiti Island.caption_short: Low-profile fringing islands and coral reefs surround a relatively tall central island.

Spring Bloom in the South Atlantic Ocean.title: Spring Bloom in the South Atlantic Ocean
Spring Bloom in the South Atlantic Ocean.caption_short: Intense streaks of blue and green colored the South Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Argentina on November 15, 2009.

Fire in Western Australia&rsquo;s Nuytsl.title: Fire in Western Australia’s Nuytsland Nature Reserve
Fire in Western Australia&rsquo;s Nuytsl.caption_short: A thick plume of brownish smoke billowed from the Western Australia coast and over the Great Australian Bight on November 19, 2009.

Tehran Urbanization.title: Tehran Urbanization
Tehran Urbanization.caption_short: Explosive urban growth is documented in this pair of images of Tehran from 1985 and 2009.

Snow in Ontario.title: Snow in Ontario
Snow in Ontario.caption_short: Acquired November 18, 2009, this true-color image shows a broad band of snow stretching across Ontario. Snow appears thickest near James Bay and thinnest north of Lake Superior.

El Nino Resurging in November 2009.title: El Nino Resurging in November 2009
El Nino Resurging in November 2009.caption_short: A wave of warm water pooling in the central and eastern Pacific appears as a large area of higher-than-normal sea surface heights in this image from early November.

Mid-November Colorado Snowstorm.title: Mid-November Colorado Snowstorm
Mid-November Colorado Snowstorm.caption_short: Acquired November 17, 2009, this true-color image shows snow nearly covering the northeastern quadrant of Colorado and stretching into neighboring states.

Clouds Can Reveal Shape of Continents.title: Clouds Can Reveal Shape of Continents
Clouds Can Reveal Shape of Continents.caption_short: Even without a map overlay, global cloud patterns can reveal the shape and location of many of Earth’s continents. This global map of cloud fraction in October 2009 demonstrates the pattern.

Tropical Cyclone Anja.title: Tropical Cyclone Anja
Tropical Cyclone Anja.caption_short: Acquired November 16,2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Cyclone Anja over the Southern Indian ocean, far from any major landmasses.

Upsala Glacier, Argentina.title: Upsala Glacier, Argentina
Upsala Glacier, Argentina.caption_short: Upsala Glacier in the Southern Patagonian Icefield calves icebergs into Lake Argentina in this astronaut photo from October 25, 2009.

Sequoia National Park.title: Sequoia National Park
Sequoia National Park.caption_short: Acquired October 22, 2008, this true-color image of Sequoia National Park shows a network of varied ecosystem, including conifer forests, river valleys, alpine vegetation, and bare rocks.

Late Fall in the Adirondack Mountains.title: Late Fall in the Adirondack Mountains
Late Fall in the Adirondack Mountains.caption_short: The red and orange tones of autumn had faded to brown in the mountains of New York and Vermont when this true color image was taken on November 8, 2009. The contrast between the green and gold valleys and brown mountains help reveal the unique geography of the region.

Heavy Snow in Northern China.title: Heavy Snow in Northern China
Heavy Snow in Northern China.caption_short: Acquired November 13, 2009, these true- and false-color images show part of northeastern China shortly after a severe snowstorm. In the false-color image, snow appears orange-red, and clouds range in color from pale peach to white.

Phytoplankton Bloom off Chile.title: Phytoplankton Bloom off Chile
Phytoplankton Bloom off Chile.caption_short: Acquired November 10, 2009, this true-color image shows peacock-hued waters swirling off the coast of Chile, north and south of Punta Lavapié.

Glacier-capped Mountains in Tibet.title: Glacier-capped Mountains in Tibet
Glacier-capped Mountains in Tibet.caption_short: A range of glacier-capped mountains northwest of Lhasa, Tibet, casts long shadows in this winter-time image from the ASTER sensor on NASA’s Terra satellite.

Tropical Storm Phyan.title: Tropical Storm Phyan
Tropical Storm Phyan.caption_short: Acquired November 11, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Phyan straddling the coastline of India, near the Pakistan border.

Tropical Storm Ida.title: Tropical Storm Ida
Tropical Storm Ida.caption_short: Tropical Storm Ida sprawls over Nicaragua and Honduras in this natural-color image from November 5, 2009.

Katabatic Winds Rake Terra Nova Bay.title: Katabatic Winds Rake Terra Nova Bay
Katabatic Winds Rake Terra Nova Bay.caption_short: The scene provides a glimpse of the persistent and fierce downslope winds that blow from the interior of the Antarctic ice sheet toward the coast.

Hurricane Ida.title: Hurricane Ida
Hurricane Ida.caption_short: Hurricane Ida has a concentrated center of strong winds in this visualization of the storm’s wind field as observed by the QuikSCAT satellite on November 9, 2009.

Thunderstorms on the Brazilian Horizon.title: Thunderstorms on the Brazilian Horizon
Thunderstorms on the Brazilian Horizon.caption_short: Thunderstorms and other interesting clouds are captured in this astronaut photo over the Amazon Basin on October 6, 2009.

Dry Wadi Fills with Life.title: Dry Wadi Fills with Life
Dry Wadi Fills with Life.caption_short: These true-color images show a wadi in northern Niger on September 19, 2007, and September 18, 2009. The 2007 shows the wadi populated by plants that have taken advantage of recent precipitation.

Spring Bloom and Dust off Argentina.title: Spring Bloom and Dust off Argentina
Spring Bloom and Dust off Argentina.caption_short: The arc and waves of a pale brown plume of dust complement the swirls of blue and green in the South Atlantic Ocean in this photo-like image from November 5, 2009.

Flooding along the Illinois River.title: Flooding along the Illinois River
Flooding along the Illinois River.caption_short: Acquired November 4, 2009 (top), and October 24, 2009 (bottom), these images show the effects of heavy rains along the Illinois River. Vegetation appears bright green, water appears navy, and clouds appear pale blue-green in these false-color images.

Flooding in Eastern Arkansas.title: Flooding in Eastern Arkansas
Flooding in Eastern Arkansas.caption_short: Acquired on October 25 and November 1, 2009, these false-color images show flooding in eastern Arkansas, most obvious in the swollen White River.

Egyptian Dust Storm.title: Egyptian Dust Storm
Egyptian Dust Storm.caption_short: A pale plume of dust sweeps northeast from the Egyptian desert in this true-color image from November 4, 2009.

Oil Fire in India.title: Oil Fire in India
Oil Fire in India.caption_short: Thick black smoke billows from a fire burning at an oil depot in western India in this photo-like image taken on October 30, 2009.

October Snow in Colorado.title: October Snow in Colorado
October Snow in Colorado.caption_short: The mountains and plains of Colorado were blanketed with snow on October 3, 2009, after the season’s first blizzard.

Typhoon Mirinae.title: Typhoon Mirinae
Typhoon Mirinae.caption_short: Although Mirinae was weakening, its winds maintained the classic spiral structure associated with well-organized tropical cyclones in this image of the storm’s wind structure on November 1, 2009.

Glacial Dust off Alaska.title: Glacial Dust off Alaska
Glacial Dust off Alaska.caption_short: A pale brown plume of dust filled the Copper River Valley and arced over the Gulf of Alaska in this true-color image from October 29, 2009.

El Misti Volcano and Arequipa, Peru.title: El Misti Volcano and Arequipa, Peru
El Misti Volcano and Arequipa, Peru.caption_short: This astronaut photograph from October 16, 2009, shows Arequipa—Peru’ “White City”on the flanks of the towering El Misti Volcano.

Thorthormi Glacier Lake, Bhutan.title: Thorthormi Glacier Lake, Bhutan
Thorthormi Glacier Lake, Bhutan.caption_short: This natural-color image shows glaciers and glacial lakes in the Bhutan Himalaya on October 28, 2009.

Tropical Storm Mirinae.title: Tropical Storm Mirinae
Tropical Storm Mirinae.caption_short: Acquired October 27, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Mirinae extending a long arm toward the east as the storm blows over the west Pacific Ocean.

Ash Emissions at Nevado del Huila.title: Ash Emissions at Nevado del Huila
Ash Emissions at Nevado del Huila.caption_short: A column of ash punched through the omnipresent clouds above Nevado del Huila in Colombia during recent volcanic activity.

Oil Slick in the Timor Sea.title: Oil Slick in the Timor Sea
Oil Slick in the Timor Sea.caption_short: This image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite on August 30, 2009, shows the Timor Sea and what are probably oil slicks about 250 kilometers northwest of Western Australia.

By Reflecting Sunlight, Greenland Helps.title: By Reflecting Sunlight, Greenland Helps Keep the Arctic Cool
By Reflecting Sunlight, Greenland Helps.caption_short: This series of globes from June–August 2009 shows how sea ice, snow, and ice sheets in the Northern Hemisphere reflect large amounts of incoming sunlight and help keep the Arctic cool in the summer.

Spring Bloom in New Zealand Waters.title: Spring Bloom in New Zealand Waters
Spring Bloom in New Zealand Waters.caption_short: A phytoplankton bloom colored the waters east of New Zealand on October 25, 2009.

Dust Storm in North Central Australia.title: Dust Storm in North Central Australia
Dust Storm in North Central Australia.caption_short: Acquired October 26, 2009, this true-color image shows a dust plume spanning hundreds of kilometers in Northern Territory and western Queensland. A cluster of fires also burns in Queensland.

Fire at Fuel Storage Facility in Puerto.title: Fire at Fuel Storage Facility in Puerto Rico
