Fire at Fuel Storage Facility in Puerto.caption_short: A plume of dark brown smoke billows northwest from a fire at a Puerto Rico fuel storage facility in this image from October 23, 2009.

Chaiten Volcano, Chile.title: Chaiten Volcano, Chile
Chaiten Volcano, Chile.caption_short: Chileâ€™s Chaiten Volcano remained active in early 2009, releasing plumes of ash and steam.

Great Bitter Lake, Egypt.title: Great Bitter Lake, Egypt
Great Bitter Lake, Egypt.caption_short: Ships line up to pass each other in the Suez Canal’s Great Bitter Lake in this astronaut photo from October 2, 2009.

Tao-Rusyr Caldera, Onekotan Island, Kuri.title: Tao-Rusyr Caldera, Onekotan Island, Kuril Islands
Tao-Rusyr Caldera, Onekotan Island, Kuri.caption_short: Krenitzyn Peak rises from lake-filled Tao-Rusyr Caldera on southern Onekotan Island in this natural-color image from June 10, 2009.

El Ni&ntilde;o, La Ni&ntilde;a, and Rain.title: El Niño, La Niña, and Rainfall
El Ni&ntilde;o, La Ni&ntilde;a, and Rain.caption_short: For many people, El Niño and La Niña mean floods or drought, but the events are actually a warming or cooling of the eastern Pacific Ocean that impacts rainfall. These sea surface temperature and rainfall anomaly images show the direct correlation between ocean temperatures and rainfall during El Niño and La Niña events.

Earthquake off Samoa Generates Tsunami.title: Earthquake off Samoa Generates Tsunami
Earthquake off Samoa Generates Tsunami.caption_short: A large (magnitude 8.0) undersea earthquake near Samoa generated a destructive tsunami that killed over 100 people.

Hurricane Neki.title: Hurricane Neki
Hurricane Neki.caption_short: Acquired October 21, 2009, this true-color image shows Hurricane Neki over the Pacific Ocean, west-southwest of the big island of Hawaii.

Studying Plants, Permafrost, and Carbon.title: Studying Plants, Permafrost, and Carbon near Barrow, Alaska
Studying Plants, Permafrost, and Carbon.caption_short: Compared to a photo-like image, a false-color image of the lake-dotted tundra near Barrow, Alaska, reveals more detail about the different plant communities occupying wetter or drier areas of the landscape.

Tropical Storm Rick.title: Tropical Storm Rick
Tropical Storm Rick.caption_short: Acquired October 20, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Rick south of the tip of Baja California.

Mapping the Flow of Smoke.title: Mapping the Flow of Smoke
Mapping the Flow of Smoke.caption_short: Smoke from fires in southwestern Oregon drifted over much of Oregon in this true color image from late September 2009. The associated aerosol image reveals that the smoke reached as far east as eastern Montana and central Canada, illustrating that pollution travels long distances.

Category 5 Hurricane Rick.title: Category 5 Hurricane Rick
Category 5 Hurricane Rick.caption_short: Category 5 Hurricane Rick sprawls across the tropical East Pacific in this natural-color image form October 18, 2009.

Super Typhoon Lupit.title: Super Typhoon Lupit
Super Typhoon Lupit.caption_short: Acquired October 18, 2009, this true-color image shows Super Typohhon Lupit over the western Pacific Ocean. High, thick clouds appear northeast of the storm’s eye.

Hurricane Rick.title: Hurricane Rick
Hurricane Rick.caption_short: Acquired October 17, 2009, this true-color image shows Hurricane Rick over the eastern Pacific off the west coast of southern Mexico.

Ash and Steam Plume, Soufriere Hills Vol.title: Ash and Steam Plume, Soufriere Hills Volcano, Montserrat
Ash and Steam Plume, Soufriere Hills Vol.caption_short: An oblique photo of Montserrat Island taken by astronauts captures an eruption from the island’s Soufrière Hills Volcano on October 11, 2009.

Marion Island, South Africa.title: Marion Island, South Africa
Marion Island, South Africa.caption_short: Acquired on on May 5, 2009, this true-color image shows Marion Island in the Indian Ocean. Sparsely vegetated, this volcanic island has remnants of snow near its summit.

Kenya&rsquo;s Ewaso Nyiro River Dries.title: Kenya’s Ewaso Nyiro River Dries
Kenya&rsquo;s Ewaso Nyiro River Dries.caption_short: Severe drought gripped much of East Africa in 2009, turning a riverbed into a pale tan ribbon of sand.

Solar Prominence.title: Solar Prominence
Solar Prominence.caption_short: Acquired September 26 and 27, 2009, these images provide two views of a filament or prominence erupting from the Sun. One view shows a relatively dark filament against the bright background of the Sun. The other view shows the bright prominence against the blackness of space.

Tropical Storm Parma.title: Tropical Storm Parma
Tropical Storm Parma.caption_short: Acquired October 5, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Parma west of the islands of Luzon and Taiwan.

Dust over the Black Sea.title: Dust over the Black Sea
Dust over the Black Sea.caption_short: Dust blows across Turkey’s arid interior and fans out over the Black Sea in this photo-like image taken on October 13, 2009.

Australian Dust Storm.title: Australian Dust Storm
Australian Dust Storm.caption_short: The plume of dust that swept over the South Pacific Ocean from Australia on October 13, 2009, was delicate, almost ghostly, compared to the large, dense plume of dust that darkened much of the east Australian coast on September 23.

Fires around Lake Malawi.title: Fires around Lake Malawi
Fires around Lake Malawi.caption_short: Acquired October 13, 2009, this true-color image shows fires, likely agricultural fires, burning around Lake Malawi.

Kipuka, Craters of the Moon.title: Kipuka, Craters of the Moon
Kipuka, Craters of the Moon.caption_short: This "kipuka" in Craters of the Moon National Monument is an area of undisturbed grassland surrounded by a lava flow.

Craters of the Moon, Idaho.title: Craters of the Moon, Idaho
Craters of the Moon, Idaho.caption_short: This lava field includes at least 60 flows ranging from 15,000 to 2,100 years old.

Phytoplankton Bloom in the Bering Sea.title: Phytoplankton Bloom in the Bering Sea
Phytoplankton Bloom in the Bering Sea.caption_short: Acquired October 8, 2009, this true-color image shows peacock-hued splashes of color off the coast of Alaska, near St. Paul Island.

Oblique View of the Arnica Fire, Yellows.title: Oblique View of the Arnica Fire, Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming
Oblique View of the Arnica Fire, Yellows.caption_short: The smoke plume from the Arnica Fire is reflected in Yellowstone Lake in this astronaut photo from September 24, 2009.

Tombouctou, Mali.title: Tombouctou, Mali
Tombouctou, Mali.caption_short: Acquired March 6, 2001, this false-color image shows Tombouctou (Timbuktu) and the surrounding region. Vegetation is red, water is blue, human-built structures are brown-gray, and bare ground ranges in color from off-white to tan.

Rainfall from Typhoon Parma.title: Rainfall from Typhoon Parma
Rainfall from Typhoon Parma.caption_short: Typhoon Parma dumped up to 700 millimeters of rain over northern Luzon, Philippines, over the course of a week, as illustrated in this map of rainfall totals between October 2 and October 8, 2009.

Earthquakes Near Vanuatu.title: Earthquakes Near Vanuatu
Earthquakes Near Vanuatu.caption_short: This map shows the region surrounding the earthquakes that occurred near Vanuatu on October 7 and 8, 2009. Ocean water appears in shades of blue, and land areas appear in shades of brown. Circles mark earthquake locations, and a black line marks the tectonic plate boundary.

Hampton Glacier, Alexander Island, Antar.title: Hampton Glacier, Alexander Island, Antarctica
Hampton Glacier, Alexander Island, Antar.caption_short: Hampton Glacier calves icebergs into Shokalsky Bay on the Antarctic Penninsula.

Fires in Northeastern Australia.title: Fires in Northeastern Australia
Fires in Northeastern Australia.caption_short: Acquired October 6, 2009, this true-color image shows fires burning around the coastal city of Cairns. Smoke from the fires blows inland.

Super Typhoon Melor.title: Super Typhoon Melor
Super Typhoon Melor.caption_short: Acquired October 5, 2009, this true-color image shows Super Typhoon Melor spanning hundreds of kilometers over the Pacific Ocean.

Ship Trails over the Pacific Ocean.title: Ship Trails over the Pacific Ocean
Ship Trails over the Pacific Ocean.caption_short: Acquired October 5, 2009, this true-color image shows ship trails, which appear brighter and denser than the surrounding clouds, embedded in a cloud bank off the west coast of North America.

Typhoon Melor and Tropical Storm Parma.title: Typhoon Melor and Tropical Storm Parma
Typhoon Melor and Tropical Storm Parma.caption_short: A little over 1,000 kilometers separated the center of Tropical Storm Parma from the center of Typhoon Melor on October 6, when the this composite image was taken.

Bursts of Ash from Soufriere Hills Volca.title: Bursts of Ash from Soufriere Hills Volcano
Bursts of Ash from Soufriere Hills Volca.caption_short: After 10 months of relative quiet, Soufriere Hills Volcano on the Caribbean island of Montserrat blasted ash 3,600 meters into the sky in early October 2009.

Dust Storm in Eastern Washington.title: Dust Storm in Eastern Washington
Dust Storm in Eastern Washington.caption_short: A thick, rippling plume of dust runs northeast to southwest through the center of this image of eastern Washington state on October 4, 2009.

Flooding along the Krishna River.title: Flooding along the Krishna River
Flooding along the Krishna River.caption_short: These false-color images show a portion of the Krishna River in southern India in flood stage on October 5, 2009 (top), and before the flooding on September 10, 2009 (bottom).

Glacier Outlet, Southern Patagonian Ice.title: Glacier Outlet, Southern Patagonian Ice Field, Chile
Glacier Outlet, Southern Patagonian Ice.caption_short: This astronaut photograph shows the merged outlet of two glaciers within the deep fjords of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field.

Petrified Forest National Park, Arizona.title: Petrified Forest National Park, Arizona
Petrified Forest National Park, Arizona.caption_short: Acquired November 28, 2002, this true-color image shows an arid landscape in eastern Arizona. At the time of the earliest dinosaurs, it was a moist, tropical region near the equator.

Fast-Flowing Glaciers Thin Greenland and.title: Fast-Flowing Glaciers Thin Greenland and Antarctic Ice Sheets
Fast-Flowing Glaciers Thin Greenland and.caption_short: To understand how fast-moving glaciers are changing the ice sheets, scientists devised a method to map elevation change using data from ICESat.

Fires in Eastern Africa.title: Fires in Eastern Africa
Fires in Eastern Africa.caption_short: Acquired October 1, 2009, this true-color image shows fires, marked by red dots, burning near Lake Tanganyika, Lake Mweru, and Lake Malawi.

Human Ecosystems.title: Human Ecosystems
Human Ecosystems.caption_short: This global map shows Earth’s anthropogenic biomes—ecological patterns caused or influenced by human activity.

Lava Domes, Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Volcano.title: Lava Domes, ChaitÃ©n Volcano
Lava Domes, Chait\u00c3\u00a9n Volcano.caption_short: Fresh lava domes fill most of the 10,000-year old caldera of Chaitén volcano.

7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off Sumatra.title: 7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off Sumatra
7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off Sumatra.caption_short: This image shows the topography and bathymetry near Sumatra, Indonesia, where hundreds or thousands of people were feared dead in the wake of a magnitude 7.6 earthquake that struck on September 30, 2009.

Ash and Steam Plume from Chait\u00c3\u00.title: Ash and Steam Plume from ChaitÃ©n
Ash and Steam Plume from Chait\u00c3\u00.caption_short: Chaitén volcano emitted a column of ash and steam as its dome-building eruption continued in late September 2009.

Fires in Yellowstone.title: Fires in Yellowstone
Fires in Yellowstone.caption_short: Acquired September 27, 2009, this true-color image shows hotspots and smoke plumes associated with wildfires in northwestern Wyoming. The largest fire, Arnica, sends thick smoke plumes over Yellowstone Lake.

Wildfires in Oregon.title: Wildfires in Oregon
Wildfires in Oregon.caption_short: Acquired September 22, 2009, this true-color image shows thick plumes of smoke rising from wildfires in Oregon.

Tropical Storm Ketsana.title: Tropical Storm Ketsana
Tropical Storm Ketsana.caption_short: Acquired September 28, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Ketsana traveling westward across the South China Sea toward Southeast Asia.

Cikangkareng Landslide, Indonesia.title: Cikangkareng Landslide, Indonesia
Cikangkareng Landslide, Indonesia.caption_short: In this natural-color image, the exposed soil from a deadly landslide in September 2009 stands out from surrounding vegetation in Cinajur province, Indonesia.

Dust over Eastern Australia.title: Dust over Eastern Australia
Dust over Eastern Australia.caption_short: A wall of dust stretches from northern Queensland to the southern tip of eastern Australia in this photo-like satellite image from September 23, 2009.

Burn Scar from Guiberson Fire.title: Burn Scar from Guiberson Fire
Burn Scar from Guiberson Fire.caption_short: This false-color image shows the brick-red burn scar left behind by the Guiberson Fire in Ventura County, California, on September 26, 2009.

City of Dubai at Night, United Arab Emir.title: City of Dubai at Night, United Arab Emirates
City of Dubai at Night, United Arab Emir.caption_short: This nighttime astronaut photo shows the city lights of Dubai in the United Arab Emirates on September 11, 2009.

Laguna Ojo de Liebre, Mexico.title: Laguna Ojo de Liebre, Mexico
Laguna Ojo de Liebre, Mexico.caption_short: Acquired September 18, 2009, this true-color image of Laguna Ojo de Liebre on Baja California shows the margins of industrialized salt works in the east and a famed marine mammal wintering site in the west.

Lhasa, Tibet.title: Lhasa, Tibet
Lhasa, Tibet.caption_short: This three-dimensional view of Lhasa, Tibet illustrates how the city fills a flat river valley nestled in the ranges of the Himalaya Mountains in southern China.

Solar Towers near Seville, Spain.title: Solar Towers near Seville, Spain
Solar Towers near Seville, Spain.caption_short: In a patchwork of agricultural fields outside Seville, Spain, stand two heliostats, which generate solar power by concentrating sunlight to heat water into steam, which is used to generate electricity.

Fire in Ventura County, California.title: Fire in Ventura County, California
Fire in Ventura County, California.caption_short: Acquired shortly before noon local time on September 22, 2009, this true-color image shows smoke from the Guiberson Fire blowing southwestward toward the Pacific coastline. A red outline gives the rough perimeter of the fire.

Heavy Rain in U.S. Southeast.title: Heavy Rain in U.S. Southeast
Heavy Rain in U.S. Southeast.caption_short: This image shows estimates of rainfall over the southeastern United States from September 14-21, 2009. Highest rainfall amounts appear in dark blue, and lightest rainfall amounts appear in pale green. Especially intense rainfall occurs in Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, and northern Florida.

Saharan Dust over the Atlantic.title: Saharan Dust over the Atlantic
Saharan Dust over the Atlantic.caption_short: A tan cloud of dust colors the skies off Africa’s west coast on September 21, 2009.

Sinking River Deltas - Irrawaddy River.title: Sinking River Deltas - Irrawaddy River
Sinking River Deltas - Irrawaddy River.caption_short: This elevation image shows that the Irrawaddy Delta in Burma (Myanmar) is clearly flat, much of it below five meters in elevation. This low elevation makes the delta particularly prone to flooding from storm surges.

Magnitude 6.1 Earthquake in Bhutan.title: Magnitude 6.1 Earthquake in Bhutan
Magnitude 6.1 Earthquake in Bhutan.caption_short: A deadly magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck Bhutan on September 21, 2009.

Floods Across the Western Sahel.title: Floods Across the Western Sahel
Floods Across the Western Sahel.caption_short: These false-color images show the Inner Niger Delta in Mali on August 24, 2009,and September 18, 2009. The September 18 image shows wetlands soaked by rains.

Lago Erepecu and Rio Trombetas, Brazil.title: Lago Erepecu and Rio Trombetas, Brazil
Lago Erepecu and Rio Trombetas, Brazil.caption_short: In this astronaut photo, the mirror-like reflection of sunlight off water makes the Trombetas River and Lake Erepecu in the Brazilian Amazon stand out from the deep green forest.

Changes on Ol Doinyo Lengai.title: Changes on Ol Doinyo Lengai
Changes on Ol Doinyo Lengai.caption_short: In September 2007, a series of explosive eruptions altered the summit of the volcano, the only one that erupts natrocarbonatite lava.

North Pole Sea Ice Minimum 2009.title: North Pole Sea Ice Minimum 2009
North Pole Sea Ice Minimum 2009.caption_short: On September 12, 2009, sea ice reached its annual minimum extent, covering 5.10 million square kilometers (2.97 million square miles) of the Arctic Ocean. This image shows the 2009 ice extent compared to the 1979-2000 average.

Station Fire Burn Scar.title: Station Fire Burn Scar
Station Fire Burn Scar.caption_short: Captured September 16, 2009, this false-color image shows the brown-red burn scar left by the Station Fire north of the city of Los Angeles.

Super Typhoon Choi-Wan.title: Super Typhoon Choi-Wan
Super Typhoon Choi-Wan.caption_short: Choi-wan is a perfect circle with bands of clouds pin-wheeling around the dense center in this photo-like image from September 15 2009.

Precision Farming in Minnesota.title: Precision Farming in Minnesota
Precision Farming in Minnesota.caption_short: Lush green fields dominate this Landsat image of northwest Minnesota from September 10, 2009, though some crops have already been harvested leaving squares of tan and brown.

Antarctic Ozone Hole 2009.title: Antarctic Ozone Hole 2009
Antarctic Ozone Hole 2009.caption_short: Blues and purples in this image of Antarctic ozone concentrations reveal the developing ozone hole of 2009.

Australian Dust over the Pacific Ocean.title: Australian Dust over the Pacific Ocean
Australian Dust over the Pacific Ocean.caption_short: Dust blown from the Lake Eyre basin forms a dense tan cloud over the Pacific Ocean.

Fires in Los Angeles County.title: Fires in Los Angeles County
Fires in Los Angeles County.caption_short: Acquired August 29, 2009, this true-color image shows a hotspot associated with a wildfire near the city of Los Angeles. Smoke from the fire blows toward the north.

Earthquake off the Coast of Venezuela.title: Earthquake off the Coast of Venezuela
Earthquake off the Coast of Venezuela.caption_short: A strong earthquake struck off the Venezuelan coast on September 12, 2009.

Dust Plume Across Northern Patagonia.title: Dust Plume Across Northern Patagonia
Dust Plume Across Northern Patagonia.caption_short: A checkerboard of growing (dark green) and fallow (tan) fields in northern Patagonia appears beneath a rippling plume of beige dust in this natural-color image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite on September 11, 2009.

Fires and Smoke in Borneo.title: Fires and Smoke in Borneo
Fires and Smoke in Borneo.caption_short: Dense smoke from land use fires obscured the ground in southern Borneo from view when these photo-like images were taken on September 6 and September 7, 2009.

Tropical Storm Koppu.title: Tropical Storm Koppu
Tropical Storm Koppu.caption_short: Tropical Storm Koppu was nearing landfall over southern China when the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Terra captured this image on September 14, 2009.

Lake Tiberias (Sea of Galilee), Northern.title: Lake Tiberias (Sea of Galilee), Northern Israel
Lake Tiberias (Sea of Galilee), Northern.caption_short: This astronaut photo of Israel’s Lake Tiberias (Sea of Galilee) shows an irregular patchwork of green and brown fields surrounding the lake. The Jordan River is visible flowing in at the northern end of the lake and out at the southern end.

Glaciers Flow into a Greenland Valley.title: Glaciers Flow into a Greenland Valley
Glaciers Flow into a Greenland Valley.caption_short: These true-color images show wide-area and close-up views of glaciers flowing into a largely dry, linear valley in western Greenland on August 29, 2009.

Space Debris.title: Space Debris
Space Debris.caption_short: Approximately 19,000 manmade objects larger than 10 centimeters orbit the Earth. These images, based on models, show the distribution of orbital debris around Earth.

Tropical Storm Mujigae.title: Tropical Storm Mujigae
Tropical Storm Mujigae.caption_short: Acquired September 9, 2009, this image uses color coding and barbs to indicate wind speed and direction for Tropical Storm Mujigae. The image captures the storm center immediately west of the Philippine island of Luzon.

Tropical Storm Linda.title: Tropical Storm Linda
Tropical Storm Linda.caption_short: This image uses color codes and barbs to show relative wind speeds and wind directions of Tropical Storm Linda on September 10, 2009.

Heavy Rain in Istanbul.title: Heavy Rain in Istanbul
Heavy Rain in Istanbul.caption_short: This image shows rainfall estimates for northwestern Turkey and the surrounding region from September 2 to September 9, 2009. The lightest amounts appear in pale green, and the heaviest amounts appear in blue.

Hurricane Fred.title: Hurricane Fred
Hurricane Fred.caption_short: Acquired at 12:55 UTC on September 9, 2009, this true-color image shows Hurricane Fred, hundreds of kilometers across, hovering over the eastern Atlantic Ocean.

Deforestation in Malaysian Borneo.title: Deforestation in Malaysian Borneo
Deforestation in Malaysian Borneo.caption_short: Acquired May 27, 2003, this true-color Landsat ETM image shows part of a plantation in Malaysian Borneo, along the edge of the forest. The area outlined in white in the ETM image appears in greater detail in the image acquired on June 18, 2002, by the commercial satellite Ikonos. The images show the differences between forest, cleared land, and palm plantation.

Tropical Storm Dujuan.title: Tropical Storm Dujuan
Tropical Storm Dujuan.caption_short: This image shows the wind structure inside Tropical Storm Dujuan as observed by the QuikSCAT satellite on September 8.

Floods across the Western Sahel.title: Floods across the Western Sahel
Floods across the Western Sahel.caption_short: Comparing August 28 and September 3, 2009, these false-color images show changes along Burkina Faso’s Nakamb&Zeacute; River caused by flooding.

Tabun Khara Obo, Mongolia.title: Tabun Khara Obo, Mongolia
Tabun Khara Obo, Mongolia.caption_short: Acquired on August 28, 2009, this true-color image shows the Tabun Khara Obo in southeastern Mongolia. Sunlight shines from the southeast, leaving the crater’s northern and western slopes in shadow.

Black Point Lava Flow, Arizona.title: Black Point Lava Flow, Arizona
Black Point Lava Flow, Arizona.caption_short: The otherworldly footprint of black basaltic lava creates a striking landscape at Black Point Lava Flow in northern Arizona, seen in this photograph taken from the International Space Station.

Hurricane Jimena.title: Hurricane Jimena
Hurricane Jimena.caption_short: Hurricane Jimena was heading west-northwest toward Mexico’s Baja Peninsula on August 30, 2009, when the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image.

7.0 Quake off Java.title: 7.0 Quake off Java
7.0 Quake off Java.caption_short: This image shows bathymetry in shades of blue and topography in shades of brown in the area where an earthquake struck off the shore of western Java on September 2, 2009.

Northwest Passage, Late August 2009.title: Northwest Passage, Late August 2009
Northwest Passage, Late August 2009.caption_short: Acquired August 27, 2009, this true-color image shows the partial opening of the Northwest Passage in the Canadian Arctic Archipelago. Besides some ice-free and ice-clogged channels, the image also shows the varied topography of snow-free islands.

Floods in Northeastern India.title: Floods in Northeastern India
Floods in Northeastern India.caption_short: Acquired on July 18 and August 1, 2009, these false-color images provide a before-and-after view of the Sitamarhi District of the Indian state of Bihar. The image from August 1 shows swollen waterways and large areas of standing water.

Tropical Storm Krovanh.title: Tropical Storm Krovanh
Tropical Storm Krovanh.caption_short: Acquired August 31, 2009, this true-color image shows Tropical Storm Krovanh off the coast of Japan. The eye of the storm appears to hover over the ocean south of Tokyo.

Heiltskuk Icefield, British Columbia.title: Heiltskuk Icefield, British Columbia
Heiltskuk Icefield, British Columbia.caption_short: This detailed astronaut photograph shows Canada’ Heiltskuk Icefield—mostly covered by snow across the upper mountain slopes—and two major valley glaciers that extend from it.

Burn Scar Near Athens, Greece.title: Burn Scar Near Athens, Greece
Burn Scar Near Athens, Greece.caption_short: Charred plants color the hills northeast of Athens, Greece, chocolate brown in this photo-like image taken days after a large fire raced through the region.

Strongest Storms Each Year This Decade:.title: Strongest Storms Each Year This Decade: 2008, Super Typhoon Jangmi
Strongest Storms Each Year This Decade:.caption_short: Seen from space, even a super typhoon seems more beautiful than dangerous. This image of a graceful-looking Typhoon Jangmi was captured on September 27, 2008, as the storm approached Taiwan.

Activity at Koryaksky Volcano.title: Activity at Koryaksky Volcano
Activity at Koryaksky Volcano.caption_short: Acquired August 27, 2009, this true-color image shows a pale plume blowing away from Koryaksky Volcano toward the east-northeast. The plume arcs slightly as it approaches the Bering Sea.

Aral Sea Continues to Shrink.title: Aral Sea Continues to Shrink
Aral Sea Continues to Shrink.caption_short: In the first half of the twentieth century, it was the world’s fourth-largest lake. By August 2009, virtually nothing remained of the largest lobe.

Floods along the India-Nepal Border.title: Floods along the India-Nepal Border
Floods along the India-Nepal Border.caption_short: Acquired July 23 and August 24, 2009, these false-color images show swollen rivers along the India-Nepal border. The Ganges and Ghaghara Rivers are both swollen.

Flooding Along the Brahmaputra River.title: Flooding Along the Brahmaputra River
Flooding Along the Brahmaputra River.caption_short: Acquired on July 23 and August 26, 2009, these false-color images show flood-related changes in a stretch of the Brahmaputra River. In the later image, the river is visibly swollen, and nearby tributaries have also filled.

Afternoon Clouds over the Amazon Rainfor.title: Afternoon Clouds over the Amazon Rainforest
Afternoon Clouds over the Amazon Rainfor.caption_short: A uniform layer of tiny “popcorn” clouds covers the Amazon Rainforest in this image from August 19, 2009. The clouds are a byproduct of photosynthesis.

Tropical Storm Hilda.title: Tropical Storm Hilda
Tropical Storm Hilda.caption_short: This view of the wind speed and direction of Tropical Storm Hilda was captured by the QuikSCAT satellite on August 24, 2009.

Fires in Greece.title: Fires in Greece
Fires in Greece.caption_short: Deadly wildfires in southern Greece wafted thick clouds of smoke over the Ionian Sea and southward to the Mediterranean in late August 2007. A line of fires stretches along the western coast of Greece’s Peloponnesus Peninsula. To the northeast, a large fire is casting a plume of smoke over Athens.

Typhoon Vamco.title: Typhoon Vamco
Typhoon Vamco.caption_short: Typhoon Vamco has a small, distinctive eye defined by a wall of clouds in this photo-like image from August 20, 2009.

Hurricane Bill.title: Hurricane Bill
Hurricane Bill.caption_short: Strong winds and heavy rain are revealed near the eye of Hurricane Bill in this QuikSCAT satellite image from August 16, 2009.

Sevastopol, Ukraine.title: Sevastopol, Ukraine
Sevastopol, Ukraine.caption_short: The urban landscape of Sevastopol, on the Ukrainian coast of the Black Sea, is featured in this astronaut photo from August 5, 2009.

Hurricane Bill Skirts East Coast.title: Hurricane Bill Skirts East Coast
Hurricane Bill Skirts East Coast.caption_short: Acquired August 23, 2009, this true-color image shows Hurricane Bill missing the U.S., apparently headed northward toward Canada.

Burgess Shale, Yoho National Park of Can.title: Burgess Shale, Yoho National Park of Canada
Burgess Shale, Yoho National Park of Can.caption_short: Acquired August 29, 2001, this true-color image of Yoho National Park shows a landscape of naked ridges, forested slopes, meandering rivers, and jewel-toned lakes.

Barents Sea in Bloom.title: Barents Sea in Bloom
Barents Sea in Bloom.caption_short: This image of the summer phytoplankton bloom in the Barents Sea off the northwesternmost corner of Russia was captured by the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite on August 19, 2009. The milky-blue color that dominates the bloom suggests that it contains large numbers of phytoplankton called coccolithophores.

Plume from Kilauea&rsquo;s Halema&rsquo;.title: Plume from Kilauea’s Halema’uma’u Crater
Plume from Kilauea&rsquo;s Halema&rsquo;.caption_short: Acquired August 19, 2009, this true-color image shows a ghostly gray-blue plume blowing from the Halema'uma'u Overlook vent on the Kilauea Volcano. While the land surface around the vent is devoid of vegetation, plants apparently thrive to the east.

Smoke over the Pacific Northwest.title: Smoke over the Pacific Northwest
Smoke over the Pacific Northwest.caption_short: Acquired August 19, 2009, this true-color image shows thick smoke from fires in southern British Columbia clouding skies over Vancouver, Seattle, and Spokane. The image also shows a dramatic transition in land cover between eastern and western Washington.

Flying Steady: Mission Control Tunes Up.title: Flying Steady: Mission Control Tunes Up Aqua’s Orbit
Flying Steady: Mission Control Tunes Up.caption_short: This pair of images includes a computer drawing of NASA’ Aqua satellite and the global picture of Earth one Aqua’s onboard sensors captured on March 16, 2009.

Floods in Northwestern Pakistan.title: Floods in Northwestern Pakistan
Floods in Northwestern Pakistan.caption_short: These false-color images show part of the Jhelum River, southwest of the city of Swabi, shortly before and after the floods that struck the region on August 16, 2009. The earlier image was acquired August 13, and the later image was acquired August 18. The later image shows a swollen river and conspicuous tributary not visible in the earlier shot.

First IR Image from Newest Weather Satel.title: First IR Image from Newest Weather Satellite Captures Hurricane Bill
First IR Image from Newest Weather Satel.caption_short: The first full-disk thermal image from the newest NASA/NOAA weather satellite shows the remnants of Tropical Storm Claudette and Tropical Depression Ana, as well as Hurricane Bill on August 17, 2009.

Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.title: Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia
Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.caption_short: Mongolia’s capital city of Ulaanbaatar occupies a valley along the Tuul River. Roughly 1,350 meters above sea level, and over 47 degrees north of the Equator, the city rests atop a sporadic permafrost zone, and ranks among the world’s coldest national capitals.

Dust over Iraq and Kuwait.title: Dust over Iraq and Kuwait
Dust over Iraq and Kuwait.caption_short: Pale dust from Iraq's agricultural region obscures most of Kuwait and culminates in a distinct plume over the Persian Gulf in this photo-like image.

Fires in Magadan Region, Russia&rsquo;s.title: Fires in Magadan Region, Russia’s Kolyma Mountains
Fires in Magadan Region, Russia&rsquo;s.caption_short: More than two dozen large, smoky fires were burning in the Magadan Region of northeastern Russia on August 1, 2009.

Dust Storm in Argentina.title: Dust Storm in Argentina
Dust Storm in Argentina.caption_short: Thick plumes of dust blew from the exposed shore of Argentina's Laguna Mar Chiquita on August 16, 2009.

Tropical Storm Claudette.title: Tropical Storm Claudette
Tropical Storm Claudette.caption_short: Only a trace of the iconic shape of a hurricane is apparent in this natural-color image of Tropical Storm Claudette from August 16, 2009.

Mount Hood, Oregon.title: Mount Hood, Oregon
Mount Hood, Oregon.caption_short: In the astronaut photo from August 5, 2009, bright white glaciers cap the summit of Oregon’s Mount Hood, while gray volcanic deposits line the rivers that drain the mountain, and green forests cover the lower slopes.

Drought in California&rsquo;s Central Va.title: Drought in California’s Central Valley
Drought in California&rsquo;s Central Va.caption_short: Dark brown squares mark fields that would ordinarily support irrigated crops in California’s Central Valley in this vegetation image. In 2009, a lack of water meant that the crops were not growing well or the fields lay fallow.

Lockheed Fire, Santa Cruz Mountains.title: Lockheed Fire, Santa Cruz Mountains
Lockheed Fire, Santa Cruz Mountains.caption_short: A narrow but dense plume of smoke rises from the Lockheed Fire southwest of San Jose, California, and slices across the mouth of Monterey Bay, stretching past the city of Santa Cruz toward Monterey in this photo-like image taken on August 13, 2009.

Hurricane Guillermo.title: Hurricane Guillermo
Hurricane Guillermo.caption_short: A semi-clear eye marks the center of Tropical Storm Guillermo, which became a weak hurricane shortly after this image was taken on August 13, 2009.

Charcot Island, Antarctica.title: Charcot Island, Antarctica
Charcot Island, Antarctica.caption_short: Acquired August 2, 2009, this gray-scale image is made from thermal observations. The image shows that Charcot Island, long connected to Antarctica by the Wilkins Ice Shelf, was circumnavigable in the Southern Hemisphere winter of 2009.

La Brea Fire.title: La Brea Fire
La Brea Fire.caption_short: Smoke from the La Brea Fire spills out over the Santa Barbara Channel in this natural-color image from August 12, 2009.

Wildfire at Okanagan Lake, British Colum.title: Wildfire at Okanagan Lake, British Columbia
Wildfire at Okanagan Lake, British Colum.caption_short: A large burned area that is part of the Terrace Mountain Fire near Okanagan Lake is visible beneath patchy clouds in this natural-color iamge from August 9, 2009.

Drought on the Canadian Prairie.title: Drought on the Canadian Prairie
Drought on the Canadian Prairie.caption_short: All vegetation—crops and natural vegetation—on Canada’s central prairie was growing less than average, as indicated by the predominant shade of brown in these vegetation index images from July 2009.

Fresh Craters on the Moon and Earth.title: Fresh Craters on the Moon and Earth
Fresh Craters on the Moon and Earth.caption_short: Throughout their histories, both the Moon and Earth have been bombarded by meteorites and asteroids, which often leave behind dramatic impact craters.

Smoke from Fires in Russia and Alaska.title: Smoke from Fires in Russia and Alaska
Smoke from Fires in Russia and Alaska.caption_short: The highest concentrations of carbon monoxide, a component of smoke, are centered over large fire complexes in Russia in this image that tracks smoke transport across the Arctic.

Burn Scars Near Confluence of Yukon and.title: Burn Scars Near Confluence of Yukon and Tanana Rivers, Alaska
Burn Scars Near Confluence of Yukon and.caption_short: Rainy weather moderated fire activity in interior Alaska, and when the clouds cleared on August 9, 2009, several large burn scars were visible.

Slow-Moving Typhoon Morakot Inundates Ta.title: Slow-Moving Typhoon Morakot Inundates Taiwan
Slow-Moving Typhoon Morakot Inundates Ta.caption_short: A bull’s eye of heavy rain from Typhoon Morakot engulfs southern Taiwan in this rainfall accumulation image spanning August 3 to 9, 2009.

Plume from Bagana.title: Plume from Bagana
Plume from Bagana.caption_short: Acquired August 9, 2009, this true-color image shows a faint plume from Bagana Volcano on the island of Bougainville blowing toward the northeast, over the Pacific Ocean.

Typhoon Morakot.title: Typhoon Morakot
Typhoon Morakot.caption_short: Strong winds surround a calm center in this visualization of Typhoon Morakot.

Hurricane Felicia.title: Hurricane Felicia
Hurricane Felicia.caption_short: Felicia had a compact, strong center, surrounded by distinctive bands of strong wind when QuikSCAT acquired this image on August 6, 2009.

Aorounga Impact Crater, Chad.title: Aorounga Impact Crater, Chad
Aorounga Impact Crater, Chad.caption_short: Taken July 25, 2009, this astronaut photograph shows the concentric rings of Aorounga Impact Crater in north-central Chad.

Prospect Park, Brooklyn.title: Prospect Park, Brooklyn
Prospect Park, Brooklyn.caption_short: Acquired September 12, 2001, this true-color image of Brooklyn shows two green oases in the middle of cityscape: Prospect Park and Green-Wood Cemetery.

Relative Amounts of Bad Ozone Ingredient.title: Relative Amounts of Bad Ozone Ingredients Across the U.S.
Relative Amounts of Bad Ozone Ingredient.caption_short: These maps show how the relative amounts of the key ingredients for ozone (smog) formation in the United States change throughout the summer.

Plume from Dukono.title: Plume from Dukono
Plume from Dukono.caption_short: Clouds obscure the summit of Dukono in this image from May 3, 2009, but a faint plume blows away from the volcano toward the east-northeast.

Hurricane Felicia and Tropical Storm Enr.title: Hurricane Felicia and Tropical Storm Enrique
Hurricane Felicia and Tropical Storm Enr.caption_short: Hurricane Felicia, with its distinct eye and tight bands of spiraling clouds, and the less distinct Tropical Storm Enrique sat side by side over the East Pacific Ocean on August 4, 2009.

Bloom in the Norwegian Sea.title: Bloom in the Norwegian Sea
Bloom in the Norwegian Sea.caption_short: The brilliant shades of blue and green that fill the waters near the Norwegian shore in this photo-like image are likely phytoplankton.

Summer Haze in the Eastern United States.title: Summer Haze in the Eastern United States
Summer Haze in the Eastern United States.caption_short: Haze rolls off the Eastern seaboard over the Atlantic Ocean, while clouds pile up along the ridgelines of the Appalachian Mountains in this photo-like image from August 4, 2009.

Chernobyl, Ukraine.title: Chernobyl, Ukraine
Chernobyl, Ukraine.caption_short: On April 26, 1986, the world’s worst nuclear power accident occurred at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant  near the Ukrainian-Belarus border. Toxic radionuclides like Cs137 and Sr90 contaminated an area of 155,000 square kilometers in what is today Belarus, Ukraine and Russia.  Hundreds of thousands of people were killed, sickened from radiation-induced illnesses, or resettled to uncontaminated land. This image, taken from the Russian Mir spacecraft, shows Chernobyl and the surrounding countryside.

Fires in Interior Alaska.title: Fires in Interior Alaska
Fires in Interior Alaska.caption_short: Several lightning-triggered fires were burning near the Tanana River, southwest of Fairbanks, Alaska, on July 7, 2009.

Hundreds of Thousands of Acres Burning i.title: Hundreds of Thousands of Acres Burning in Interior Alaska
Hundreds of Thousands of Acres Burning i.caption_short: Hundreds of thousands of acres were burning in the Tanana and Yukon River basins in interior Alaska on August 2, 2009.

Fire on La Palma, Canary Islands.title: Fire on La Palma, Canary Islands
Fire on La Palma, Canary Islands.caption_short: Smoke from a large fire on La Palma in the Canary Islands spread southeast on August 2, 2009.

Teide Volcano, Canary Islands, Spain.title: Teide Volcano, Canary Islands, Spain
Teide Volcano, Canary Islands, Spain.caption_short: Sinuous, channelized lava flows are the most striking volcanic features visible in this astronaut photo of Teide and Viejo Volcanoes on Tenerife Island.

Fires in Yukon Territory, Canada.title: Fires in Yukon Territory, Canada
Fires in Yukon Territory, Canada.caption_short: Numerous large fires were burning in Yukon Territory, Canada, on July 30, 2009.

Fires in Alaska&rsquo;s Yukon Flats Wild.title: Fires in Alaska’s Yukon Flats Wildlife Refuge
Fires in Alaska&rsquo;s Yukon Flats Wild.caption_short: Large fires in eastern Alaska’s Yukon Flats National Wildlife Refuge were billowing out thick plumes of yellowish smoke on July 30, 2009.

Heavy Rains in Southern Japan.title: Heavy Rains in Southern Japan
Heavy Rains in Southern Japan.caption_short: This false-color image shows rainfall amounts in and around southern Japan in July 2009. Deeper blue indicates heavier rainfall.

Novaya Zemlya.title: Novaya Zemlya
Novaya Zemlya.caption_short: This true-color image of Novaya Zemlya from July 27, 2009, shows a glacier-capped northern island surrounded by mostly open ocean water.

Caraj&aacute;s Mine, Brazil.title: Carajás Mine, Brazil
Caraj&aacute;s Mine, Brazil.caption_short: The terraced layers of red earth that make up the Carajás Iron Ore Mine contrast with the deep green Amazon Rainforest in this cloud-free image.

El Nino Conditions Set in Across Pacific.title: El Nino Conditions Set in Across Pacific Ocean
El Nino Conditions Set in Across Pacific.caption_short: A patch of warmer than average ocean temperatures in the eastern Pacific on July 26, 2009, revealed the onset of El Niño conditions.

Pohang, South Korea.title: Pohang, South Korea
Pohang, South Korea.caption_short: In this astronaut photo from June 12, 2009, the urban fabric of Pohang, South Korea, is strikingly divided by the Hyeongsan River.

Carrizozo Lava Flow.title: Carrizozo Lava Flow
Carrizozo Lava Flow.caption_short: In south-central New Mexico, a charcoal-brown scar undulates across the arid landscape.

Monsoon Brings Below-Average Rain to Muc.title: Monsoon Brings Below-Average Rain to Much of India, Bangladesh
Monsoon Brings Below-Average Rain to Muc.caption_short: Most of India and Bangladesh are brown, showing that less rain fell than average during the week of July 14-20, when monsoon rains should have been falling.

Wildfire At Okanagan Lake.title: Wildfire At Okanagan Lake
Wildfire At Okanagan Lake.caption_short: A large fire that broke out northwest of Kelowna in mid-July continued to burn on July 23, 2009.

Sea Ice off Baffin Island.title: Sea Ice off Baffin Island
Sea Ice off Baffin Island.caption_short: Sea ice formed delicate swirls along the coast of Baffin Island in this true-color image acquired July 11, 2009.

Eclipse Shadows Japan, Korea, China.title: Eclipse Shadows Japan, Korea, China
Eclipse Shadows Japan, Korea, China.caption_short: This true-color image shows the effects of a total eclipse of the Sun over Japan, Korea, and eastern China on July 22, 2009.

Eclipse Shadows Southeastern China.title: Eclipse Shadows Southeastern China
Eclipse Shadows Southeastern China.caption_short: The Moon’s shadow engulfed Taiwan and a large swath of southeastern China and the Pacific Ocean on the morning of July 22, 2009, during an unusually long total eclipse of the Sun.

Dust Storm over Southern Bolivia.title: Dust Storm over Southern Bolivia
Dust Storm over Southern Bolivia.caption_short: This true-color image from July 21, 2009, shows pale beige dust plumes blowing southeastward from salt flats in western Bolivia. The image also shows small plumes blowing southward from riverbeds in eastern Bolivia.

Typhoon Molave.title: Typhoon Molave
Typhoon Molave.caption_short: Though still a tropical storm, Molave’s shape is distinctive in this image. Clouds swirl around a dark depression, which marks the eye of the storm.

Fires in Kasai Region, Democratic Republ.title: Fires in Kasai Region, Democratic Republic of Congo
Fires in Kasai Region, Democratic Republ.caption_short: This image of the Kasai region of Democratic Republic of Congo shows hundreds of active fires burning on July 20, 2009

Fires Near the Aldan River, Russia.title: Fires Near the Aldan River, Russia
Fires Near the Aldan River, Russia.caption_short: Smoke from several large forest fires pooled against the base of a mountain range in eastern Russia on July 21, 2009.

7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off New Zealand.title: 7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off New Zealand’s South Island
7.6 Magnitude Earthquake off New Zealand.caption_short: Evidence of New Zealand’s location on the Pacific Ring of Fire is shown in this image of the bathymetry (shades of blue) and topography (shades of brown) of the southwestern part of the South Island, known as Fiordland, and the surrounding waters of the Tasman Sea and Pacific Ocean.

Typhoon Molave Floods the Philippines.title: Typhoon Molave Floods the Philippines
Typhoon Molave Floods the Philippines.caption_short: Dark pools of water mark the land along the length of the Cagayan River and its tributaries in the wake of Typhoon Molave.

Dust Plumes in the Taklimakan Desert.title: Dust Plumes in the Taklimakan Desert
Dust Plumes in the Taklimakan Desert.caption_short: This true-color image shows a fuzzy semi-oval of dust fringing the southwestern rim of the Taklimakan Desert on July 18, 2009.

Dust Plumes off West Africa.title: Dust Plumes off West Africa
Dust Plumes off West Africa.caption_short: This true-color image shows a large plume of tan dust off the coast of Senegal, east of Cape Verde, on July 19, 2009.

Apollo 11 Landing Site.title: Apollo 11 Landing Site
Apollo 11 Landing Site.caption_short: Forty years after the Apollo 11 landing on the Moon,  the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter captured this image of the descent stage of the Eagle lunar module.

Mount Tambora Volcano, Sumbawa Island, I.title: Mount Tambora Volcano, Sumbawa Island, Indonesia
Mount Tambora Volcano, Sumbawa Island, I.caption_short: This astronaut photo of Tambora Volcano shows layered deposits and a lake within the caldera.

Journey to the Galapagos.title: Journey to the Galapagos
Journey to the Galapagos.caption_short: The marine life in the seas surrounding the Galapagos is influenced by unique oceanographic conditions, where the deep equatorial undercurrent slams into the islands, pushing up cool water and nutrients from the depths.

Dust Storm over Iraq and Iran.title: Dust Storm over Iraq and Iran
Dust Storm over Iraq and Iran.caption_short: On July 5-6, 2009, the Ozone Monitoring Instrument observed how much sunlight could reach the surface of the Earth through the dust particles kicked up by a severe dust storm over Iraq and Iran.

Flooding near Manaus, Brazil.title: Flooding near Manaus, Brazil
Flooding near Manaus, Brazil.caption_short: In June 2009, the waters of the Amazon surrounded the villages near its confluence with the Negro River, seeping into the cleared land and filling what had been pale green angular shapes with murky brown water.

Apollo 11 Launch Pad.title: Apollo 11 Launch Pad
Apollo 11 Launch Pad.caption_short: By launching from the east coast of Florida, NASA took advantage of both geography and physics.

Volcanic Activity at Krakatau.title: Volcanic Activity at Krakatau
Volcanic Activity at Krakatau.caption_short: This true-color image from July 7, 2009, shows Anak Krakatau releasing a small plume of steam that blows toward the southwest.

Tikehau Atoll, French Polynesia.title: Tikehau Atoll, French Polynesia
Tikehau Atoll, French Polynesia.caption_short: The islands and coral atolls of French Polynesia, located in the southern Pacific Ocean, epitomize the idea of tropical paradise: white sandy beaches, turquoise lagoons, and palm trees.

Dust Plume off West Africa.title: Dust Plume off West Africa
Dust Plume off West Africa.caption_short: Acquired on July 12, 2009, this true-color image shows a thin veil of dust blowing over the Atlantic Ocean and mingling with clouds over Cape Verde.

Dust Plumes from Afghanistan.title: Dust Plumes from Afghanistan
Dust Plumes from Afghanistan.caption_short: This true-color image shows dust plumes blowing from southwestern Afghanistan toward the south-southeast, passing over westernmost Pakistan and easternmost Iran on July 13, 2009.

Millennium Island, Kiribati.title: Millennium Island, Kiribati
Millennium Island, Kiribati.caption_short: This astronaut photo of Millennium Island shows emerald islets surrounding a turquoise lagoon dotted with coral.

5.7 Magnitude Quake in Southern China.title: 5.7 Magnitude Quake in Southern China
5.7 Magnitude Quake in Southern China.caption_short: The mountainous topography of southern China reveals something of the tectonic forces that generate strong earthquakes such as one that occurred on July 9, 2009.

Fires Stretch Across Central Africa.title: Fires Stretch Across Central Africa
Fires Stretch Across Central Africa.caption_short: This image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite from July 8, 2009, shows thick smoke from hundreds of fires burning in central Africa.

Successful Launch of GOES-O (GOES-14).title: Successful Launch of GOES-O (GOES-14)
Successful Launch of GOES-O (GOES-14).caption_short: This ground-based photograph shows the GOES-O-bearing Delta IV rocket lifting off from Launch Complex 27 at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station on June 27, 2009.

Dust Storm over Iran.title: Dust Storm over Iran
Dust Storm over Iran.caption_short: This true-color image shows a large cloud of dust over northwestern Iran on July 7, 2009.

Intense Rain Floods China and Vietnam.title: Intense Rain Floods China and Vietnam
Intense Rain Floods China and Vietnam.caption_short: A broad swath of usually intense rainfall covers flooded regions in southern China and northern Vietnam in this rainfall anomaly image.

Dust Plumes off the West Coast of Africa.title: Dust Plumes off the West Coast of Africa
Dust Plumes off the West Coast of Africa.caption_short: Large, translucent dust plumes blow westward off the African coast and over the Atlantic ocean in this true-color image from June 4, 2009.

Big Thomson Mesa, Capitol Reef National.title: Big Thomson Mesa, Capitol Reef National Park, Utah
Big Thomson Mesa, Capitol Reef National.caption_short: One hundred million years of rock formation are visible in exposed layers at Waterpocket Fold in Capital Reef National Park. This astronaut photo from June 14, 2009, shows the layered, multi-colored rock formations.

Eruption of Sarychev Peak, Kuril Islands.title: Eruption of Sarychev Peak, Kuril Islands
Eruption of Sarychev Peak, Kuril Islands.caption_short: A pair of before-and-after images shows how the June 2009 eruption of Sarychev Peak Volcano transformed Matua Island.

Dust Accelerates Snow Melt in San Juan M.title: Dust Accelerates Snow Melt in San Juan Mountains
Dust Accelerates Snow Melt in San Juan M.caption_short: True-color images of the San Juan Mountains in southwestern Colorado show a dramatic difference in snow appearance between 2008 and 2009. In 2009, dust has colored the snow dull brown and accelerated snow melt.

Himalayan Topography.title: Himalayan Topography
Himalayan Topography.caption_short: The towering peaks of the Himalaya Mountains provide an illustration of a new satellite-derived topographic model.

Atlantic Ocean Temperatures at End of Ju.title: Atlantic Ocean Temperatures at End of June 2009
Atlantic Ocean Temperatures at End of Ju.caption_short: This image of ocean temperatures on June 30, 2009, shows why storms that form in the early part of the Atlantic hurricane season tend to happen in the Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean Sea.

Yellowstone Recovers from 1988 Fires.title: Yellowstone Recovers from 1988 Fires
Yellowstone Recovers from 1988 Fires.caption_short: In 1988, wildfires raced through Yellowstone National Park, consuming hundreds of thousands of acres. This series of Landsat images tracks the landscape’s slow recovery through 2008.

Dust Storm over the Aral Sea.title: Dust Storm over the Aral Sea

September Smoke Over the Amazon from 200.title: September Smoke Over the Amazon from 2005-2008
September Smoke Over the Amazon from 200.caption_short: This series of images shows aerosols (particles in the air) over the Amazon each September, the peak of the fire seasons, from 2005 through 2008. The amount of aerosols was unusually high in 2007, and unusually low in 2008.

Dust Plumes over Turkey.title: Dust Plumes over Turkey
Dust Plumes over Turkey.caption_short: This true-color image shows dust plumes hovering over Turkey on June 27, 2009. A faint haze of dust also appears over western Iran.

Mount Fuji, Japan.title: Mount Fuji, Japan
Mount Fuji, Japan.caption_short: The snow-covered southeastern flank of Mount Fuji Volcano appears in this astronaut photograph from April 8, 2009.

Glacier National Park, Canada.title: Glacier National Park, Canada
Glacier National Park, Canada.caption_short: This true-color image of Glacier National Park in Canada, acquired in September 2001, shows a landscape of lush vegetation alternating with snow-capped peaks.

Saharan Dust Reaches Across Atlantic Oce.title: Saharan Dust Reaches Across Atlantic Ocean
Saharan Dust Reaches Across Atlantic Oce.caption_short: In this photo-like image collected over three consecutive satellite overpasses, a thick plume of dust stretches hundreds of kilometers from its origins in Africa’s Sahara Desert to the Lesser Antilles Islands on the eastern edge of the Caribbean Sea.

Tropical Storm Nangka.title: Tropical Storm Nangka
Tropical Storm Nangka.caption_short: Tropical Storm Nangka passed through the Philippines in late June 2009, bringing floods, landslides, and tornadoes.

Tropical Storm Andres Briefly Becomes Hu.title: Tropical Storm Andres Briefly Becomes Hurricane
Tropical Storm Andres Briefly Becomes Hu.caption_short: This pair of photo-like images shows Tropical Storm Andres on June 23, over the time the storm intensified from tropical storm to hurricane strength.

NASA Radar Provides 3-D View of San Andr.title: NASA Radar Provides 3-D View of San Andreas Fault
NASA Radar Provides 3-D View of San Andr.caption_short: Where the Pacific plate and North American plate meet, the intense pressure of the collision creates an 800-mile-long fracture zone.

Sarychev Peak Eruption, Kuril Islands.title: Sarychev Peak Eruption, Kuril Islands
Sarychev Peak Eruption, Kuril Islands.caption_short: A fortuitous orbit of the International Space Station in 2009 offered the astronauts a striking view of the volcano in an early stage of eruption.

Lake Eyre Filling Peaks.title: Lake Eyre Filling Peaks
Lake Eyre Filling Peaks.caption_short: By mid-June 2009, the rare filling of this lake in Australia’s Simpson Desert appeared to have reached its peak.

To the Moon! Lunar Missions Successfully.title: To the Moon! Lunar Missions Successfully Launch
To the Moon! Lunar Missions Successfully.caption_short: After waiting out a thunderstorm, NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter and Lunar Crater Observation and Sensing Satellite rocketed off the launch pad at Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida, at 5:32 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time on June 18, 2009. This photograph captures the pair of spacecraft as they were lifting off.

Landslide in Southern China.title: Landslide in Southern China
Landslide in Southern China.caption_short: On June 5, 2009, a mountainside collapsed in the Chingqing region of southern China, burying dozens of people. The landslide remained visible in satellite imagery nearly two weeks later.

Ash Plume Overlying Clouds at Sarychev P.title: Ash Plume Overlying Clouds at Sarychev Peak
Ash Plume Overlying Clouds at Sarychev P.caption_short: On June 18, 2009, Sarychev Peak produced a plume that was barely visible amid the cloud cover over the Sea of Okhotsk.

Fires in Australia&rsquo;s Kakadu Nation.title: Fires in Australia’s Kakadu National Park
Fires in Australia&rsquo;s Kakadu Nation.caption_short: Numerous fires were burning in Kakadu National Park on June 10, 2009, when the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Aqua satellite captured this image of Northern Territory, Australia.

Sarychev Eruption Generates Large Cloud.title: Sarychev Eruption Generates Large Cloud of Sulfur Dioxide
Sarychev Eruption Generates Large Cloud.caption_short: A large cloud of sulfur dioxide stretched across the Northern Pacific Ocean following the eruption of Sarychev Peak Volcano in mid-June 2009.

Dust Storm along the Iranian Coast.title: Dust Storm along the Iranian Coast
Dust Storm along the Iranian Coast.caption_short: This photo-like image shows a gray-beige dust plume blowing along the Iranian coast over the Gulf of Oman on June 17, 2009.

Fogo, Cape Verde Islands.title: Fogo, Cape Verde Islands
Fogo, Cape Verde Islands.caption_short: The volcano was almost continuously active from the 1500s until 1760.

Ash and Steam from Sarychev Peak.title: Ash and Steam from Sarychev Peak
Ash and Steam from Sarychev Peak.caption_short: A true-color MODIS image shows water vapor and volcanic ash erupting from Sarychev Peak and forming a counter-clockwise arc over the Sea of Okhotsk on June 16, 2009.

Sarychev Peak Plume Crosses Sea of Okhot.title: Sarychev Peak Plume Crosses Sea of Okhotsk
Sarychev Peak Plume Crosses Sea of Okhot.caption_short: This true-color MODIS image shows ash plumes from Sarychev Peak blowing across the Sea of Okhotsk and the island of Sakhalin.

Ash Eruptions from Sarychev Peak, Kuril.title: Ash Eruptions from Sarychev Peak, Kuril Islands
Ash Eruptions from Sarychev Peak, Kuril.caption_short: This series of images shows morning and afternoon views of the ash clouds from Sarychev Volcano on June 14 and 15, 2009.

Ash Plumes at Sarychev Peak.title: Ash Plumes at Sarychev Peak
Ash Plumes at Sarychev Peak.caption_short: A true-color image of Sarychev Peak on June 15, 2009, shows remnants of older ash plumes and a new eruption from the volcano.

Saint Helena Island.title: Saint Helena Island
Saint Helena Island.caption_short: This astronaut photo shows the sharp peaks and deep ravines of Saint Helena Island, in the remote South Atlantic Ocean.

Ash Plume from Sarychev Peak.title: Ash Plume from Sarychev Peak
Ash Plume from Sarychev Peak.caption_short: This true-color image of the plume from Sarychev Peak on June 14, 2009, shows intense volcanic ash concentrations west of the volcano, and ash spreading both east and west of the summit.

The Very Large Array, New Mexico.title: The Very Large Array, New Mexico
The Very Large Array, New Mexico.caption_short: The Cibola National Forest surrounds the Plains of San Augustine in a remote and sparsely populated region of New Mexico.  the plains are home to one of the world’s premier astronomical radio observatories, the Very Large Array (VLA).

Continuing Activity at Sarychev Peak.title: Continuing Activity at Sarychev Peak
Continuing Activity at Sarychev Peak.caption_short: A true-color image from June 13, 2004, shows a high-profile ash plume from Sarychev Peak casting a large shadow to the north.

Drought in Iraq.title: Drought in Iraq
Drought in Iraq.caption_short: One of the worst droughts in the past decade settled heavily over the Fertile Crescent region of Iraq and Syria in the winter of 2007-2008. Under normal conditions, winter rain and rivers flowing from the mountains of Turkey sustain the rich agricultural land that has fed humanity from the dawn of civilization. But little to no rain fell between October and December during the crucial planting period, and sparse rain fell in the months that followed, said the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Foreign Agricultural Service (FAS).

Activity at Sarychev Peak.title: Activity at Sarychev Peak
Activity at Sarychev Peak.caption_short: True-color images of the Central Kuril Islands show ash plumes from Sarychev Peak hovering over a blanket of clouds in early June 2009, and a clear-sky view of the same region acquired a month earlier.

Crop Recovery in Afghanistan.title: Crop Recovery in Afghanistan
Crop Recovery in Afghanistan.caption_short: A vegetation index image shows areas of above-average crop growth in northern Afghanistan, following beneficial rains in March and April 2009.

Spring Bloom Colors the Pacific Near Hok.title: Spring Bloom Colors the Pacific Near Hokkaido
Spring Bloom Colors the Pacific Near Hok.caption_short: Southeast of Hokkaido, where two ocean currents converge, swirls of phytoplankton color the Pacific green and blue.

Mars and Earth: Columnar Jointing.title: Mars and Earth: Columnar Jointing
Mars and Earth: Columnar Jointing.caption_short: Although Mars is in many ways quite different from Earth—smaller, colder, drier, and hostile to life—the geology of the two worlds is sometimes quite similar. Columnar jointing—a distinctive pattern of hexagonal cracks—is visible in rocks on both planets.

Gishwati Forest, Rwanda.title: Gishwati Forest, Rwanda
Gishwati Forest, Rwanda.caption_short: Gishwati Forest suffered severe deforestation, evident in these true-color images.

Tornadoes in Northeastern Colorado.title: Tornadoes in Northeastern Colorado
Tornadoes in Northeastern Colorado.caption_short: A black-and-white GOES image shows two cloud banks immediately north of Denver, Colorado.

Goreme National Park, Turkey.title: Goreme National Park, Turkey
Goreme National Park, Turkey.caption_short: This true-color image shows Cappadocia in central Turkey, a high, arid plateau. Varied earth tones in the region are punctuated by the deep green of vegetation-lined waterways and crops.

Global Biosphere.title: Global Biosphere
Global Biosphere.caption_short: The sum of Earth's plants, on land and in the ocean, changes slightly from year to year as weather patterns shift. This pair of images contrasts average plant growth in 2002 to growth in 2008, revealing small interannual changes.

Scientists Locate Penguins by What They.title: Scientists Locate Penguins by What They Leave Behind
Scientists Locate Penguins by What They.caption_short: A guano stain betrays the location of an emperor penguin colony on Antarctic ice in this Landsat image from December 4, 2002.

Kamchatka Peninsula.title: Kamchatka Peninsula
Kamchatka Peninsula.caption_short: Clouds hugged the east coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula while skies inland remained clear at the end of May 2009.

Democracy Bridge Damaged by Earthquake.title: Democracy Bridge Damaged by Earthquake
Democracy Bridge Damaged by Earthquake.caption_short: The day after a powerful 7.3-magnitude earthquake shook Honduras, Taiwan’s Formosat-2 satellite captured this detailed, photo-like image showing the collapsed span of the earthquake-damaged Democracy bridge.

Antarctic Ozone Hole: 1979 to 2008.title: Antarctic Ozone Hole: 1979 to 2008
Antarctic Ozone Hole: 1979 to 2008.caption_short: In 1979, Antarctic ozone levels dropped below 200 Dobson Units for the first time on record. This threshold became the standard for defining the ozone hole. In 2008, minimum ozone levels dropped to 100 Dobson Units on October 4.

Dust Plume off the Libyan Coast.title: Dust Plume off the Libyan Coast
Dust Plume off the Libyan Coast.caption_short: This true-color image from May 31, 2009, shows a dust plume blowing off the Libyan coast toward the northwest, spreading out slightly over the Mediterranean Sea.

Solar Evaporation Ponds, Atacama Desert.title: Solar Evaporation Ponds, Atacama Desert
Solar Evaporation Ponds, Atacama Desert.caption_short: Brightly colored solar evaporation (salt) ponds in the Atacama Desert give this astronaut photo  an unreal quality.

Yosemite National Park.title: Yosemite National Park
Yosemite National Park.caption_short: Naked summits alternate with forested lowlands in Yosemite Valley in this image acquired on August 18, 2001.

7.3-Magnitude Quake off the Honduras Coa.title: 7.3-Magnitude Quake off the Honduras Coast
7.3-Magnitude Quake off the Honduras Coa.caption_short: This image shows the topography and bathymetry of the region surrounding the earthquakes that occurred on May 28-29, 2009. Red circles indicate quake locations, and fine black lines indicate fault lines.

Floods from Cyclone Aila in India and Ba.title: Floods from Cyclone Aila in India and Bangladesh
Floods from Cyclone Aila in India and Ba.caption_short: This pair of images shows flooding in India and Bangladesh on May 28, 2009, following the landfall of Cyclone Aila.

Cyclone Aila.title: Cyclone Aila
Cyclone Aila.caption_short: Aila almost completely fills this true-color image from May 25, 2009. The storm stretches from the Bay of Bengal deep into India, Bangladesh, and Burma (Myanmar).

Fires and Deforestation on the Amazon Fr.title: Fires and Deforestation on the Amazon Frontier, Rondonia, Brazil
Fires and Deforestation on the Amazon Fr.caption_short: In 2007, the Amazon fire season was the worst of this decade. This pair of images shows deforestation and the smoke from intense fires in the 2007 dry season in northwest Rondônia, Brazil.

Dust Plumes over India and Pakistan.title: Dust Plumes over India and Pakistan
Dust Plumes over India and Pakistan.caption_short: Dust plumes form semicircles and swirls along the border of India and Pakistan on May 25, 2009. The dust has likely arisen from a sand sea straddling the border.

Rare Cyclonic Storm over Nothern Argenti.title: Rare Cyclonic Storm over Nothern Argentina
Rare Cyclonic Storm over Nothern Argenti.caption_short: This image shows a rare cyclonic storm organized over Argentina and Paraguay on May 21, 2009.

Salar del Hombre Muerto, Argentina.title: Salar del Hombre Muerto, Argentina
Salar del Hombre Muerto, Argentina.caption_short: Brilliant white in this true-color image, Argentina's Salar del Hombre Muerto is a high-altitude salt pan rich in minerals such as lithium.

Circles in Thin Ice, Lake Baikal, Russia.title: Circles in Thin Ice, Lake Baikal, Russia
Circles in Thin Ice, Lake Baikal, Russia.caption_short: A strange circular area of thinned ice appears in this astronaut photo from late April 2009 of Lake Baikal in southern Siberia.

Rare Refill of Lake Eyre, Australia&rsqu.title: Rare Refill of Lake Eyre, Australia’s Simpson Desert
Rare Refill of Lake Eyre, Australia&rsqu.caption_short: Muddy brown water spreads into Australia's Lake Eyre through a triangular delta in this natural-color Landsat image from May 9, 2009. The water transformed the dry basin into a vast inland sea where flocks of birds gathered to breed.

South Pole Sea Ice at 2008 Maximum and 2.title: South Pole Sea Ice at 2008 Maximum and 2009 Minimum
South Pole Sea Ice at 2008 Maximum and 2.caption_short: This pair of images shows Antarctic sea ice concentrations at the 2008 winter maximum and the 2009 summer minimum compared to the median ice extent from 1979–2000.

Smoke Plume near Japan.title: Smoke Plume near Japan
Smoke Plume near Japan.caption_short: Translucent blue-gray smoke streaks diagonally over the Kuril Islands while blue-green phytoplankton form swirls in the ocean south of Hokkaido on May 21, 2009.

Fires in Russia and Mongolia.title: Fires in Russia and Mongolia
Fires in Russia and Mongolia.caption_short: Large, smoky fires were burning in the forested mountains of Russia’s Buryatia region and Mongolia’s Belenge province on May 21, 2009.

Hawaiian Vog Photographed from Space Shu.title: Hawaiian Vog Photographed from Space Shuttle
Hawaiian Vog Photographed from Space Shu.caption_short: This image, taken by the crew of Space Shuttle Atlantis shows volcanic plumes from Kilauea rising up from three locations: Halema‘uma‘u Crater, Pu‘u ‘O‘o Crater, and from along the coastline where lava flows from the East Rift zone were entering the ocean.

The Ozone Layer If CFCs Hadn&rsquo;t Bee.title: The Ozone Layer If CFCs Hadn’t Been Banned
The Ozone Layer If CFCs Hadn&rsquo;t Bee.caption_short: These images show computer predictions of what would have happened to the ozone layer over the  mid-latitudes of the Western Hemisphere if CFCs had not been banned by the Montreal Protocol.

Dust Over the Aral Sea.title: Dust Over the Aral Sea
Dust Over the Aral Sea.caption_short: This NASA satellite image of the Aral Sea from May 3, 2009, shows one of the dangerous consequences of declining water levels: frequent dust storms.

Heavy Rain Floods Brazil.title: Heavy Rain Floods Brazil
Heavy Rain Floods Brazil.caption_short: The contrast of current rainfall with average rainfall in this anomaly image reveals just how intense flood-inducing rains were in northern Brazil in April and May 2009.

Smoke over Northeastern China.title: Smoke over Northeastern China
Smoke over Northeastern China.caption_short: Blue-gray smoke plumes over Mongolia form diagonal lines running from northwest to southeast in this true-color image from May 18, 2009.

Mauna Kea.title: Mauna Kea
Mauna Kea.caption_short: A detailed astronaut photograph shows pyroclastic deposits on Hawaii’s Muana Kea Volcano.

Komodo National Park, Indonesia.title: Komodo National Park, Indonesia
Komodo National Park, Indonesia.caption_short: This image shows the islands of Komodo National Park in the Lesser Sunda Islands, on July 20, 2000.

Arctic Sea Ice, 2002-2003.title: Arctic Sea Ice, 2002-2003
Arctic Sea Ice, 2002-2003.caption_short: Compiled from passive microwave sensor data, these images show Arctic sea ice extent for September 2002 and March 2003.

Jesusita Fire, California.title: Jesusita Fire, California
Jesusita Fire, California.caption_short: Acquired on May 8, 2009, this true-color image shows fire locations and smoke plumes from the Jesusita Fire near Santa Barbara, California.

Dust Storm over Sudan and Ethiopia.title: Dust Storm over Sudan and Ethiopia
Dust Storm over Sudan and Ethiopia.caption_short: Opaque dust fills the skies over central Sudan on May 11, 2009, and spreads into neighboring countries to the east. Along the eastern edge of the dust plume, relatively clear skies prevail.

Lake Powell, Utah.title: Lake Powell, Utah
Lake Powell, Utah.caption_short: In the early twenty-first century, Lake Powell faced the combined threats of drought and rapid water withdrawals.

Typhoons Chan Hom and Kujira soak Luzon.title: Typhoons Chan Hom and Kujira soak Luzon
Typhoons Chan Hom and Kujira soak Luzon.caption_short: Patches of intense rain follow the track of two tropical cyclones in this rainfall image of the Philippines from May 2009.

Jesusita Fire Burn Scar.title: Jesusita Fire Burn Scar
Jesusita Fire Burn Scar.caption_short: This natural-color image from May 10, 2009, shows the northern part of the area burned by the Jesusita Fire, in the Los Padres National Forest north of Santa Barbara, California.

Ankara, Turkey.title: Ankara, Turkey
Ankara, Turkey.caption_short: The distinctive red brick roof tiles of buildings in Ankara, Turkey, are the most striking feature in this astronaut photo from April 11, 2009.

Joggins Cliffs, Nova Scotia.title: Joggins Cliffs, Nova Scotia
Joggins Cliffs, Nova Scotia.caption_short: This true-color image shows the Joggins Fossil Cliffs and nearby Cumberland Basin.

2008-2009 Winter Land Surface Temperatur.title: 2008-2009 Winter Land Surface Temperature Anomalies
2008-2009 Winter Land Surface Temperatur.caption_short: This land surface temperature anomaly map spans the three months of meteorological winter: December 2008-February 2009.

Dust Plumes over the Middle East and Eur.title: Dust Plumes over the Middle East and Europe
Dust Plumes over the Middle East and Eur.caption_short: Thick dust plumes blow eastward out of Syria and change direction over Iraq, some blowing south toward Saudi Arabia and some blowing north toward Turkey.

View of Earth from MESSENGER.title: View of Earth from MESSENGER
View of Earth from MESSENGER.caption_short: This image of Earth was captured by the MESSENGER spacecraft during a flyby of our home planet on August 2, 2005. Parts of South and North America were in view.

Redoubt Volcano Stirs.title: Redoubt Volcano Stirs
Redoubt Volcano Stirs.caption_short: A plume of ash extended south from Alaska’s Mount Redoubt following a large eruption on March 26, 2009.

Reclaiming Mesopotamia&rsquo;s Marshes.title: Reclaiming Mesopotamia’s Marshes
Reclaiming Mesopotamia&rsquo;s Marshes.caption_short: A pair of natural-color images documents dramatic changes in Mesopotamian wetlands between 2002 and 2007.

Coral Reefs in the Persian Gulf.title: Coral Reefs in the Persian Gulf
Coral Reefs in the Persian Gulf.caption_short: Coral reefs fringe the shoreline and islands of the United Arab Emirates in this Landsat image.

Dust Plumes off Pakistan and Iran.title: Dust Plumes off Pakistan and Iran
Dust Plumes off Pakistan and Iran.caption_short: This true-color image shows dust plumes of varying thickness blowing off the coasts of Iran and (especially) Pakistan on May 4, 2009.

Dalmatian Coastline near Split, Croatia.title: Dalmatian Coastline near Split, Croatia
Dalmatian Coastline near Split, Croatia.caption_short: This astronaut photo from April 9, 2009, shows the Dalmatian coastline of the Adriatic Sea around Split, Croatia.

Henrietta Island, Russia.title: Henrietta Island, Russia
Henrietta Island, Russia.caption_short: This natural-color image shows Henrietta Island, with a smooth, dome-capped surface and a rugged coastline, illuminated by low-angled sunlight.

Cyclonic Clouds over the South Atlantic.title: Cyclonic Clouds over the South Atlantic Ocean
Cyclonic Clouds over the South Atlantic.caption_short: The gracefully swirling clouds that sweep over hundreds of kilometers in this photo-like image are beautiful, but they were likely bringing heavy snow and strong winds to ships in the South Atlantic Ocean on April 29, 2009.

Sunspots on April 29, 2009.title: Sunspots on April 29, 2009
Sunspots on April 29, 2009.caption_short: This pair of images from the Solar and Heliospheric Observatory (SOHO) spacecraft shows sunspots and ultraviolet light emitted by the Sun on April 29, 2009.

Kalahari and Okavango Delta.title: Kalahari and Okavango Delta
Kalahari and Okavango Delta.caption_short: The Kalahari Basin in southern Africa experiences dramatic differences in vegetation greenness between the the dry and wet seasons. In the dry season, only the inland Okavango Delta remains lush.

Dust Plume off Libya.title: Dust Plume off Libya
Dust Plume off Libya.caption_short: A dust plume blew off the coast of Libya in early February 2009.

Agricultural Fires in Western Russia.title: Agricultural Fires in Western Russia
Agricultural Fires in Western Russia.caption_short: Winter lingered to the north, but in west-central Russia, spring burning was underway on April 24, 2009.

Urbanization of Dubai.title: Urbanization of Dubai
Urbanization of Dubai.caption_short: This development of Palm Jumeirah is one of the world’s most conspicuous examples of engineered coastlines.

Eruption on Isla Fernandina.title: Eruption on Isla Fernandina
Eruption on Isla Fernandina.caption_short: La Cumbre Volcano on Isla Fernandina remained active on April 12, 2009, with a diffuse plume blowing toward the southwest.

Tuzla Valley Coal Mines, Bosnia and Herz.title: Tuzla Valley Coal Mines, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Tuzla Valley Coal Mines, Bosnia and Herz.caption_short: Surface mines and fly-ash deposits in the Tuzla Basin reveal the region’ long history as a coal-production hub for Bosnia and Herzegovina. This image of the altered landscape was captured on September 21, 2003.

Red River Floods, North Dakota and Minne.title: Red River Floods, North Dakota and Minnesota
Red River Floods, North Dakota and Minne.caption_short: A second round of spring flooding on the Red River was captured in an astronaut photo from April 9, 2009.

Ashgabat, Turkmenistan.title: Ashgabat, Turkmenistan
Ashgabat, Turkmenistan.caption_short: This true-color image shows the city of Ashgabat, turkmenistan, and its arid surroundings on September 11, 2001.

Band-e-Amir National Park, Afghanistan.title: Band-e-Amir National Park, Afghanistan
Band-e-Amir National Park, Afghanistan.caption_short: Rugged mountains and towering cliffs surround the deep blue waters of the chain of lakes at the heart of Afghanistan’s new national park, Band-e-Amir.

Fires along the South Carolina Coast.title: Fires along the South Carolina Coast
Fires along the South Carolina Coast.caption_short: This true-color image shows wildfires along the South Carolina coast (delineated by red outlines) and a smoke plume blowing toward the east-southeast.

Eruption from Llaima Volcano, Chile.title: Eruption from Llaima Volcano, Chile
Eruption from Llaima Volcano, Chile.caption_short: A MODIS image shows a faint plume blowing from Llaima Volcano toward the east-southeast.

Aerosols over Beijing.title: Aerosols over Beijing
Aerosols over Beijing.caption_short: Beijing suffers from severe air pollution. The air quality in Beijing is determined by its geography, weather conditions, and anthropogenic emissions.

Sea Ice Ebbs and Flows.title: Sea Ice Ebbs and Flows
Sea Ice Ebbs and Flows.caption_short: These satellite-based maps show sea ice concentration in the Arctic and Antarctic during September 2008 and February 2009, the months of the sea ice maximums and minimums in the respective hemispheres.

Deadly Flooding in Namibia.title: Deadly Flooding in Namibia
Deadly Flooding in Namibia.caption_short: This pair of images illustrates the dramatic flooding of the Zambezi River in Namibia in late March 2009.

Tropical Storm Bijli.title: Tropical Storm Bijli
Tropical Storm Bijli.caption_short: This image shows the rainfall associated with Tropical Cyclone Bijli as observed by the TRMM satellite.

Mount Nemrut, Turkey.title: Mount Nemrut, Turkey
Mount Nemrut, Turkey.caption_short: Winter snow blankets the 2,948-meter (9,672-foot) summit of Turkey’s Mount Nemrut Volcano in this astronaut photograph from December 3, 2008.

Wilkins Ice Bridge Collapse.title: Wilkins Ice Bridge Collapse
Wilkins Ice Bridge Collapse.caption_short: A narrow ice bridge connecting Charcot Island and Latady Island broke apart in April 2009.

Cyclone Bijli.title: Cyclone Bijli
Cyclone Bijli.caption_short: A ragged-looking Tropical Storm Bijli draped the east coast of India in this image from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA’s Terra satellite on April 16, 2009

Grand Turk and Salt Cay Islands.title: Grand Turk and Salt Cay Islands
Grand Turk and Salt Cay Islands.caption_short: This approximately true-color image shows part of the Turks and Caicos Islands archipelago, observed September 18, 2001.

Floods on the Red River.title: Floods on the Red River
Floods on the Red River.caption_short: This photo-like image shows extensive flooding on the Red River near Fargo, North Dakota, on March 28, 2009 as the river reached a record high of 40.82 feet.

Dust Storm in Southeastern Australia.title: Dust Storm in Southeastern Australia
Dust Storm in Southeastern Australia.caption_short: This true-color image shows dust plumes blowing over New South Wales, west of Canberra.

Sulfur Dioxide Plume from Isla Fernandin.title: Sulfur Dioxide Plume from Isla Fernandina
Sulfur Dioxide Plume from Isla Fernandin.caption_short: A combination of two satellite overpasses tracks the movement of sulfur dioxide westward from Isla Fernandina on April 14, 2009.

Musandam Peninsula, Oman.title: Musandam Peninsula, Oman
Musandam Peninsula, Oman.caption_short: The rocky, fjord-like fingers of the Musandam Peninsula jut into the narrow Strait of Hormuz at the mouth of the Persian Gulf in this detailed image from the Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer on NASA's Terra satellite.
